content: 1 In the thirtieth year, on the fifth day of the fourth month, when I was in the community of exiles by the Chebar Canal, the heavens opened and I saw visions of God.
content_old: 1 In the thirtieth year, on the fifth day of the fourth month, when I was in the community of exiles by the Chebar Canal, the heavens opened and I saw visions of God.

content: 2 On the fifth day of the month—it was the fifth year of the exile of King Jehoiachin—
content_old: 2 On the fifth day of the month—it was the fifth year of the exile of King Jehoiachin—

content: 3 the word of the LORD came to the priest Ezekiel son of Buzi, by the Chebar Canal, in the land of the Chaldeans. And the hand of the LORD came upon him there.
content_old: 3 the word of the LORD came to the priest Ezekiel son of Buzi, by the Chebar Canal, in the land of the Chaldeans. And the hand of the LORD came upon him there.

content: 4 I looked, and lo, a stormy wind came sweeping out of the north—a huge cloud and flashing fire, surrounded by a radiance; and in the center of it, in the center of the fire, a gleam as of amber.
content_old: 4 I looked, and lo, a stormy wind came sweeping out of the north—a huge cloud and flashing fire, surrounded by a radiance; and in the center of it, in the center of the fire, a gleam as of amber.

content: 5 In the center of it were also the figures of four creatures. And this was their appearance: They had the figures of human beings.
content_old: 5 In the center of it were also the figures of four creatures. And this was their appearance: They had the figures of human beings.

content: 6 However, each had four faces, and each of them had four wings;
content_old: 6 However, each had four faces, and each of them had four wings;

content: 7 the legs of each were a single rigid leg, and the feet of each were like a single calf’s hoof; and their sparkle was like the luster of burnished bronze.
content_old: 7 the legs of each were a single rigid leg, and the feet of each were like a single calf’s hoof; and their sparkle was like the luster of burnished bronze.

content: 8 They had human hands below their wings. The four of them had their faces and their wings on their four sides.
content_old: 8 They had human hands below their wings. The four of them had their faces and their wings on their four sides.

content: 9 Each one’s wings touched those of the other. They did not turn when they moved; each could move in the direction of any of its faces.
content_old: 9 Each one’s wings touched those of the other. They did not turn when they moved; each could move in the direction of any of its faces.

content: 10 Each of them had a human face each of the four had the face of a lion on the right; each of the four had the face of an ox on the left; and each of the four had the face of an eagle.
content_old: 10 Each of them had a human face each of the four had the face of a lion on the right; each of the four had the face of an ox on the left; and each of the four had the face of an eagle.

content: 11 Such were their faces. As for their wings, they were separated: above, each had two touching those of the others, while the other two covered its body.
content_old: 11 Such were their faces. As for their wings, they were separated: above, each had two touching those of the others, while the other two covered its body.

content: 12 And each could move in the direction of any of its faces; they went wherever the spirit impelled them to go, without turning when they moved.
content_old: 12 And each could move in the direction of any of its faces; they went wherever the spirit impelled them to go, without turning when they moved.

content: 13 Such then was the appearance of the creatures. With them was something that looked like burning coals of fire. This fire, suggestive of torches, kept moving about among the creatures; the fire had a radiance, and lightning issued from the fire.
content_old: 13 Such then was the appearance of the creatures. With them was something that looked like burning coals of fire. This fire, suggestive of torches, kept moving about among the creatures; the fire had a radiance, and lightning issued from the fire.

content: 14 Dashing to and fro the creatures was something that looked like flares.
content_old: 14 Dashing to and fro the creatures was something that looked like flares.

content: 15 As I gazed on the creatures, I saw one wheel on the ground next to each of the four-faced creatures.
content_old: 15 As I gazed on the creatures, I saw one wheel on the ground next to each of the four-faced creatures.

content: 16 As for the appearance and structure of the wheels, they gleamed like beryl. All four had the same form; the appearance and structure of each was as of two wheels cutting through each other.
content_old: 16 As for the appearance and structure of the wheels, they gleamed like beryl. All four had the same form; the appearance and structure of each was as of two wheels cutting through each other.

content: 17 And when they moved, each could move in the direction of any of its four quarters; they did not veer when they moved.
content_old: 17 And when they moved, each could move in the direction of any of its four quarters; they did not veer when they moved.

content: 18 Their rims were tall and frightening, for the rims of all four were covered all over with eyes.
content_old: 18 Their rims were tall and frightening, for the rims of all four were covered all over with eyes.

content: 19 And when the creatures moved forward, the wheels moved at their sides; and when the creatures were borne above the earth, the wheels were borne too.
content_old: 19 And when the creatures moved forward, the wheels moved at their sides; and when the creatures were borne above the earth, the wheels were borne too.

content: 20 Wherever the spirit impelled them to go, they went—wherever the spirit impelled them—and the wheels were borne alongside them; for the spirit of the creatures was in the wheels.
content_old: 20 Wherever the spirit impelled them to go, they went—wherever the spirit impelled them—and the wheels were borne alongside them; for the spirit of the creatures was in the wheels.

content: 21 When those moved, these moved; and when those stood still, these stood still; and when those were borne above the earth, the wheels were borne alongside them—for the spirit of the creatures was in the wheels.
content_old: 21 When those moved, these moved; and when those stood still, these stood still; and when those were borne above the earth, the wheels were borne alongside them—for the spirit of the creatures was in the wheels.

content: 22 Above the heads of the creatures was a form: an expanse, with an awe-inspiring gleam as of crystal, was spread out above their heads.
content_old: 22 Above the heads of the creatures was a form: an expanse, with an awe-inspiring gleam as of crystal, was spread out above their heads.

content: 23 Under the expanse, each had one pair of wings extended toward those of the others; and each had another pair covering its body.
content_old: 23 Under the expanse, each had one pair of wings extended toward those of the others; and each had another pair covering its body.

content: 24 When they moved, I could hear the sound of their wings like the sound of mighty waters, like the sound of Shaddai, a tumult like the din of an army. When they stood still, they would let their wings droop.
content_old: 24 When they moved, I could hear the sound of their wings like the sound of mighty waters, like the sound of Shaddai, a tumult like the din of an army. When they stood still, they would let their wings droop.

content: 25 From above the expanse over their heads came a sound. When they stood still, they would let their wings droop.
content_old: 25 From above the expanse over their heads came a sound. When they stood still, they would let their wings droop.

content: 26 Above the expanse over their heads was the semblance of a throne, in appearance like sapphire; and on top, upon this semblance of a throne, there was the semblance of a human form.
content_old: 26 Above the expanse over their heads was the semblance of a throne, in appearance like sapphire; and on top, upon this semblance of a throne, there was the semblance of a human form.

content: 27 From what appeared as his loins up, I saw a gleam as of amber—what looked like a fire encased in a frame; and from what appeared as his loins down, I saw what looked like fire. There was a radiance all about him.
content_old: 27 From what appeared as his loins up, I saw a gleam as of amber—what looked like a fire encased in a frame; and from what appeared as his loins down, I saw what looked like fire. There was a radiance all about him.

content: 1 And He said to me, “O mortal, stand up on your feet that I may speak to you.”
content_old: 1 And He said to me, “O mortal, stand up on your feet that I may speak to you.”

content: 2 As He spoke to me, a spirit entered into me and set me upon my feet; and I heard what was being spoken to me.
content_old: 2 As He spoke to me, a spirit entered into me and set me upon my feet; and I heard what was being spoken to me.

content: 3 He said to me, “O mortal, I am sending you to the people of Israel, that nation of rebels, who have rebelled against Me.—They as well as their fathers have defied Me to this very day;
content_old: 3 He said to me, “O mortal, I am sending you to the people of Israel, that nation of rebels, who have rebelled against Me.—They as well as their fathers have defied Me to this very day;

content: 4 for the sons are brazen of face and stubborn of heart. I send you to them, and you shall say to them: ‘Thus said the Lord GOD‘—
content_old: 4 for the sons are brazen of face and stubborn of heart. I send you to them, and you shall say to them: ‘Thus said the Lord GOD‘—

content: 5 whether they listen or not, for they are a rebellious breed—that they may know that there was a prophet among them.
content_old: 5 whether they listen or not, for they are a rebellious breed—that they may know that there was a prophet among them.

content: 6 “And you, mortal, do not fear them and do not fear their words, though thistles and thorns press against you, and you sit upon scorpions. Do not be afraid of their words and do not be dismayed by them, though they are a rebellious breed;
content_old: 6 “And you, mortal, do not fear them and do not fear their words, though thistles and thorns press against you, and you sit upon scorpions. Do not be afraid of their words and do not be dismayed by them, though they are a rebellious breed;

content: 7 but speak My words to them, whether they listen or not, for they are rebellious.
content_old: 7 but speak My words to them, whether they listen or not, for they are rebellious.

content: 8 “And you, mortal, heed what I say to you: Do not be rebellious like that rebellious breed. Open your mouth and eat what I am giving you.”
content_old: 8 “And you, mortal, heed what I say to you: Do not be rebellious like that rebellious breed. Open your mouth and eat what I am giving you.”

content: 9 As I looked, there was a hand stretched out to me, holding a written scroll.
content_old: 9 As I looked, there was a hand stretched out to me, holding a written scroll.

content: 1 He said to me, “Mortal, eat what is offered you; eat this scroll, and go speak to the House of Israel.”
content_old: 1 He said to me, “Mortal, eat what is offered you; eat this scroll, and go speak to the House of Israel.”

content: 2 So I opened my mouth, and He gave me this scroll to eat,
content_old: 2 So I opened my mouth, and He gave me this scroll to eat,

content: 3 as He said to me, “Mortal, feed your stomach and fill your belly with this scroll that I give you.” I ate it, and it tasted as sweet as honey to me.
content_old: 3 as He said to me, “Mortal, feed your stomach and fill your belly with this scroll that I give you.” I ate it, and it tasted as sweet as honey to me.

content: 4 Then He said to me, “Mortal, go to the House of Israel and repeat My very words to them.
content_old: 4 Then He said to me, “Mortal, go to the House of Israel and repeat My very words to them.

content: 5 For you are sent, not to a people of unintelligible speech and difficult language, but to the House of Israel—
content_old: 5 For you are sent, not to a people of unintelligible speech and difficult language, but to the House of Israel—

content: 6 not to the many peoples of unintelligible speech and difficult language, whose talk you cannot understand. If I sent you to them, they would listen to you.
content_old: 6 not to the many peoples of unintelligible speech and difficult language, whose talk you cannot understand. If I sent you to them, they would listen to you.

content: 7 But the House of Israel will refuse to listen to you, for they refuse to listen to Me; for the whole House of Israel are brazen of forehead and stubborn of heart.
content_old: 7 But the House of Israel will refuse to listen to you, for they refuse to listen to Me; for the whole House of Israel are brazen of forehead and stubborn of heart.

content: 8 But I will make your face as hard as theirs, and your forehead as brazen as theirs.
content_old: 8 But I will make your face as hard as theirs, and your forehead as brazen as theirs.

content: 9 I will make your forehead like adamant, harder than flint. Do not fear them, and do not be dismayed by them, though they are a rebellious breed.”
content_old: 9 I will make your forehead like adamant, harder than flint. Do not fear them, and do not be dismayed by them, though they are a rebellious breed.”

content: 10 Then He said to me: “Mortal, listen with your ears and receive into your mind all the words that I speak to you.
content_old: 10 Then He said to me: “Mortal, listen with your ears and receive into your mind all the words that I speak to you.

content: 11 Go to your people, the exile community, and speak to them. Say to them: Thus says the Lord GOD—whether they listen or not.”
content_old: 11 Go to your people, the exile community, and speak to them. Say to them: Thus says the Lord GOD—whether they listen or not.”

content: 12 Then a spirit carried me away, and behind me I heard a great roaring sound: “Blessed is the Presence of the LORD, in His place,”
content_old: 12 Then a spirit carried me away, and behind me I heard a great roaring sound: “Blessed is the Presence of the LORD, in His place,”

content: 13 with the sound of the wings of the creatures beating against one another, and the sound of the wheels beside them—a great roaring sound.
content_old: 13 with the sound of the wings of the creatures beating against one another, and the sound of the wheels beside them—a great roaring sound.

content: 14 A spirit seized me and carried me away. I went in bitterness, in the fury of my spirit, while the hand of the LORD was strong upon me.
content_old: 14 A spirit seized me and carried me away. I went in bitterness, in the fury of my spirit, while the hand of the LORD was strong upon me.

content: 15 And I came to the exile community that dwelt in Tel Abib by the Chebar Canal, and I remained where they dwelt. And for seven days I sat there stunned among them.
content_old: 15 And I came to the exile community that dwelt in Tel Abib by the Chebar Canal, and I remained where they dwelt. And for seven days I sat there stunned among them.

content: 16 After those seven days, the word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 16 After those seven days, the word of the LORD came to me:

content: 17 “O mortal, I appoint you watchman for the House of Israel; and when you hear a word from My mouth, you must warn them for Me.
content_old: 17 “O mortal, I appoint you watchman for the House of Israel; and when you hear a word from My mouth, you must warn them for Me.

content: 18 If I say to a wicked man, ‘You shall die,’ and you do not warn him—you do not speak to warn the wicked man of his wicked course in order to save his life—he, the wicked man, shall die for his iniquity, but I will require a reckoning for his blood from you.
content_old: 18 If I say to a wicked man, ‘You shall die,’ and you do not warn him—you do not speak to warn the wicked man of his wicked course in order to save his life—he, the wicked man, shall die for his iniquity, but I will require a reckoning for his blood from you.

content: 19 But if you do warn the wicked man, and he does not turn back from his wickedness and his wicked course, he shall die for his iniquity, but you will have saved your own life.
content_old: 19 But if you do warn the wicked man, and he does not turn back from his wickedness and his wicked course, he shall die for his iniquity, but you will have saved your own life.

content: 20 Again, if a righteous man abandons his righteousness and does wrong, when I put a stumbling block before him, he shall die. He shall die for his sins; the righteous deeds that he did shall not be remembered; but because you did not warn him, I will require a reckoning for his blood from you.
content_old: 20 Again, if a righteous man abandons his righteousness and does wrong, when I put a stumbling block before him, he shall die. He shall die for his sins; the righteous deeds that he did shall not be remembered; but because you did not warn him, I will require a reckoning for his blood from you.

content: 21 If, however, you warn the righteous man not to sin, and he, the righteous, does not sin, he shall live because he took warning, and you will have saved your own life.”
content_old: 21 If, however, you warn the righteous man not to sin, and he, the righteous, does not sin, he shall live because he took warning, and you will have saved your own life.”

content: 22 Then the hand of the LORD came upon me there, and He said to me, “Arise, go out to the valley, and there I will speak with you.”
content_old: 22 Then the hand of the LORD came upon me there, and He said to me, “Arise, go out to the valley, and there I will speak with you.”

content: 23 I arose and went out to the valley, and there stood the Presence of the LORD, like the Presence that I had seen at the Chebar Canal; and I flung myself down on my face.
content_old: 23 I arose and went out to the valley, and there stood the Presence of the LORD, like the Presence that I had seen at the Chebar Canal; and I flung myself down on my face.

content: 24 And a spirit entered into me and set me upon my feet. And He spoke to me, and said to me: “Go, shut yourself up in your house.
content_old: 24 And a spirit entered into me and set me upon my feet. And He spoke to me, and said to me: “Go, shut yourself up in your house.

content: 25 As for you, O mortal, cords have been placed upon you, and you have been bound with them, and you shall not go out among them.
content_old: 25 As for you, O mortal, cords have been placed upon you, and you have been bound with them, and you shall not go out among them.

content: 26 And I will make your tongue cleave to your palate, and you shall be dumb; you shall not be a reprover to them, for they are a rebellious breed.
content_old: 26 And I will make your tongue cleave to your palate, and you shall be dumb; you shall not be a reprover to them, for they are a rebellious breed.

content: 1 “And you, O mortal, take a brick and put it in front of you, and incise on it a city, Jerusalem.
content_old: 1 “And you, O mortal, take a brick and put it in front of you, and incise on it a city, Jerusalem.

content: 2 Set up a siege against it, and build towers against it, and cast a mound against it; pitch camps against it, and bring up battering rams roundabout it.
content_old: 2 Set up a siege against it, and build towers against it, and cast a mound against it; pitch camps against it, and bring up battering rams roundabout it.

content: 3 Then take an iron plate and place it as an iron wall between yourself and the city, and set your face against it. Thus it shall be under siege, you shall besiege it. This shall be an omen for the House of Israel.
content_old: 3 Then take an iron plate and place it as an iron wall between yourself and the city, and set your face against it. Thus it shall be under siege, you shall besiege it. This shall be an omen for the House of Israel.

content: 4 “Then lie on your left side, and let it bear the punishment of the House of Israel; for as many days as you lie on it you shall bear their punishment.
content_old: 4 “Then lie on your left side, and let it bear the punishment of the House of Israel; for as many days as you lie on it you shall bear their punishment.

content: 5 For I impose upon you three hundred and ninety days, corresponding to the number of the years of their punishment; and so you shall bear the punishment for the House of Israel.
content_old: 5 For I impose upon you three hundred and ninety days, corresponding to the number of the years of their punishment; and so you shall bear the punishment for the House of Israel.

content: 6 When you have completed these, you shall lie another forty days on your right side, and bear the punishment of the House of Judah. I impose on you one day for each year.
content_old: 6 When you have completed these, you shall lie another forty days on your right side, and bear the punishment of the House of Judah. I impose on you one day for each year.

content: 7 “Then, with bared arm, set your face toward besieged Jerusalem and prophesy against it.
content_old: 7 “Then, with bared arm, set your face toward besieged Jerusalem and prophesy against it.

content: 8 Now I put cords upon you, so that you cannot turn from side to side until you complete your days of siege.
content_old: 8 Now I put cords upon you, so that you cannot turn from side to side until you complete your days of siege.

content: 9 “Further, take wheat, barley, beans, lentils, millet, and emmer. Put them into one vessel and bake them into bread. Eat it as many days as you lie on your side: three hundred and ninety.
content_old: 9 “Further, take wheat, barley, beans, lentils, millet, and emmer. Put them into one vessel and bake them into bread. Eat it as many days as you lie on your side: three hundred and ninety.

content: 10 The food that you eat shall be by weight, twenty shekels a day; this you shall eat in the space of a day.
content_old: 10 The food that you eat shall be by weight, twenty shekels a day; this you shall eat in the space of a day.

content: 11 And you shall drink water by measure; drink a sixth of a hin in the space of a day.
content_old: 11 And you shall drink water by measure; drink a sixth of a hin in the space of a day.

content: 12 “Eat it as a barley cake; you shall bake it on human excrement before their eyes.
content_old: 12 “Eat it as a barley cake; you shall bake it on human excrement before their eyes.

content: 13 So,” said the LORD, “shall the people of Israel eat their bread, unclean, among the nations to which I will banish them.”
content_old: 13 So,” said the LORD, “shall the people of Israel eat their bread, unclean, among the nations to which I will banish them.”

content: 14 Then I said, “Ah, Lord GOD, my person was never defiled; nor have I eaten anything that died of itself or was torn by beasts from my youth until now, nor has foul flesh entered my mouth.”
content_old: 14 Then I said, “Ah, Lord GOD, my person was never defiled; nor have I eaten anything that died of itself or was torn by beasts from my youth until now, nor has foul flesh entered my mouth.”

content: 15 He answered me, “See, I allow you cow’s dung instead of human excrement; prepare your bread on that.”
content_old: 15 He answered me, “See, I allow you cow’s dung instead of human excrement; prepare your bread on that.”

content: 16 And He said to me, “O mortal, I am going to break the staff of bread in Jerusalem, and they shall eat bread by weight, in anxiety, and drink water by measure, in horror,
content_old: 16 And He said to me, “O mortal, I am going to break the staff of bread in Jerusalem, and they shall eat bread by weight, in anxiety, and drink water by measure, in horror,

content: 1 “And you, O mortal, take a sharp knife; use it as a barber’s razor and pass it over your head and beard. Then take scales and divide the hair.
content_old: 1 “And you, O mortal, take a sharp knife; use it as a barber’s razor and pass it over your head and beard. Then take scales and divide the hair.

content: 2 When the days of siege are completed, destroy a third part in fire in the city, take a third and strike it with the sword all around the city, and scatter a third to the wind and unsheathe a sword after them.
content_old: 2 When the days of siege are completed, destroy a third part in fire in the city, take a third and strike it with the sword all around the city, and scatter a third to the wind and unsheathe a sword after them.

content: 3 “Take also a few from there and tie them up in your skirts.
content_old: 3 “Take also a few from there and tie them up in your skirts.

content: 4 And take some more of them and cast them into the fire, and burn them in the fire. From this a fire shall go out upon the whole House of Israel.”
content_old: 4 And take some more of them and cast them into the fire, and burn them in the fire. From this a fire shall go out upon the whole House of Israel.”

content: 5 Thus said the Lord GOD: I set this Jerusalem in the midst of nations, with countries round about her.
content_old: 5 Thus said the Lord GOD: I set this Jerusalem in the midst of nations, with countries round about her.

content: 6 But she rebelled against My rules and My laws, acting more wickedly than the nations and the countries round about her; she rejected My rules and disobeyed My laws.
content_old: 6 But she rebelled against My rules and My laws, acting more wickedly than the nations and the countries round about her; she rejected My rules and disobeyed My laws.

content: 7 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: Because you have outdone the nations that are round about you—you have not obeyed My laws or followed My rules, nor have you observed the rules of the nations round about you—
content_old: 7 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: Because you have outdone the nations that are round about you—you have not obeyed My laws or followed My rules, nor have you observed the rules of the nations round about you—

content: 8 assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: I, in turn, am going to deal with you, and I will execute judgments in your midst in the sight of the nations.
content_old: 8 assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: I, in turn, am going to deal with you, and I will execute judgments in your midst in the sight of the nations.

content: 9 On account of all your abominations, I will do among you what I have never done, and the like of which I will never do again.
content_old: 9 On account of all your abominations, I will do among you what I have never done, and the like of which I will never do again.

content: 10 Assuredly, parents shall eat their children in your midst, and children shall eat their parents. I will execute judgments against you, and I will scatter all your survivors in every direction.
content_old: 10 Assuredly, parents shall eat their children in your midst, and children shall eat their parents. I will execute judgments against you, and I will scatter all your survivors in every direction.

content: 11 Assuredly, as I live—said the Lord GOD—because you defiled My Sanctuary with all your detestable things and all your abominations, I in turn will shear away and show no pity. I in turn will show no compassion:
content_old: 11 Assuredly, as I live—said the Lord GOD—because you defiled My Sanctuary with all your detestable things and all your abominations, I in turn will shear away and show no pity. I in turn will show no compassion:

content: 12 One-third of you shall die of pestilence or perish in your midst by famine, one-third shall fall by the sword around you, and I will scatter one-third in every direction and will unsheathe the sword after them.
content_old: 12 One-third of you shall die of pestilence or perish in your midst by famine, one-third shall fall by the sword around you, and I will scatter one-third in every direction and will unsheathe the sword after them.

content: 13 I will vent all My anger and satisfy My fury upon them; and when I vent all My fury upon them, they shall know that I the LORD have spoken in My passion.
content_old: 13 I will vent all My anger and satisfy My fury upon them; and when I vent all My fury upon them, they shall know that I the LORD have spoken in My passion.

content: 14 I will make you a ruin and a mockery among the nations roundabout you, in the sight of every passerby.
content_old: 14 I will make you a ruin and a mockery among the nations roundabout you, in the sight of every passerby.

content: 15 And when I execute judgment upon you in anger and rage and furious chastisement, you shall be a mockery and a derision, a warning and a horror, to the nations roundabout you: I the LORD have spoken.
content_old: 15 And when I execute judgment upon you in anger and rage and furious chastisement, you shall be a mockery and a derision, a warning and a horror, to the nations roundabout you: I the LORD have spoken.

content: 16 When I loose the deadly arrows of famine against those doomed to destruction, when I loose them against you to destroy you, I will heap more famine upon you and break your staff of bread.
content_old: 16 When I loose the deadly arrows of famine against those doomed to destruction, when I loose them against you to destroy you, I will heap more famine upon you and break your staff of bread.

content: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 O mortal, turn your face toward the mountains of Israel and prophesy to them
content_old: 2 O mortal, turn your face toward the mountains of Israel and prophesy to them

content: 3 and say: O mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord GOD. Thus said the Lord GOD to the mountains and the hills, to the streams and the valleys: See, I will bring a sword against you and destroy your shrines.
content_old: 3 and say: O mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord GOD. Thus said the Lord GOD to the mountains and the hills, to the streams and the valleys: See, I will bring a sword against you and destroy your shrines.

content: 4 Your altars shall be wrecked and your incense stands smashed, and I will hurl down your slain in front of your fetishes.
content_old: 4 Your altars shall be wrecked and your incense stands smashed, and I will hurl down your slain in front of your fetishes.

content: 5 I will cast the corpses of the people of Israel in front of their fetishes, and scatter your bones around your altars
content_old: 5 I will cast the corpses of the people of Israel in front of their fetishes, and scatter your bones around your altars

content: 6 in all your settlements. The towns shall be laid waste and the shrines shall be devastated. Thus your altars shall be laid waste and bear their punishment; your fetishes shall be smashed and annihilated, your incense stands cut down, and your handiwork wiped out;
content_old: 6 in all your settlements. The towns shall be laid waste and the shrines shall be devastated. Thus your altars shall be laid waste and bear their punishment; your fetishes shall be smashed and annihilated, your incense stands cut down, and your handiwork wiped out;

content: 7 and the slain shall fall in your midst. Then you shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 7 and the slain shall fall in your midst. Then you shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 8 Yet I will leave a remnant, in that some of you shall escape the sword among the nations and be scattered through the lands.
content_old: 8 Yet I will leave a remnant, in that some of you shall escape the sword among the nations and be scattered through the lands.

content: 9 And those of you that escape will remember Me among the nations where they have been taken captive, how I was brokenhearted through their faithless hearts which turned away from Me, and through their eyes which lusted after their fetishes. And they shall loathe themselves for all the evil they committed and for all their abominable deeds.
content_old: 9 And those of you that escape will remember Me among the nations where they have been taken captive, how I was brokenhearted through their faithless hearts which turned away from Me, and through their eyes which lusted after their fetishes. And they shall loathe themselves for all the evil they committed and for all their abominable deeds.

content: 10 Then they shall realize it was not without cause that I the LORD resolved to bring this evil upon them.
content_old: 10 Then they shall realize it was not without cause that I the LORD resolved to bring this evil upon them.

content: 11 Thus said the Lord GOD: Strike your hands together and stamp your feet and cry: Aha! over all the vile abominations of the House of Israel who shall fall by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence.
content_old: 11 Thus said the Lord GOD: Strike your hands together and stamp your feet and cry: Aha! over all the vile abominations of the House of Israel who shall fall by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence.

content: 12 He who is far away shall die of pestilence, and he who is near shall fall by the sword, and he who survives and is protected shall die of famine. Thus I will spend My fury upon them.
content_old: 12 He who is far away shall die of pestilence, and he who is near shall fall by the sword, and he who survives and is protected shall die of famine. Thus I will spend My fury upon them.

content: 13 And you shall know that I am the LORD, when your slain lie among the fetishes round about their altars, on every high hill, on all the mountaintops, under every green tree, and under every leafy oak—wherever they presented pleasing odors to all their fetishes.
content_old: 13 And you shall know that I am the LORD, when your slain lie among the fetishes round about their altars, on every high hill, on all the mountaintops, under every green tree, and under every leafy oak—wherever they presented pleasing odors to all their fetishes.

content: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 You, O mortal, say: Thus said the Lord GOD to the land of Israel: Doom! Doom is coming upon the four corners of the land.
content_old: 2 You, O mortal, say: Thus said the Lord GOD to the land of Israel: Doom! Doom is coming upon the four corners of the land.

content: 3 Now doom is upon you! I will let loose My anger against you and judge you according to your ways; I will requite you for all your abominations.
content_old: 3 Now doom is upon you! I will let loose My anger against you and judge you according to your ways; I will requite you for all your abominations.

content: 4 I will show you no pity and no compassion; but I will requite you for your ways and for the abominations in your midst. And you shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 4 I will show you no pity and no compassion; but I will requite you for your ways and for the abominations in your midst. And you shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 5 Thus said the Lord GOD: A singular disaster; a disaster is coming.
content_old: 5 Thus said the Lord GOD: A singular disaster; a disaster is coming.

content: 6 Doom is coming! The hour of doom is coming! It stirs against you; there it comes!
content_old: 6 Doom is coming! The hour of doom is coming! It stirs against you; there it comes!

content: 7 The cycle has come around for you, O inhabitants of the land; the time has come; the day is near. There is panic on the mountains, not joy.
content_old: 7 The cycle has come around for you, O inhabitants of the land; the time has come; the day is near. There is panic on the mountains, not joy.

content: 8 Very soon I will pour out My wrath upon you and spend My anger on you; I will judge you according to your ways, and I will requite you for all your abominations.
content_old: 8 Very soon I will pour out My wrath upon you and spend My anger on you; I will judge you according to your ways, and I will requite you for all your abominations.

content: 9 I will show you no pity and no compassion; but I will requite you for your ways, and for the abominations in your midst. And you shall know it was I the LORD who punished.
content_old: 9 I will show you no pity and no compassion; but I will requite you for your ways, and for the abominations in your midst. And you shall know it was I the LORD who punished.

content: 10 Here is the day! See, the cycle has come round; it has appeared. The rod has blossomed; arrogance has budded,
content_old: 10 Here is the day! See, the cycle has come round; it has appeared. The rod has blossomed; arrogance has budded,

content: 11 lawlessness has grown into a rod of wickedness. Nothing comes of them, nor of their abundance, nor of their wealth; nor is there preeminence among them.
content_old: 11 lawlessness has grown into a rod of wickedness. Nothing comes of them, nor of their abundance, nor of their wealth; nor is there preeminence among them.

content: 12 The time has come, the day has arrived. Let not the buyer rejoice nor the seller mourn—for divine wrath shall overtake all her multitude.
content_old: 12 The time has come, the day has arrived. Let not the buyer rejoice nor the seller mourn—for divine wrath shall overtake all her multitude.

content: 13 For the seller shall not return to what he sold so long as they remain among the living. For the vision concerns all her multitude, it shall not be revoked. And because of his guilt, no man shall hold fast to his life.
content_old: 13 For the seller shall not return to what he sold so long as they remain among the living. For the vision concerns all her multitude, it shall not be revoked. And because of his guilt, no man shall hold fast to his life.

content: 14 They have sounded the horn, and all is prepared; but no one goes to battle, for My wrath is directed against all her multitude.
content_old: 14 They have sounded the horn, and all is prepared; but no one goes to battle, for My wrath is directed against all her multitude.

content: 15 The sword is outside and pestilence and famine are inside; he who is in the open shall die by the sword, he who is in the town shall be devoured by famine and pestilence.
content_old: 15 The sword is outside and pestilence and famine are inside; he who is in the open shall die by the sword, he who is in the town shall be devoured by famine and pestilence.

content: 16 And if any survive, they shall take to the mountains; they shall be like doves of the valley, moaning together—every one for his iniquity.
content_old: 16 And if any survive, they shall take to the mountains; they shall be like doves of the valley, moaning together—every one for his iniquity.

content: 17 All hands shall grow weak, and all knees shall turn to water.
content_old: 17 All hands shall grow weak, and all knees shall turn to water.

content: 18 They shall gird on sackcloth, and horror shall cover them; every face shall betray shame, and every head shall be made bald.
content_old: 18 They shall gird on sackcloth, and horror shall cover them; every face shall betray shame, and every head shall be made bald.

content: 19 They shall throw their silver into the streets, and their gold shall be treated as something unclean. Their silver and gold shall not avail to save them in the day of the LORD’s wrath—to satisfy their hunger or to fill their stomachs. Because they made them stumble into guilt—
content_old: 19 They shall throw their silver into the streets, and their gold shall be treated as something unclean. Their silver and gold shall not avail to save them in the day of the LORD’s wrath—to satisfy their hunger or to fill their stomachs. Because they made them stumble into guilt—

content: 20 for out of their beautiful adornments, in which they took pride, they made their images and their detestable abominations—therefore I will make them an unclean thing to them.
content_old: 20 for out of their beautiful adornments, in which they took pride, they made their images and their detestable abominations—therefore I will make them an unclean thing to them.

content: 21 I will give them as spoil to strangers, and as plunder to the wicked of the earth; and they shall defile them.
content_old: 21 I will give them as spoil to strangers, and as plunder to the wicked of the earth; and they shall defile them.

content: 22 I will turn My face from them, and My treasures shall be defiled; ruffians shall invade it and defile it.
content_old: 22 I will turn My face from them, and My treasures shall be defiled; ruffians shall invade it and defile it.

content: 23 Forge the chain, for the land is full of bloody crimes, and the city is full of lawlessness.
content_old: 23 Forge the chain, for the land is full of bloody crimes, and the city is full of lawlessness.

content: 24 I will bring in the worst of the nations to take possession of their houses; so shall I turn to naught the pride of the powerful, and their sanctuaries shall be defiled.
content_old: 24 I will bring in the worst of the nations to take possession of their houses; so shall I turn to naught the pride of the powerful, and their sanctuaries shall be defiled.

content: 25 Horror comes, and they shall seek safety, but there shall be none.
content_old: 25 Horror comes, and they shall seek safety, but there shall be none.

content: 26 Calamity shall follow calamity, and rumor follow rumor. Then they shall seek vision from the prophet in vain; instruction shall perish from the priest, and counsel from the elders.
content_old: 26 Calamity shall follow calamity, and rumor follow rumor. Then they shall seek vision from the prophet in vain; instruction shall perish from the priest, and counsel from the elders.

content: 1 In the sixth year, on the fifth day of the sixth month, I was sitting at home, and the elders of Judah were sitting before me, and there the hand of the Lord GOD fell upon me.
content_old: 1 In the sixth year, on the fifth day of the sixth month, I was sitting at home, and the elders of Judah were sitting before me, and there the hand of the Lord GOD fell upon me.

content: 2 As I looked, there was a figure that had the appearance of fire: from what appeared as his loins down, fire; and from his loins up, his appearance was resplendent and had the color of amber.
content_old: 2 As I looked, there was a figure that had the appearance of fire: from what appeared as his loins down, fire; and from his loins up, his appearance was resplendent and had the color of amber.

content: 3 He stretched out the form of a hand, and took me by the hair of my head. A spirit lifted me up between heaven and earth and brought me in visions of God to Jerusalem, to the entrance of the Penimith Gate that faces north; that was the site of the infuriating image that provokes fury.
content_old: 3 He stretched out the form of a hand, and took me by the hair of my head. A spirit lifted me up between heaven and earth and brought me in visions of God to Jerusalem, to the entrance of the Penimith Gate that faces north; that was the site of the infuriating image that provokes fury.

content: 4 And the Presence of the God of Israel appeared there, like the vision that I had seen in the valley.
content_old: 4 And the Presence of the God of Israel appeared there, like the vision that I had seen in the valley.

content: 5 And He said to me, “O mortal, turn your eyes northward.” I turned my eyes northward, and there, north of the gate of the altar, was that infuriating image on the approach.
content_old: 5 And He said to me, “O mortal, turn your eyes northward.” I turned my eyes northward, and there, north of the gate of the altar, was that infuriating image on the approach.

content: 6 And He said to me, “Mortal, do you see what they are doing, the terrible abominations that the House of Israel is practicing here, to drive Me far from My Sanctuary? You shall yet see even greater abominations!”
content_old: 6 And He said to me, “Mortal, do you see what they are doing, the terrible abominations that the House of Israel is practicing here, to drive Me far from My Sanctuary? You shall yet see even greater abominations!”

content: 7 Then He brought me to the entrance of the court; and I looked, and there was a hole in the wall.
content_old: 7 Then He brought me to the entrance of the court; and I looked, and there was a hole in the wall.

content: 8 He said to me, “Mortal, break through the wall”; so I broke through the wall and found an entrance.
content_old: 8 He said to me, “Mortal, break through the wall”; so I broke through the wall and found an entrance.

content: 9 And He said to me, “Enter and see the vile abominations that they are practicing here.”
content_old: 9 And He said to me, “Enter and see the vile abominations that they are practicing here.”

content: 10 I entered and looked, and there all detestable forms of creeping things and beasts and all the fetishes of the House of Israel were depicted over the entire wall.
content_old: 10 I entered and looked, and there all detestable forms of creeping things and beasts and all the fetishes of the House of Israel were depicted over the entire wall.

content: 11 Before them stood seventy men, elders of the House of Israel, with Jaazaniah son of Shaphan standing in their midst. Everyone had a censer in his hand, and a thick cloud of incense smoke ascended.
content_old: 11 Before them stood seventy men, elders of the House of Israel, with Jaazaniah son of Shaphan standing in their midst. Everyone had a censer in his hand, and a thick cloud of incense smoke ascended.

content: 12 Again He spoke to me, “O mortal, have you seen what the elders of the House of Israel are doing in the darkness, everyone in his image-covered chamber? For they say, ‘The LORD does not see us; the LORD has abandoned the country.’ ”
content_old: 12 Again He spoke to me, “O mortal, have you seen what the elders of the House of Israel are doing in the darkness, everyone in his image-covered chamber? For they say, ‘The LORD does not see us; the LORD has abandoned the country.’ ”

content: 13 And He said to me, “You shall see even more terrible abominations which they practice.”
content_old: 13 And He said to me, “You shall see even more terrible abominations which they practice.”

content: 14 Next He brought me to the entrance of the north gate of the House of the LORD; and there sat the women bewailing Tammuz.
content_old: 14 Next He brought me to the entrance of the north gate of the House of the LORD; and there sat the women bewailing Tammuz.

content: 15 He said to me, “Have you seen, O mortal? You shall see even more terrible abominations than these.”
content_old: 15 He said to me, “Have you seen, O mortal? You shall see even more terrible abominations than these.”

content: 16 Then He brought me into the inner court of the House of the LORD, and there, at the entrance to the Temple of the LORD, between the portico and the altar, were about twenty-five men, their backs to the Temple of the LORD and their faces to the east; they were bowing low to the sun in the east.
content_old: 16 Then He brought me into the inner court of the House of the LORD, and there, at the entrance to the Temple of the LORD, between the portico and the altar, were about twenty-five men, their backs to the Temple of the LORD and their faces to the east; they were bowing low to the sun in the east.

content: 17 And He said to me, “Do you see, O mortal? Is it not enough for the House of Judah to practice the abominations that they have committed here, that they must fill the country with lawlessness and provoke Me still further and thrust the branch to their nostrils?
content_old: 17 And He said to me, “Do you see, O mortal? Is it not enough for the House of Judah to practice the abominations that they have committed here, that they must fill the country with lawlessness and provoke Me still further and thrust the branch to their nostrils?

content: 1 Then He called loudly in my hearing, saying, “Approach, you men in charge of the city, each bearing his weapons of destruction!”
content_old: 1 Then He called loudly in my hearing, saying, “Approach, you men in charge of the city, each bearing his weapons of destruction!”

content: 2 And six men entered by way of the upper gate that faces north, each with his club in his hand; and among them was another, clothed in linen, with a writing case at his waist. They came forward and stopped at the bronze altar.
content_old: 2 And six men entered by way of the upper gate that faces north, each with his club in his hand; and among them was another, clothed in linen, with a writing case at his waist. They came forward and stopped at the bronze altar.

content: 3 Now the Presence of the God of Israel had moved from the cherub on which it had rested to the platform of the House. He called to the man clothed in linen with the writing case at his waist;
content_old: 3 Now the Presence of the God of Israel had moved from the cherub on which it had rested to the platform of the House. He called to the man clothed in linen with the writing case at his waist;

content: 4 and the LORD said to him, “Pass through the city, through Jerusalem, and put a mark on the foreheads of the men who moan and groan because of all the abominations that are committed in it.”
content_old: 4 and the LORD said to him, “Pass through the city, through Jerusalem, and put a mark on the foreheads of the men who moan and groan because of all the abominations that are committed in it.”

content: 5 To the others He said in my hearing, “Follow him through the city and strike; show no pity or compassion.
content_old: 5 To the others He said in my hearing, “Follow him through the city and strike; show no pity or compassion.

content: 6 Kill off graybeard, youth and maiden, women and children; but do not touch any person who bears the mark. Begin here at My Sanctuary.” So they began with the elders who were in front of the House.
content_old: 6 Kill off graybeard, youth and maiden, women and children; but do not touch any person who bears the mark. Begin here at My Sanctuary.” So they began with the elders who were in front of the House.

content: 7 And He said to them, “Defile the House and fill the courts with the slain. Then go forth.” So they went forth and began to kill in the city.
content_old: 7 And He said to them, “Defile the House and fill the courts with the slain. Then go forth.” So they went forth and began to kill in the city.

content: 8 When they were out killing, and I remained alone, I flung myself on my face and cried out, “Ah, Lord GOD! Are you going to annihilate all that is left of Israel, pouring out Your fury upon Jerusalem?”
content_old: 8 When they were out killing, and I remained alone, I flung myself on my face and cried out, “Ah, Lord GOD! Are you going to annihilate all that is left of Israel, pouring out Your fury upon Jerusalem?”

content: 9 He answered me, “The iniquity of the Houses of Judah and Israel is very very great, the land is full of crime and the city is full of corruption. For they say, ‘The LORD has forsaken the land, and the LORD does not see.’
content_old: 9 He answered me, “The iniquity of the Houses of Judah and Israel is very very great, the land is full of crime and the city is full of corruption. For they say, ‘The LORD has forsaken the land, and the LORD does not see.’

content: 10 I, in turn, will show no pity or compassion; I will give them their deserts.”
content_old: 10 I, in turn, will show no pity or compassion; I will give them their deserts.”

content: 1 I looked, and on the expanse over the heads of the cherubs, there was something like a sapphire stone; an appearance resembling a throne could be seen over them.
content_old: 1 I looked, and on the expanse over the heads of the cherubs, there was something like a sapphire stone; an appearance resembling a throne could be seen over them.

content: 2 He spoke to the man clothed in linen and said, “Step inside the wheelwork, under the cherubs, and fill your hands with glowing coals from among the cherubs, and scatter them over the city.” And he went in as I looked on.
content_old: 2 He spoke to the man clothed in linen and said, “Step inside the wheelwork, under the cherubs, and fill your hands with glowing coals from among the cherubs, and scatter them over the city.” And he went in as I looked on.

content: 3 Now the cherubs were standing on the south side of the House when the man entered, and the cloud filled the inner court.
content_old: 3 Now the cherubs were standing on the south side of the House when the man entered, and the cloud filled the inner court.

content: 4 But when the Presence of the LORD moved from the cherubs to the platform of the House, the House was filled with the cloud, and the court was filled with the radiance of the Presence of the LORD.
content_old: 4 But when the Presence of the LORD moved from the cherubs to the platform of the House, the House was filled with the cloud, and the court was filled with the radiance of the Presence of the LORD.

content: 5 The sound of the cherubs’ wings could be heard as far as the outer court, like the voice of El Shaddai when He speaks.
content_old: 5 The sound of the cherubs’ wings could be heard as far as the outer court, like the voice of El Shaddai when He speaks.

content: 6 When He commanded the man dressed in linen: “Take fire from among the cherubs within the wheelwork,” he went in and stood beside a wheel.
content_old: 6 When He commanded the man dressed in linen: “Take fire from among the cherubs within the wheelwork,” he went in and stood beside a wheel.

content: 7 And a cherub stretched out his hand among the cherubs to the fire that was among the cherubs; he took some and put it into the hands of him who was clothed in linen, who took it and went out.
content_old: 7 And a cherub stretched out his hand among the cherubs to the fire that was among the cherubs; he took some and put it into the hands of him who was clothed in linen, who took it and went out.

content: 8 The cherubs appeared to have the form of a man’s hand under their wings.
content_old: 8 The cherubs appeared to have the form of a man’s hand under their wings.

content: 9 I could see that there were four wheels beside the cherubs, one wheel beside each of the cherubs; as for the appearance of the wheels, they gleamed like the beryl stone.
content_old: 9 I could see that there were four wheels beside the cherubs, one wheel beside each of the cherubs; as for the appearance of the wheels, they gleamed like the beryl stone.

content: 10 In appearance, the four had the same form, as if there were two wheels cutting through each other.
content_old: 10 In appearance, the four had the same form, as if there were two wheels cutting through each other.

content: 11 And when they moved, each could move in the direction of any of its four quarters; they did not veer as they moved. The moved in the direction in which one of the heads faced, without turning as they moved.
content_old: 11 And when they moved, each could move in the direction of any of its four quarters; they did not veer as they moved. The moved in the direction in which one of the heads faced, without turning as they moved.

content: 12 Their entire bodies—backs, hands, and wings—and the wheels, the wheels of the four of them, were covered all over with eyes.
content_old: 12 Their entire bodies—backs, hands, and wings—and the wheels, the wheels of the four of them, were covered all over with eyes.

content: 13 It was these wheels that I had heard called “the wheelwork.”
content_old: 13 It was these wheels that I had heard called “the wheelwork.”

content: 14 Each one had four faces: One was a cherub’s face, the second a human face, the third a lion’s face, and the fourth an eagle’s face.
content_old: 14 Each one had four faces: One was a cherub’s face, the second a human face, the third a lion’s face, and the fourth an eagle’s face.

content: 15 The cherubs ascended; those were the creatures that I had seen by the Chebar Canal.
content_old: 15 The cherubs ascended; those were the creatures that I had seen by the Chebar Canal.

content: 16 Whenever the cherubs went, the wheels went beside them; and when the cherubs lifted their wings to ascend from the earth, the wheels did not roll away from their side.
content_old: 16 Whenever the cherubs went, the wheels went beside them; and when the cherubs lifted their wings to ascend from the earth, the wheels did not roll away from their side.

content: 17 When those stood still, these stood still; and when those ascended, these ascended with them, for the spirit of the creature was in them.
content_old: 17 When those stood still, these stood still; and when those ascended, these ascended with them, for the spirit of the creature was in them.

content: 18 Then the Presence of the LORD left the platform of the House and stopped above the cherubs.
content_old: 18 Then the Presence of the LORD left the platform of the House and stopped above the cherubs.

content: 19 And I saw the cherubs lift their wings and rise from the earth, with the wheels beside them as they departed; and they stopped at the entrance of the eastern gate of the House of the LORD, with the Presence of the God of Israel above them.
content_old: 19 And I saw the cherubs lift their wings and rise from the earth, with the wheels beside them as they departed; and they stopped at the entrance of the eastern gate of the House of the LORD, with the Presence of the God of Israel above them.

content: 20 They were the same creatures that I had seen below the God of Israel at the Chebar Canal; so now I knew that they were cherubs.
content_old: 20 They were the same creatures that I had seen below the God of Israel at the Chebar Canal; so now I knew that they were cherubs.

content: 21 Each one had four faces and each had four wings, with the form of human hands under the wings.
content_old: 21 Each one had four faces and each had four wings, with the form of human hands under the wings.

content: 1 Then a spirit lifted me up and brought me to the east gate of the House of the LORD, which faces eastward; and there, at the entrance of the gate, were twenty-five men, among whom I saw Jaazaniah son of Azzur and Pelatiah son of Benaiah, leaders of the people.
content_old: 1 Then a spirit lifted me up and brought me to the east gate of the House of the LORD, which faces eastward; and there, at the entrance of the gate, were twenty-five men, among whom I saw Jaazaniah son of Azzur and Pelatiah son of Benaiah, leaders of the people.

content: 2 The LORDsaid to me, “O mortal, these are the men who plan iniquity and plot wickedness in this city,
content_old: 2 The LORDsaid to me, “O mortal, these are the men who plan iniquity and plot wickedness in this city,

content: 3 who say: ‘There is no need now to build houses; this city is the pot, and we are the meat.’
content_old: 3 who say: ‘There is no need now to build houses; this city is the pot, and we are the meat.’

content: 4 I adjure you, prophesy against them; prophesy, O mortal!”
content_old: 4 I adjure you, prophesy against them; prophesy, O mortal!”

content: 5 Thereupon the spirit of the LORD fell upon me, and He said to me, “Speak: Thus said the LORD: Such are your thoughts, O House of Israel; I know what comes into your mind.
content_old: 5 Thereupon the spirit of the LORD fell upon me, and He said to me, “Speak: Thus said the LORD: Such are your thoughts, O House of Israel; I know what comes into your mind.

content: 6 Many have you slain in this city; you have filled its streets with corpses.
content_old: 6 Many have you slain in this city; you have filled its streets with corpses.

content: 7 Assuredly, thus says the Lord GOD: The corpses that you have piled up in it are the meat for which it is the pot; but you shall be taken out of it.
content_old: 7 Assuredly, thus says the Lord GOD: The corpses that you have piled up in it are the meat for which it is the pot; but you shall be taken out of it.

content: 8 You feared the sword, and the sword I will bring upon you—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 8 You feared the sword, and the sword I will bring upon you—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 9 I will take you out of it and deliver you into the hands of strangers, and I will execute judgments upon you.
content_old: 9 I will take you out of it and deliver you into the hands of strangers, and I will execute judgments upon you.

content: 10 You shall fall by the sword; I will punish you at the border of Israel. And you shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 10 You shall fall by the sword; I will punish you at the border of Israel. And you shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 11 This city shall not be a pot for you, nor you the meat in it; I will punish you at the border of Israel.
content_old: 11 This city shall not be a pot for you, nor you the meat in it; I will punish you at the border of Israel.

content: 12 Then you shall know that I am the LORD, whose laws you did not follow and whose rules you did not obey, acting instead according to the rules of the nations around you.”
content_old: 12 Then you shall know that I am the LORD, whose laws you did not follow and whose rules you did not obey, acting instead according to the rules of the nations around you.”

content: 13 Now, as I prophesied, Pelatiah son of Benaiah dropped dead. I threw myself upon my face and cried out aloud, “Ah, Lord GOD! You are wiping out the remnant of Israel!”
content_old: 13 Now, as I prophesied, Pelatiah son of Benaiah dropped dead. I threw myself upon my face and cried out aloud, “Ah, Lord GOD! You are wiping out the remnant of Israel!”

content: 14 Then the word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 14 Then the word of the LORD came to me:

content: 15 “O mortal, your brothers, your brothers, the men of your kindred, all of that very House of Israel to whom the inhabitants of Jerusalem say, ‘Keep far from the LORD; the land has been given as a heritage to us.’
content_old: 15 “O mortal, your brothers, your brothers, the men of your kindred, all of that very House of Israel to whom the inhabitants of Jerusalem say, ‘Keep far from the LORD; the land has been given as a heritage to us.’

content: 16 Say then: Thus said the Lord GOD: I have indeed removed them far among the nations and have scattered them among the countries, and I have become to them a diminished sanctity in the countries whither they have gone.
content_old: 16 Say then: Thus said the Lord GOD: I have indeed removed them far among the nations and have scattered them among the countries, and I have become to them a diminished sanctity in the countries whither they have gone.

content: 17 Yet say: Thus said the Lord GOD: I will gather you from the peoples and assemble you out of the countries where you have been scattered, and I will give you the Land of Israel.
content_old: 17 Yet say: Thus said the Lord GOD: I will gather you from the peoples and assemble you out of the countries where you have been scattered, and I will give you the Land of Israel.

content: 18 And they shall return there, and do away with all its detestable things and all its abominations.
content_old: 18 And they shall return there, and do away with all its detestable things and all its abominations.

content: 19 I will give them one heart and put a new spirit in them; I will remove the heart of stone from their bodies and give them a heart of flesh,
content_old: 19 I will give them one heart and put a new spirit in them; I will remove the heart of stone from their bodies and give them a heart of flesh,

content: 20 that they may follow My laws and faithfully observe My rules. Then they shall be My people and I will be their God.
content_old: 20 that they may follow My laws and faithfully observe My rules. Then they shall be My people and I will be their God.

content: 21 But as for them whose heart is set upon their detestable things and their abominations, I will repay them for their conduct—declares the Lord GOD.”
content_old: 21 But as for them whose heart is set upon their detestable things and their abominations, I will repay them for their conduct—declares the Lord GOD.”

content: 22 Then the cherubs, with the wheels beside them, lifted their wings, while the Presence of the God of Israel rested above them.
content_old: 22 Then the cherubs, with the wheels beside them, lifted their wings, while the Presence of the God of Israel rested above them.

content: 23 The Presence of the LORD ascended from the midst of the city and stood on the hill east of the city.
content_old: 23 The Presence of the LORD ascended from the midst of the city and stood on the hill east of the city.

content: 24 A spirit carried me away and brought me in a vision by the spirit of God to the exile community in Chaldea. Then the vision that I had seen left me,
content_old: 24 A spirit carried me away and brought me in a vision by the spirit of God to the exile community in Chaldea. Then the vision that I had seen left me,

content: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 O mortal, you dwell among the rebellious breed. They have eyes to see but see not, ears to hear but hear not; for they are a rebellious breed.
content_old: 2 O mortal, you dwell among the rebellious breed. They have eyes to see but see not, ears to hear but hear not; for they are a rebellious breed.

content: 3 Therefore, mortal, get yourself gear for exile, and go into exile by day before their eyes. Go into exile from your home to another place before their very eyes; perhaps they will take note, even though they are a rebellious breed.
content_old: 3 Therefore, mortal, get yourself gear for exile, and go into exile by day before their eyes. Go into exile from your home to another place before their very eyes; perhaps they will take note, even though they are a rebellious breed.

content: 4 Carry out your gear as gear for exile by day before their very eyes; and go out again in the evening before their eyes, as one who goes out into exile.
content_old: 4 Carry out your gear as gear for exile by day before their very eyes; and go out again in the evening before their eyes, as one who goes out into exile.

content: 5 Before their eyes, break through the wall and carry the gear out through it;
content_old: 5 Before their eyes, break through the wall and carry the gear out through it;

content: 6 before their eyes, carry it on your shoulder. Take it out in the dark, and cover your face that you may not see the land; for I make you a portent to the House of Israel.
content_old: 6 before their eyes, carry it on your shoulder. Take it out in the dark, and cover your face that you may not see the land; for I make you a portent to the House of Israel.

content: 7 I did just as I was ordered: I took out my gear by day as gear for exile, and in the evening I broke through the wall with my own hands. In the darkness I carried out on my shoulder, carrying it before their eyes.
content_old: 7 I did just as I was ordered: I took out my gear by day as gear for exile, and in the evening I broke through the wall with my own hands. In the darkness I carried out on my shoulder, carrying it before their eyes.

content: 8 In the morning, the word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 8 In the morning, the word of the LORD came to me:

content: 9 O mortal, did not the House of Israel, that rebellious breed, ask you, “What are you doing?”
content_old: 9 O mortal, did not the House of Israel, that rebellious breed, ask you, “What are you doing?”

content: 10 Say to them: “Thus said the Lord GOD: This pronouncement concerns the prince in Jerusalem and all the House of Israel who are in it.”
content_old: 10 Say to them: “Thus said the Lord GOD: This pronouncement concerns the prince in Jerusalem and all the House of Israel who are in it.”

content: 11 Say: “I am a portent for you: As I have done, so shall it be done to them; they shall go into exile, into captivity.
content_old: 11 Say: “I am a portent for you: As I have done, so shall it be done to them; they shall go into exile, into captivity.

content: 12 And the prince among them shall carry his gear on his shoulder as he goes out in the dark. He shall break through the wall in order to carry out through it; he shall cover his face, because he himself shall not see the land with his eyes.”
content_old: 12 And the prince among them shall carry his gear on his shoulder as he goes out in the dark. He shall break through the wall in order to carry out through it; he shall cover his face, because he himself shall not see the land with his eyes.”

content: 13 I will spread My net over him, and he shall be caught in My snare. I will bring him to Babylon, the land of the Chaldeans, but he shall not see it; and there he shall die.
content_old: 13 I will spread My net over him, and he shall be caught in My snare. I will bring him to Babylon, the land of the Chaldeans, but he shall not see it; and there he shall die.

content: 14 And all those around him, his helpers and all his troops, I will scatter in every direction; and I will unsheathe the sword after them.
content_old: 14 And all those around him, his helpers and all his troops, I will scatter in every direction; and I will unsheathe the sword after them.

content: 15 Then, when I have scattered them among the nations and dispersed them through the countries, they shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 15 Then, when I have scattered them among the nations and dispersed them through the countries, they shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 16 But I will spare a few of them from the sword, from famine, and from pestilence, that they may recount all their abominable deeds among the nations to which they come; and they shall know that I am the LORD!
content_old: 16 But I will spare a few of them from the sword, from famine, and from pestilence, that they may recount all their abominable deeds among the nations to which they come; and they shall know that I am the LORD!

content: 17 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 17 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 18 O mortal, eat your bread in trembling and drink your water in fear and anxiety.
content_old: 18 O mortal, eat your bread in trembling and drink your water in fear and anxiety.

content: 19 And say to the people of the land: Thus said the Lord GOD concerning the inhabitants of Jerusalem in the land of Israel: They shall eat their bread in anxiety and drink their water in desolation, because their land will be desolate of its multitudes on account of the lawlessness of all its inhabitants.
content_old: 19 And say to the people of the land: Thus said the Lord GOD concerning the inhabitants of Jerusalem in the land of Israel: They shall eat their bread in anxiety and drink their water in desolation, because their land will be desolate of its multitudes on account of the lawlessness of all its inhabitants.

content: 20 The inhabited towns shall be laid waste and the land shall become a desolation; then you shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 20 The inhabited towns shall be laid waste and the land shall become a desolation; then you shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 21 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 21 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 22 O mortal, what is this proverb that you have in the land of Israel, that you say, “The days grow many and every vision comes to naught?”
content_old: 22 O mortal, what is this proverb that you have in the land of Israel, that you say, “The days grow many and every vision comes to naught?”

content: 23 Assuredly, say to them, Thus said the Lord GOD: I will put an end to this proverb; it shall not be used in Israel any more. Speak rather to them: The days draw near, and the fulfillment of every vision.
content_old: 23 Assuredly, say to them, Thus said the Lord GOD: I will put an end to this proverb; it shall not be used in Israel any more. Speak rather to them: The days draw near, and the fulfillment of every vision.

content: 24 For there shall no longer be any false vision or soothing divination in the House of Israel.
content_old: 24 For there shall no longer be any false vision or soothing divination in the House of Israel.

content: 25 But whenever I the LORD speak what I speak, that word shall be fulfilled without any delay; in your days, O rebellious breed, I will fulfill every word I speak—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 25 But whenever I the LORD speak what I speak, that word shall be fulfilled without any delay; in your days, O rebellious breed, I will fulfill every word I speak—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 26 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 26 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 27 See, O mortal, the House of Israel says, “The vision that he sees is far ahead, and he prophesies for the distant future.”
content_old: 27 See, O mortal, the House of Israel says, “The vision that he sees is far ahead, and he prophesies for the distant future.”

content: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 O mortal, prophesy against the prophets of Israel who prophesy; say to those who prophesy out of their own imagination: Hear the word of the LORD!
content_old: 2 O mortal, prophesy against the prophets of Israel who prophesy; say to those who prophesy out of their own imagination: Hear the word of the LORD!

content: 3 Thus said the Lord GOD: Woe to the degenerate prophets, who follow their own fancy, without having had a vision!
content_old: 3 Thus said the Lord GOD: Woe to the degenerate prophets, who follow their own fancy, without having had a vision!

content: 4 Your prophets, O Israel, have been like jackals among ruins.
content_old: 4 Your prophets, O Israel, have been like jackals among ruins.

content: 5 You did not enter the breaches and repair the walls for the House of Israel, that they might stand up in battle in the day of the LORD.
content_old: 5 You did not enter the breaches and repair the walls for the House of Israel, that they might stand up in battle in the day of the LORD.

content: 6 They prophesied falsehood and lying divination; they said, “Declares the LORD,” when the LORD did not send them, and then they waited for their word to be fulfilled.
content_old: 6 They prophesied falsehood and lying divination; they said, “Declares the LORD,” when the LORD did not send them, and then they waited for their word to be fulfilled.

content: 7 It was false visions you prophesied and lying divination you uttered, saying, “Declares the LORD,” when I had not spoken.
content_old: 7 It was false visions you prophesied and lying divination you uttered, saying, “Declares the LORD,” when I had not spoken.

content: 8 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: Because you speak falsehood and prophesy lies, assuredly, I will deal with you—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 8 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: Because you speak falsehood and prophesy lies, assuredly, I will deal with you—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 9 My hand will be against the prophets who prophesy falsehood and utter lying divination. They shall not remain in the assembly of My people, they shall not be inscribed in the lists of the House of Israel, and they shall not come back to the land of Israel. Thus shall you know that I am the Lord GOD.
content_old: 9 My hand will be against the prophets who prophesy falsehood and utter lying divination. They shall not remain in the assembly of My people, they shall not be inscribed in the lists of the House of Israel, and they shall not come back to the land of Israel. Thus shall you know that I am the Lord GOD.

content: 10 Inasmuch as they have misled My people, saying, “It is well,” when nothing is well, daubing with plaster the flimsy wall which the people were building,
content_old: 10 Inasmuch as they have misled My people, saying, “It is well,” when nothing is well, daubing with plaster the flimsy wall which the people were building,

content: 11 say to those daubers of plaster: It shall collapse; a driving rain shall descend—and you, O great hailstones, shall fall—and a hurricane wind shall rend it.
content_old: 11 say to those daubers of plaster: It shall collapse; a driving rain shall descend—and you, O great hailstones, shall fall—and a hurricane wind shall rend it.

content: 12 Then, when the wall collapses, you will be asked, “What became of the plaster you daubed on?”
content_old: 12 Then, when the wall collapses, you will be asked, “What became of the plaster you daubed on?”

content: 13 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: In My fury I will let loose hurricane winds; in My anger a driving rain shall descend, and great hailstones in destructive fury.
content_old: 13 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: In My fury I will let loose hurricane winds; in My anger a driving rain shall descend, and great hailstones in destructive fury.

content: 14 I will throw down the wall that you daubed with plaster, and I will raze it to the ground so that its foundation is exposed; and when it falls, you shall perish in its midst; then you shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 14 I will throw down the wall that you daubed with plaster, and I will raze it to the ground so that its foundation is exposed; and when it falls, you shall perish in its midst; then you shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 15 And when I have spent My fury upon the wall and upon those who daubed it with plaster, I will say to you: Gone is the wall and gone are its daubers,
content_old: 15 And when I have spent My fury upon the wall and upon those who daubed it with plaster, I will say to you: Gone is the wall and gone are its daubers,

content: 16 the prophets of Israel who prophesy about Jerusalem and see a vision of well-being for her when there is no well-being—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 16 the prophets of Israel who prophesy about Jerusalem and see a vision of well-being for her when there is no well-being—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 17 And you, O mortal, set your face against the women of your people, who prophesy out of their own imagination. Prophesy against them
content_old: 17 And you, O mortal, set your face against the women of your people, who prophesy out of their own imagination. Prophesy against them

content: 18 and say: Thus said the Lord GOD: Woe to those who sew pads on all arm-joints and make bonnets for the head of every person, in order to entrap! Can you hunt down lives among My people, while you preserve your own lives?
content_old: 18 and say: Thus said the Lord GOD: Woe to those who sew pads on all arm-joints and make bonnets for the head of every person, in order to entrap! Can you hunt down lives among My people, while you preserve your own lives?

content: 19 You have profaned My name among My people in return for handfuls of barley and morsels of bread; you have announced the death of persons who will not die and the survival of persons who will not live—lying to My people, who listen to your lies.
content_old: 19 You have profaned My name among My people in return for handfuls of barley and morsels of bread; you have announced the death of persons who will not die and the survival of persons who will not live—lying to My people, who listen to your lies.
