content: 20 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to deal with your pads, by which you hunt down lives like birds, and I will tear them from your arms and free the persons whose lives you hunt down like birds.
content_old: 20 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to deal with your pads, by which you hunt down lives like birds, and I will tear them from your arms and free the persons whose lives you hunt down like birds.

content: 21 I will tear off your bonnets and rescue My people from your hands, and they shall no longer be prey in your hands; then you shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 21 I will tear off your bonnets and rescue My people from your hands, and they shall no longer be prey in your hands; then you shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 22 Because you saddened the heart of the innocent with lies, when I would not inflict suffering on him, and encouraged the wicked not to repent of his evil ways and so gain life—
content_old: 22 Because you saddened the heart of the innocent with lies, when I would not inflict suffering on him, and encouraged the wicked not to repent of his evil ways and so gain life—

content: 1 Certain elders of Israel came to me and sat down before me.
content_old: 1 Certain elders of Israel came to me and sat down before me.

content: 2 And the word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 2 And the word of the LORD came to me:

content: 3 O mortal, these men have turned their thoughts upon their fetishes and set their minds upon the sin through which they stumbled: Shall I respond to their inquiry?
content_old: 3 O mortal, these men have turned their thoughts upon their fetishes and set their minds upon the sin through which they stumbled: Shall I respond to their inquiry?

content: 4 Now speak to them and tell them: Thus said the Lord GOD: If anyone of the House of Israel turns his thoughts upon his fetishes and sets his mind upon the sin through which he stumbled, and yet comes to the prophet, I the LORD will respond to him as he comes with his multitude of fetishes.
content_old: 4 Now speak to them and tell them: Thus said the Lord GOD: If anyone of the House of Israel turns his thoughts upon his fetishes and sets his mind upon the sin through which he stumbled, and yet comes to the prophet, I the LORD will respond to him as he comes with his multitude of fetishes.

content: 5 Thus I will hold the House of Israel to account for their thoughts, because they have all been estranged from Me through their fetishes.
content_old: 5 Thus I will hold the House of Israel to account for their thoughts, because they have all been estranged from Me through their fetishes.

content: 6 Now say to the House of Israel: Thus said the Lord GOD: Repent, and turn back from your fetishes and turn your minds away from all your abominations.
content_old: 6 Now say to the House of Israel: Thus said the Lord GOD: Repent, and turn back from your fetishes and turn your minds away from all your abominations.

content: 7 For if any man of the House of Israel, or of the strangers who dwell in Israel, breaks away from Me and turns his thoughts upon his fetishes and sets his mind upon the sins through which he stumbled, and then goes to the prophet to inquire of Me through him, I the LORD will respond to him directly.
content_old: 7 For if any man of the House of Israel, or of the strangers who dwell in Israel, breaks away from Me and turns his thoughts upon his fetishes and sets his mind upon the sins through which he stumbled, and then goes to the prophet to inquire of Me through him, I the LORD will respond to him directly.

content: 8 I will set My face against that man and make him a sign and a byword, and I will cut him off from the midst of My people. Then you shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 8 I will set My face against that man and make him a sign and a byword, and I will cut him off from the midst of My people. Then you shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 9 And if a prophet is seduced and does speak a word, it was I the LORD who seduced that prophet; I will stretch out My hand against him and destroy him from among My people Israel.
content_old: 9 And if a prophet is seduced and does speak a word, it was I the LORD who seduced that prophet; I will stretch out My hand against him and destroy him from among My people Israel.

content: 10 Thus they shall bear their punishment: The punishment of the inquirer and the punishment of the prophet shall be the same,
content_old: 10 Thus they shall bear their punishment: The punishment of the inquirer and the punishment of the prophet shall be the same,

content: 11 so that the House of Israel may never again stray from Me and defile itself with all its transgressions. Then they shall be My people and I will be their God—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 11 so that the House of Israel may never again stray from Me and defile itself with all its transgressions. Then they shall be My people and I will be their God—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 12 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 12 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 13 O mortal, if a land were to sin against Me and commit a trespass, and I stretched out My hand against it and broke its staff of bread, and sent famine against it and cut off man and beast from it,
content_old: 13 O mortal, if a land were to sin against Me and commit a trespass, and I stretched out My hand against it and broke its staff of bread, and sent famine against it and cut off man and beast from it,

content: 14 even if these three men—Noah, Daniel, and Job—should be in it, they would by their righteousness save only themselves—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 14 even if these three men—Noah, Daniel, and Job—should be in it, they would by their righteousness save only themselves—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 15 Or, if I were to send wild beasts to roam the land and they depopulated it, and it became a desolation with none passing through it because of the beasts,
content_old: 15 Or, if I were to send wild beasts to roam the land and they depopulated it, and it became a desolation with none passing through it because of the beasts,

content: 16 as I live—declares the Lord GOD—those three men in it would save neither sons nor daughters; they alone would be saved, but the land would become a desolation.
content_old: 16 as I live—declares the Lord GOD—those three men in it would save neither sons nor daughters; they alone would be saved, but the land would become a desolation.

content: 17 Or, if I were to bring the sword upon that land and say, “Let a sword sweep through the land so that I may cut off from it man and beast,”
content_old: 17 Or, if I were to bring the sword upon that land and say, “Let a sword sweep through the land so that I may cut off from it man and beast,”

content: 18 if those three men should be in it, as I live—declares the Lord GOD—they would save neither sons nor daughters, but they alone would be saved.
content_old: 18 if those three men should be in it, as I live—declares the Lord GOD—they would save neither sons nor daughters, but they alone would be saved.

content: 19 Or, if I let loose a pestilence against that land, and poured out My fury upon it in blood, cutting off from it man and beast,
content_old: 19 Or, if I let loose a pestilence against that land, and poured out My fury upon it in blood, cutting off from it man and beast,

content: 20 should Noah, Daniel, and Job be in it, as I live—declares the Lord GOD—they would save neither son nor daughter; they would save themselves alone by their righteousness.
content_old: 20 should Noah, Daniel, and Job be in it, as I live—declares the Lord GOD—they would save neither son nor daughter; they would save themselves alone by their righteousness.

content: 21 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: How much less now that I have let loose against Jerusalem all four of My terrible punishments—the sword, famine, wild beasts, and pestilence—to cut off man and beast from it!
content_old: 21 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: How much less now that I have let loose against Jerusalem all four of My terrible punishments—the sword, famine, wild beasts, and pestilence—to cut off man and beast from it!

content: 22 Yet there are survivors left of it, sons and daughters who are being brought out. They are coming out to you; and when you see their ways and their deeds, you will be consoled for the disaster that I brought on Jerusalem, for all that I brought on it.
content_old: 22 Yet there are survivors left of it, sons and daughters who are being brought out. They are coming out to you; and when you see their ways and their deeds, you will be consoled for the disaster that I brought on Jerusalem, for all that I brought on it.

content: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 O mortal, how is the wood of the grapevine better than the wood of any branch to be found among the trees of the forest?
content_old: 2 O mortal, how is the wood of the grapevine better than the wood of any branch to be found among the trees of the forest?

content: 3 Can wood be taken from it for use in any work? Can one take a peg from it to hang any vessel on?
content_old: 3 Can wood be taken from it for use in any work? Can one take a peg from it to hang any vessel on?

content: 4 Now suppose it was thrown into the fire as fuel and the fire consumed its two ends and its middle was charred—is it good for any use?
content_old: 4 Now suppose it was thrown into the fire as fuel and the fire consumed its two ends and its middle was charred—is it good for any use?

content: 5 Even when it was whole it could not be used for anything; how much less when fire has consumed it and it is charred! Can it still be used for anything?
content_old: 5 Even when it was whole it could not be used for anything; how much less when fire has consumed it and it is charred! Can it still be used for anything?

content: 6 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: Like the wood of the grapevine among the trees of the forest, which I have designated to be fuel for fire, so will I treat the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
content_old: 6 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: Like the wood of the grapevine among the trees of the forest, which I have designated to be fuel for fire, so will I treat the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

content: 7 I will set My face against them; they escaped from fire, but fire shall consume them. When I set my face against them, you shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 7 I will set My face against them; they escaped from fire, but fire shall consume them. When I set my face against them, you shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 O mortal, proclaim Jerusalem’s abominations to her,
content_old: 2 O mortal, proclaim Jerusalem’s abominations to her,

content: 3 and say: Thus said the Lord GOD to Jerusalem: By origin and birth you are from the land of the Canaanites—your father was an Amorite and your mother a Hittite.
content_old: 3 and say: Thus said the Lord GOD to Jerusalem: By origin and birth you are from the land of the Canaanites—your father was an Amorite and your mother a Hittite.

content: 4 As for your birth, when you were born your navel cord was not cut, and you were not bathed in water to smooth you; you were not rubbed with salt, nor were you swaddled.
content_old: 4 As for your birth, when you were born your navel cord was not cut, and you were not bathed in water to smooth you; you were not rubbed with salt, nor were you swaddled.

content: 5 No one pitied you enough to do any one of these things for you out of compassion for you; on the day you were born, you were left lying, rejected, in the open field.
content_old: 5 No one pitied you enough to do any one of these things for you out of compassion for you; on the day you were born, you were left lying, rejected, in the open field.

content: 6 When I passed by you and saw you wallowing in your blood, I said to you: “Live in spite of your blood.” Yea, I said to you: “Live in spite of your blood.”
content_old: 6 When I passed by you and saw you wallowing in your blood, I said to you: “Live in spite of your blood.” Yea, I said to you: “Live in spite of your blood.”

content: 7 I let you grow like the plants of the field; and you continued to grow up until you attained to womanhood, until your breasts became firm and your hair sprouted. You were still naked and bare
content_old: 7 I let you grow like the plants of the field; and you continued to grow up until you attained to womanhood, until your breasts became firm and your hair sprouted. You were still naked and bare

content: 8 when I passed by you again and saw that your time for love had arrived. So I spread My robe over you and covered your nakedness, and I entered into a covenant with you by oath—declares the Lord GOD; thus you became Mine.
content_old: 8 when I passed by you again and saw that your time for love had arrived. So I spread My robe over you and covered your nakedness, and I entered into a covenant with you by oath—declares the Lord GOD; thus you became Mine.

content: 9 I bathed you in water, and washed the blood off you, and anointed you with oil.
content_old: 9 I bathed you in water, and washed the blood off you, and anointed you with oil.

content: 10 I clothed you with embroidered garments, and gave you sandals of tahash-leather to wear, and wound fine linen about your head, and dressed you in silks.
content_old: 10 I clothed you with embroidered garments, and gave you sandals of tahash-leather to wear, and wound fine linen about your head, and dressed you in silks.

content: 11 I decked you out in finery and put bracelets on your arms and a chain around your neck.
content_old: 11 I decked you out in finery and put bracelets on your arms and a chain around your neck.

content: 12 I put a ring in your nose, and earrings in your ears, and a splendid crown on your head.
content_old: 12 I put a ring in your nose, and earrings in your ears, and a splendid crown on your head.

content: 13 You adorned yourself with gold and silver, and your apparel was of fine linen, silk, and embroidery. Your food was choice flour, honey, and oil. You grew more and more beautiful, and became fit for royalty.
content_old: 13 You adorned yourself with gold and silver, and your apparel was of fine linen, silk, and embroidery. Your food was choice flour, honey, and oil. You grew more and more beautiful, and became fit for royalty.

content: 14 Your beauty won you fame among the nations, for it was perfected through the splendor which I set upon you��declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 14 Your beauty won you fame among the nations, for it was perfected through the splendor which I set upon you��declares the Lord GOD.

content: 15 But confident in your beauty and fame, you played the harlot: you lavished your favors on every passerby; they were his.
content_old: 15 But confident in your beauty and fame, you played the harlot: you lavished your favors on every passerby; they were his.

content: 16 You even took some of your cloths and made yourself tapestried platforms and fornicated on them—not in the future; not in time to come.
content_old: 16 You even took some of your cloths and made yourself tapestried platforms and fornicated on them—not in the future; not in time to come.

content: 17 You took your beautiful things, made of the gold and silver that I had given you, and you made yourself phallic images and fornicated with them.
content_old: 17 You took your beautiful things, made of the gold and silver that I had given you, and you made yourself phallic images and fornicated with them.

content: 18 You took your embroidered cloths to cover them; and you set My oil and My incense before them.
content_old: 18 You took your embroidered cloths to cover them; and you set My oil and My incense before them.

content: 19 The food that I had given you—the choice flour, the oil, and the honey, which I had provided for you to eat—you set it before them for a pleasing odor. And so it went—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 19 The food that I had given you—the choice flour, the oil, and the honey, which I had provided for you to eat—you set it before them for a pleasing odor. And so it went—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 20 You even took the sons and daughters that you bore to Me and sacrificed them to those as food—as if your harlotries were not enough,
content_old: 20 You even took the sons and daughters that you bore to Me and sacrificed them to those as food—as if your harlotries were not enough,

content: 21 you slaughtered My children and presented them as offerings to them!
content_old: 21 you slaughtered My children and presented them as offerings to them!

content: 22 In all your abominations and harlotries, you did not remember the days of your youth, when you were naked and bare, and lay wallowing in your blood.
content_old: 22 In all your abominations and harlotries, you did not remember the days of your youth, when you were naked and bare, and lay wallowing in your blood.

content: 23 After all your wickedness (woe, woe to you!)—declares the Lord GOD—
content_old: 23 After all your wickedness (woe, woe to you!)—declares the Lord GOD—

content: 24 you built yourself an eminence and made yourself a mound in every square.
content_old: 24 you built yourself an eminence and made yourself a mound in every square.

content: 25 You built your mound at every crossroad; and you sullied your beauty and spread your legs to every passerby, and you multiplied your harlotries.
content_old: 25 You built your mound at every crossroad; and you sullied your beauty and spread your legs to every passerby, and you multiplied your harlotries.

content: 26 You played the whore with your neighbors, the lustful Egyptians—you multiplied your harlotries to anger Me.
content_old: 26 You played the whore with your neighbors, the lustful Egyptians—you multiplied your harlotries to anger Me.

content: 27 Now, I will stretch out My arm against you and withhold your maintenance; and I will surrender you to the will of your enemies, the Philistine women, who are shocked by your lewd behavior.
content_old: 27 Now, I will stretch out My arm against you and withhold your maintenance; and I will surrender you to the will of your enemies, the Philistine women, who are shocked by your lewd behavior.

content: 28 In your insatiable lust you also played the whore with the Assyrians; you played the whore with them, but were still unsated.
content_old: 28 In your insatiable lust you also played the whore with the Assyrians; you played the whore with them, but were still unsated.

content: 29 You multiplied your harlotries with Chaldea, that land of traders; yet even with this you were not satisfied.
content_old: 29 You multiplied your harlotries with Chaldea, that land of traders; yet even with this you were not satisfied.

content: 30 How sick was your heart—declares the Lord GOD—when you did all those things, the acts of a self-willed whore,
content_old: 30 How sick was your heart—declares the Lord GOD—when you did all those things, the acts of a self-willed whore,

content: 31 building your eminence at every crossroad and setting your mound in every square! Yet you were not like a prostitute, for you spurned fees;
content_old: 31 building your eminence at every crossroad and setting your mound in every square! Yet you were not like a prostitute, for you spurned fees;

content: 32 the adulterous wife who welcomes strangers instead of her husband.
content_old: 32 the adulterous wife who welcomes strangers instead of her husband.

content: 33 Gifts are made to all prostitutes, but you made gifts to all your lovers, and bribed them to come to you from every quarter for your harlotries.
content_old: 33 Gifts are made to all prostitutes, but you made gifts to all your lovers, and bribed them to come to you from every quarter for your harlotries.

content: 34 You were the opposite of other women: you solicited instead of being solicited; you paid fees instead of being paid fees. Thus you were just the opposite!
content_old: 34 You were the opposite of other women: you solicited instead of being solicited; you paid fees instead of being paid fees. Thus you were just the opposite!

content: 35 Now, O harlot, hear the word of the LORD.
content_old: 35 Now, O harlot, hear the word of the LORD.

content: 36 Thus said the Lord GOD: Because of your brazen effrontery, offering your nakedness to your lovers for harlotry—just like the blood of your children, which you gave to all your abominable fetishes:—
content_old: 36 Thus said the Lord GOD: Because of your brazen effrontery, offering your nakedness to your lovers for harlotry—just like the blood of your children, which you gave to all your abominable fetishes:—

content: 37 I will assuredly assemble all the lovers to whom you gave your favors, along with everybody you accepted and everybody you rejected. I will assemble them against you from every quarter, and I will expose your nakedness to them, and they shall see all your nakedness.
content_old: 37 I will assuredly assemble all the lovers to whom you gave your favors, along with everybody you accepted and everybody you rejected. I will assemble them against you from every quarter, and I will expose your nakedness to them, and they shall see all your nakedness.

content: 38 I will inflict upon you the punishment of women who commit adultery and murder, and I will direct bloody and impassioned fury against you.
content_old: 38 I will inflict upon you the punishment of women who commit adultery and murder, and I will direct bloody and impassioned fury against you.

content: 39 I will deliver you into their hands, and they shall tear down your eminence and level your mounds; and they shall strip you of your clothing and take away your dazzling jewels, leaving you naked and bare.
content_old: 39 I will deliver you into their hands, and they shall tear down your eminence and level your mounds; and they shall strip you of your clothing and take away your dazzling jewels, leaving you naked and bare.

content: 40 Then they shall assemble a mob against you to pelt you with stones and pierce you with their swords.
content_old: 40 Then they shall assemble a mob against you to pelt you with stones and pierce you with their swords.

content: 41 They shall put your houses to the flames and execute punishment upon you in the sight of many women; thus I will put a stop to your harlotry, and you shall pay no more fees.
content_old: 41 They shall put your houses to the flames and execute punishment upon you in the sight of many women; thus I will put a stop to your harlotry, and you shall pay no more fees.

content: 42 When I have satisfied My fury upon you and My rage has departed from you, then I will be tranquil; I will be angry no more.
content_old: 42 When I have satisfied My fury upon you and My rage has departed from you, then I will be tranquil; I will be angry no more.

content: 43 Because you did not remember the days of your youth, but infuriated Me with all those things, I will pay you back for your conduct—declares the Lord GOD. Have you not committed depravity on top of all your other abominations?
content_old: 43 Because you did not remember the days of your youth, but infuriated Me with all those things, I will pay you back for your conduct—declares the Lord GOD. Have you not committed depravity on top of all your other abominations?

content: 44 Why, everyone who uses proverbs applies to you the proverb “Like mother, like daughter.”
content_old: 44 Why, everyone who uses proverbs applies to you the proverb “Like mother, like daughter.”

content: 45 You are the daughter of your mother, who rejected her husband and children. And you are the sister of your sisters, who rejected their husbands and children; for you are daughters of a Hittite mother and an Amorite father.
content_old: 45 You are the daughter of your mother, who rejected her husband and children. And you are the sister of your sisters, who rejected their husbands and children; for you are daughters of a Hittite mother and an Amorite father.

content: 46 Your elder sister was Samaria, who lived with her daughters to the north of you; your younger sister was Sodom, who lived with her daughters to the south of you.
content_old: 46 Your elder sister was Samaria, who lived with her daughters to the north of you; your younger sister was Sodom, who lived with her daughters to the south of you.

content: 47 Did you not walk in their ways and practice their abominations? Why, you were almost more corrupt than they in all your ways.
content_old: 47 Did you not walk in their ways and practice their abominations? Why, you were almost more corrupt than they in all your ways.

content: 48 As I live—declares the Lord GOD—your sister Sodom and her daughters did not do what you and your daughters did.
content_old: 48 As I live—declares the Lord GOD—your sister Sodom and her daughters did not do what you and your daughters did.

content: 49 Only this was the sin of your sister Sodom: arrogance! She and her daughters had plenty of bread and untroubled tranquillity; yet she did not support the poor and the needy.
content_old: 49 Only this was the sin of your sister Sodom: arrogance! She and her daughters had plenty of bread and untroubled tranquillity; yet she did not support the poor and the needy.

content: 50 In their haughtiness, they committed abomination before Me; and so I removed them, as you saw.
content_old: 50 In their haughtiness, they committed abomination before Me; and so I removed them, as you saw.

content: 51 Nor did Samaria commit even half your sins. You committed more abominations than they, and by all the abominations that you committed you made your sisters look righteous.
content_old: 51 Nor did Samaria commit even half your sins. You committed more abominations than they, and by all the abominations that you committed you made your sisters look righteous.

content: 52 Truly, you must bear the disgrace of serving as your sisters’ advocate: Since you have sinned more abominably than they, they appear righteous in comparison. So be ashamed and bear your disgrace, because you have made your sisters look righteous.
content_old: 52 Truly, you must bear the disgrace of serving as your sisters’ advocate: Since you have sinned more abominably than they, they appear righteous in comparison. So be ashamed and bear your disgrace, because you have made your sisters look righteous.

content: 53 I will restore their fortunes—the fortunes of Sodom and her daughters and the fortunes of Samaria and her daughters—and your fortunes along with theirs.
content_old: 53 I will restore their fortunes—the fortunes of Sodom and her daughters and the fortunes of Samaria and her daughters—and your fortunes along with theirs.

content: 54 Thus you shall bear your disgrace and feel your disgrace for behaving in such a way that they could take comfort.
content_old: 54 Thus you shall bear your disgrace and feel your disgrace for behaving in such a way that they could take comfort.

content: 55 Then your sister Sodom and her daughters shall return to their former state, and Samaria and her daughters shall return to their former state, and you and your daughters shall return to your former state.
content_old: 55 Then your sister Sodom and her daughters shall return to their former state, and Samaria and her daughters shall return to their former state, and you and your daughters shall return to your former state.

content: 56 Was not your sister Sodom a byword in your mouth in the days of your pride,
content_old: 56 Was not your sister Sodom a byword in your mouth in the days of your pride,

content: 57 before your own wickedness was exposed? So must you now bear the mockery of the daughters of Aram and all her neighbors, the daughters of Philistia who jeer at you on every side.
content_old: 57 before your own wickedness was exposed? So must you now bear the mockery of the daughters of Aram and all her neighbors, the daughters of Philistia who jeer at you on every side.

content: 58 You yourself must bear your depravity and your abominations—declares the LORD.
content_old: 58 You yourself must bear your depravity and your abominations—declares the LORD.

content: 59 Truly, thus said the Lord GOD: I will deal with you as you have dealt, for you have spurned the pact and violated the covenant.
content_old: 59 Truly, thus said the Lord GOD: I will deal with you as you have dealt, for you have spurned the pact and violated the covenant.

content: 60 Nevertheless, I will remember the covenant I made with you in the days of your youth, and I will establish it with you as an everlasting covenant.
content_old: 60 Nevertheless, I will remember the covenant I made with you in the days of your youth, and I will establish it with you as an everlasting covenant.

content: 61 You shall remember your ways and feel ashamed, when you receive your older sisters and your younger sisters, and I give them to you as daughters, though they are not of your covenant.
content_old: 61 You shall remember your ways and feel ashamed, when you receive your older sisters and your younger sisters, and I give them to you as daughters, though they are not of your covenant.

content: 62 I will establish My covenant with you, and you shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 62 I will establish My covenant with you, and you shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 O mortal, propound a riddle and relate an allegory to the House of Israel.
content_old: 2 O mortal, propound a riddle and relate an allegory to the House of Israel.

content: 3 Say: Thus said the Lord GOD: The great eagle with the great wings and the long pinions, with the full plumage and the brilliant colors, came to the Lebanon range and seized the top of the cedar.
content_old: 3 Say: Thus said the Lord GOD: The great eagle with the great wings and the long pinions, with the full plumage and the brilliant colors, came to the Lebanon range and seized the top of the cedar.

content: 4 He plucked off its topmost bough and carried it off to the land of traders and set it in a city of merchants.
content_old: 4 He plucked off its topmost bough and carried it off to the land of traders and set it in a city of merchants.

content: 5 He then took some of the seed of the land and planted it in a fertile field; he planted and set it like a willow beside abundant waters.
content_old: 5 He then took some of the seed of the land and planted it in a fertile field; he planted and set it like a willow beside abundant waters.

content: 6 It grew and became a spreading vine of low stature; it became a vine, produced branches, and sent out boughs. that its twigs should turn to him, and that its roots should stay under him.
content_old: 6 It grew and became a spreading vine of low stature; it became a vine, produced branches, and sent out boughs. that its twigs should turn to him, and that its roots should stay under him.

content: 7 But there was another great eagle with great wings and full plumage; and this vine now bent its roots in his direction and sent out its twigs toward him, that he might water it more than the bed where it was planted—
content_old: 7 But there was another great eagle with great wings and full plumage; and this vine now bent its roots in his direction and sent out its twigs toward him, that he might water it more than the bed where it was planted—

content: 8 though it was planted in rich soil beside abundant water—so that it might grow branches and produce boughs and be a noble vine.
content_old: 8 though it was planted in rich soil beside abundant water—so that it might grow branches and produce boughs and be a noble vine.

content: 9 Say: Thus said the Lord GOD: Will it thrive? Will he not tear out its roots and rip off its crown, so that its entire foliage withers? It shall wither, despite any strong arm or mighty army to remove it from its roots.
content_old: 9 Say: Thus said the Lord GOD: Will it thrive? Will he not tear out its roots and rip off its crown, so that its entire foliage withers? It shall wither, despite any strong arm or mighty army to remove it from its roots.

content: 10 And suppose it is transplanted, will it thrive? When the east wind strikes it, it shall wither—wither upon the bed where it is growing.
content_old: 10 And suppose it is transplanted, will it thrive? When the east wind strikes it, it shall wither—wither upon the bed where it is growing.

content: 11 Then the word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 11 Then the word of the LORD came to me:

content: 12 Say to the rebellious breed: Do you not know what these things mean? Say: The king of Babylon came to Jerusalem, and carried away its king and its officers and brought them back with him to Babylon.
content_old: 12 Say to the rebellious breed: Do you not know what these things mean? Say: The king of Babylon came to Jerusalem, and carried away its king and its officers and brought them back with him to Babylon.

content: 13 He took one of the seed royal and made a covenant with him and imposed an oath on him, and he carried away the nobles of the land—
content_old: 13 He took one of the seed royal and made a covenant with him and imposed an oath on him, and he carried away the nobles of the land—

content: 14 so that it might be a humble kingdom and not exalt itself, but keep his covenant and so endure.
content_old: 14 so that it might be a humble kingdom and not exalt itself, but keep his covenant and so endure.

content: 15 But rebelled against him and sent his envoys to Egypt to get horses and a large army. Will he succeed? Will he who does such things escape? Shall he break a covenant and escape?
content_old: 15 But rebelled against him and sent his envoys to Egypt to get horses and a large army. Will he succeed? Will he who does such things escape? Shall he break a covenant and escape?

content: 16 As I live—declares the Lord GOD—in the very homeland of the king who made him king, whose oath he flouted and whose covenant he broke—right there, in Babylon, he shall die.
content_old: 16 As I live—declares the Lord GOD—in the very homeland of the king who made him king, whose oath he flouted and whose covenant he broke—right there, in Babylon, he shall die.

content: 17 Pharaoh will not fight at his side with a great army and with numerous troops in the war, when mounds are thrown up and siege towers erected to destroy many lives.
content_old: 17 Pharaoh will not fight at his side with a great army and with numerous troops in the war, when mounds are thrown up and siege towers erected to destroy many lives.

content: 18 He flouted a pact and broke a covenant; he gave his promise and did all these things—he shall not escape.
content_old: 18 He flouted a pact and broke a covenant; he gave his promise and did all these things—he shall not escape.

content: 19 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: As I live, I will pay him back for flouting My pact and breaking My covenant.
content_old: 19 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: As I live, I will pay him back for flouting My pact and breaking My covenant.

content: 20 I will spread My net over him and he shall be caught in My snare; I will carry him to Babylon and enter with him into judgment there for the trespass which he committed against Me.
content_old: 20 I will spread My net over him and he shall be caught in My snare; I will carry him to Babylon and enter with him into judgment there for the trespass which he committed against Me.

content: 21 And all the fugitives of all his battalions shall fall by the sword, and those who remain shall scatter in every direction; then you will know that I the LORD have spoken.
content_old: 21 And all the fugitives of all his battalions shall fall by the sword, and those who remain shall scatter in every direction; then you will know that I the LORD have spoken.

content: 22 Thus said the Lord GOD: Then I in turn will take and set from the lofty top of the cedar; I will pluck a tender twig from the tip of its crown, and I will plant it on a tall, towering mountain.
content_old: 22 Thus said the Lord GOD: Then I in turn will take and set from the lofty top of the cedar; I will pluck a tender twig from the tip of its crown, and I will plant it on a tall, towering mountain.

content: 23 I will plant it in Israel’s lofty highlands, and it shall bring forth boughs and produce branches and grow into a noble cedar. Every bird of every feather shall take shelter under it, shelter in the shade of its boughs.
content_old: 23 I will plant it in Israel’s lofty highlands, and it shall bring forth boughs and produce branches and grow into a noble cedar. Every bird of every feather shall take shelter under it, shelter in the shade of its boughs.

content: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 What do you mean by quoting this proverb upon the soil of Israel, “Parents eat sour grapes and their children’s teeth are blunted”?
content_old: 2 What do you mean by quoting this proverb upon the soil of Israel, “Parents eat sour grapes and their children’s teeth are blunted”?

content: 3 As I live—declares the Lord GOD—this proverb shall no longer be current among you in Israel.
content_old: 3 As I live—declares the Lord GOD—this proverb shall no longer be current among you in Israel.

content: 4 Consider, all lives are Mine; the life of the parent and the life of the child are both Mine. The person who sins, only he shall die.
content_old: 4 Consider, all lives are Mine; the life of the parent and the life of the child are both Mine. The person who sins, only he shall die.

content: 5 Thus, if a man is righteous and does what is just and right:
content_old: 5 Thus, if a man is righteous and does what is just and right:

content: 6 If he has not eaten on the mountains or raised his eyes to the fetishes of the House of Israel; if he has not defiled another man’s wife or approached a menstruous woman;
content_old: 6 If he has not eaten on the mountains or raised his eyes to the fetishes of the House of Israel; if he has not defiled another man’s wife or approached a menstruous woman;

content: 7 if he has not wronged anyone; if he has returned the debtor’s pledge to him and has taken nothing by robbery; if he has given bread to the hungry and clothed the naked;
content_old: 7 if he has not wronged anyone; if he has returned the debtor’s pledge to him and has taken nothing by robbery; if he has given bread to the hungry and clothed the naked;

content: 8 if he has not lent at advance interest or exacted accrued interest; if he has abstained from wrongdoing and executed true justice between man and man;
content_old: 8 if he has not lent at advance interest or exacted accrued interest; if he has abstained from wrongdoing and executed true justice between man and man;

content: 9 if he has followed My laws and kept My rules and acted honestly—he is righteous. Such a man shall live—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 9 if he has followed My laws and kept My rules and acted honestly—he is righteous. Such a man shall live—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 10 Suppose, now, that he has begotten a son who is a ruffian, a shedder of blood, who does any of these things,
content_old: 10 Suppose, now, that he has begotten a son who is a ruffian, a shedder of blood, who does any of these things,

content: 11 whereas he himself did none of these things. That is, the son has eaten on the mountains, has defiled another man’s wife,
content_old: 11 whereas he himself did none of these things. That is, the son has eaten on the mountains, has defiled another man’s wife,

content: 12 has wronged the poor and the needy, has taken by robbery, has not returned a pledge, has raised his eyes to the fetishes, has committed abomination,
content_old: 12 has wronged the poor and the needy, has taken by robbery, has not returned a pledge, has raised his eyes to the fetishes, has committed abomination,

content: 13 has lent at advance interest, or exacted accrued interest—shall he live? He shall not live! If he has committed any of these abominations, he shall die; he has forfeited his life.
content_old: 13 has lent at advance interest, or exacted accrued interest—shall he live? He shall not live! If he has committed any of these abominations, he shall die; he has forfeited his life.

content: 14 Now suppose that he, in turn, has begotten a son who has seen all the sins that his father committed, but has taken heed and has not imitated them:
content_old: 14 Now suppose that he, in turn, has begotten a son who has seen all the sins that his father committed, but has taken heed and has not imitated them:

content: 15 He has not eaten on the mountains or raised his eyes to the fetishes of the House of Israel; he has not defiled another man’s wife;
content_old: 15 He has not eaten on the mountains or raised his eyes to the fetishes of the House of Israel; he has not defiled another man’s wife;

content: 16 he has not wronged anyone; he has not seized a pledge or taken anything by robbery; he has given his bread to the hungry and clothed the naked;
content_old: 16 he has not wronged anyone; he has not seized a pledge or taken anything by robbery; he has given his bread to the hungry and clothed the naked;

content: 17 he has refrained from oppressing the poor; he has not exacted advance or accrued interest; he has obeyed My rules and followed My laws—he shall not die for the iniquity of his father, but shall live.
content_old: 17 he has refrained from oppressing the poor; he has not exacted advance or accrued interest; he has obeyed My rules and followed My laws—he shall not die for the iniquity of his father, but shall live.

content: 18 To be sure, his father, because he practiced fraud, robbed his brother, and acted wickedly among his kin, did die for his iniquity;
content_old: 18 To be sure, his father, because he practiced fraud, robbed his brother, and acted wickedly among his kin, did die for his iniquity;

content: 19 and now you ask, “Why has not the son shared the burden of his father’s guilt?” But the son has done what is right and just, and has carefully kept all My laws: he shall live!
content_old: 19 and now you ask, “Why has not the son shared the burden of his father’s guilt?” But the son has done what is right and just, and has carefully kept all My laws: he shall live!

content: 20 The person who sins, he alone shall die. A child shall not share the burden of a parent’s guilt, nor shall a parent share the burden of a child’s guilt; the righteousness of the righteous shall be accounted to him alone, and the wickedness of the wicked shall be accounted to him alone.
content_old: 20 The person who sins, he alone shall die. A child shall not share the burden of a parent’s guilt, nor shall a parent share the burden of a child’s guilt; the righteousness of the righteous shall be accounted to him alone, and the wickedness of the wicked shall be accounted to him alone.

content: 21 Moreover, if the wicked one repents of all the sins that he committed and keeps all My laws and does what is just and right, he shall live; he shall not die.
content_old: 21 Moreover, if the wicked one repents of all the sins that he committed and keeps all My laws and does what is just and right, he shall live; he shall not die.

content: 22 None of the transgressions he committed shall be remembered against him; because of the righteousness he has practiced, he shall live.
content_old: 22 None of the transgressions he committed shall be remembered against him; because of the righteousness he has practiced, he shall live.

content: 23 Is it my desire that a wicked person shall die?—says the Lord GOD. It is rather that he shall turn back from his ways and live.
content_old: 23 Is it my desire that a wicked person shall die?—says the Lord GOD. It is rather that he shall turn back from his ways and live.

content: 24 So, too, if a righteous person turns away from his righteousness and does wrong, practicing the very abominations that the wicked person practiced, shall he live? None of the righteous deeds that he did shall be remembered; because of the treachery he has practiced and the sins he has committed—because of these, he shall die.
content_old: 24 So, too, if a righteous person turns away from his righteousness and does wrong, practicing the very abominations that the wicked person practiced, shall he live? None of the righteous deeds that he did shall be remembered; because of the treachery he has practiced and the sins he has committed—because of these, he shall die.

content: 25 Yet you say, “The way of the Lord is unfair.” Listen, O House of Israel: Is My way unfair? It is your ways that are unfair!
content_old: 25 Yet you say, “The way of the Lord is unfair.” Listen, O House of Israel: Is My way unfair? It is your ways that are unfair!

content: 26 When a righteous person turns away from his righteousness and does wrong, he shall die for it; he shall die for the wrong he has done.
content_old: 26 When a righteous person turns away from his righteousness and does wrong, he shall die for it; he shall die for the wrong he has done.

content: 27 And if a wicked person turns back from the wickedness that he practiced and does what is just and right, such a person shall save his life.
content_old: 27 And if a wicked person turns back from the wickedness that he practiced and does what is just and right, such a person shall save his life.

content: 28 Because he took heed and turned back from all the transgressions that he committed, he shall live; he shall not die.
content_old: 28 Because he took heed and turned back from all the transgressions that he committed, he shall live; he shall not die.

content: 29 Yet the House of Israel say, “The way of the LORD is unfair.” Are My ways unfair, O House of Israel? It is your ways that are unfair!
content_old: 29 Yet the House of Israel say, “The way of the LORD is unfair.” Are My ways unfair, O House of Israel? It is your ways that are unfair!

content: 30 Be assured, O House of Israel, I will judge each one of you according to his ways—declares the Lord GOD. Repent and turn back from your transgressions; let them not be a stumbling block of guilt for you.
content_old: 30 Be assured, O House of Israel, I will judge each one of you according to his ways—declares the Lord GOD. Repent and turn back from your transgressions; let them not be a stumbling block of guilt for you.

content: 31 Cast away all the transgressions by which you have offended, and get yourselves a new heart and a new spirit, that you may not die, O House of Israel.
content_old: 31 Cast away all the transgressions by which you have offended, and get yourselves a new heart and a new spirit, that you may not die, O House of Israel.

content: 1 And you are to intone a dirge over the princes of Israel,
content_old: 1 And you are to intone a dirge over the princes of Israel,

content: 2 and say: What a lioness was your mother Among the lions! Crouching among the great beasts, She reared her cubs.
content_old: 2 and say: What a lioness was your mother Among the lions! Crouching among the great beasts, She reared her cubs.

content: 3 She raised up one of her cubs, He became a great beast; He learned to hunt prey— He devoured men.
content_old: 3 She raised up one of her cubs, He became a great beast; He learned to hunt prey— He devoured men.

content: 4 Nations heeded the call against him; He was caught in their snare. They dragged him off with hooks To the land of Egypt.
content_old: 4 Nations heeded the call against him; He was caught in their snare. They dragged him off with hooks To the land of Egypt.

content: 5 When she saw herself frustrated, Her hope defeated, She took another of her cubs And set him up as a great beast.
content_old: 5 When she saw herself frustrated, Her hope defeated, She took another of her cubs And set him up as a great beast.

content: 6 He stalked among the lions, He was a great beast; He learned to hunt prey— He devoured men.
content_old: 6 He stalked among the lions, He was a great beast; He learned to hunt prey— He devoured men.

content: 7 He ravished their widows, Laid waste their cities; The land and all in it were appalled At the sound of his roaring.
content_old: 7 He ravished their widows, Laid waste their cities; The land and all in it were appalled At the sound of his roaring.

content: 8 Nations from the countries roundabout Arrayed themselves against him. They spread their net over him, He was caught in their snare.
content_old: 8 Nations from the countries roundabout Arrayed themselves against him. They spread their net over him, He was caught in their snare.

content: 9 With hooks he was put in a cage, They carried him off to the king of Babylon And confined him in a fortress, So that never again should his roar be heard On the hills of Israel.
content_old: 9 With hooks he was put in a cage, They carried him off to the king of Babylon And confined him in a fortress, So that never again should his roar be heard On the hills of Israel.

content: 10 Your mother was like a vine in your blood, Planted beside streams, With luxuriant boughs and branches Thanks to abundant waters.
content_old: 10 Your mother was like a vine in your blood, Planted beside streams, With luxuriant boughs and branches Thanks to abundant waters.

content: 11 And she had a mighty rod Fit for a ruler’s scepter. It towered highest among the leafy trees, It was conspicuous by its height, By the abundance of its boughs.
content_old: 11 And she had a mighty rod Fit for a ruler’s scepter. It towered highest among the leafy trees, It was conspicuous by its height, By the abundance of its boughs.

content: 12 But plucked up in a fury, She was hurled to the ground. The east wind withered her branches, They broke apart and dried up; And her mighty rod was consumed by fire.
content_old: 12 But plucked up in a fury, She was hurled to the ground. The east wind withered her branches, They broke apart and dried up; And her mighty rod was consumed by fire.

content: 13 Now she is planted in the desert, In ground that is arid and parched.
content_old: 13 Now she is planted in the desert, In ground that is arid and parched.

content: 1 In the seventh year, on the tenth day of the fifth month, certain elders of Israel came to inquire of the LORD, and sat down before me.
content_old: 1 In the seventh year, on the tenth day of the fifth month, certain elders of Israel came to inquire of the LORD, and sat down before me.

content: 2 And the word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 2 And the word of the LORD came to me:

content: 3 O mortal, speak to the elders of Israel and say to them: Thus said the Lord GOD: Have you come to inquire of Me? As I live, I will not respond to your inquiry—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 3 O mortal, speak to the elders of Israel and say to them: Thus said the Lord GOD: Have you come to inquire of Me? As I live, I will not respond to your inquiry—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 4 Arraign, arraign them, O mortal! Declare to them the abhorrent deeds of their fathers.
content_old: 4 Arraign, arraign them, O mortal! Declare to them the abhorrent deeds of their fathers.

content: 5 Say to them: Thus said the Lord GOD: On the day that I chose Israel, I gave My oath to the stock of the House of Jacob; when I made Myself known to them in the land of Egypt, I gave my oath to them. When I said, “I the LORD am your God,”
content_old: 5 Say to them: Thus said the Lord GOD: On the day that I chose Israel, I gave My oath to the stock of the House of Jacob; when I made Myself known to them in the land of Egypt, I gave my oath to them. When I said, “I the LORD am your God,”

content: 6 that same day I swore to them to take them out of the land of Egypt into a land flowing with milk and honey, a land which I had sought out for them, the fairest of all lands.
content_old: 6 that same day I swore to them to take them out of the land of Egypt into a land flowing with milk and honey, a land which I had sought out for them, the fairest of all lands.

content: 7 I also said to them: Cast away, every one of you, the detestable things that you are drawn to, and do not defile yourselves with the fetishes of Egypt—I the LORD am your God.
content_old: 7 I also said to them: Cast away, every one of you, the detestable things that you are drawn to, and do not defile yourselves with the fetishes of Egypt—I the LORD am your God.

content: 8 But they defied Me and refused to listen to Me. They did not cast away the detestable things they were drawn to, nor did they give up the fetishes of Egypt. Then I resolved to pour out My fury upon them, to vent all My anger upon them there, in the land of Egypt.
content_old: 8 But they defied Me and refused to listen to Me. They did not cast away the detestable things they were drawn to, nor did they give up the fetishes of Egypt. Then I resolved to pour out My fury upon them, to vent all My anger upon them there, in the land of Egypt.

content: 9 But I acted for the sake of My name, that it might not be profaned in the sight of the nations among whom they were. For it was before their eyes that I had made Myself known to Israel to bring them out of the land of Egypt.
content_old: 9 But I acted for the sake of My name, that it might not be profaned in the sight of the nations among whom they were. For it was before their eyes that I had made Myself known to Israel to bring them out of the land of Egypt.

content: 10 I brought them out of the land of Egypt and I led them into the wilderness.
content_old: 10 I brought them out of the land of Egypt and I led them into the wilderness.

content: 11 I gave them My laws and taught them My rules, by the pursuit of which a man shall live.
content_old: 11 I gave them My laws and taught them My rules, by the pursuit of which a man shall live.

content: 12 Moreover, I gave them My sabbaths to serve as a sign between Me and them, that they might know that it is I the LORD who sanctify them.
content_old: 12 Moreover, I gave them My sabbaths to serve as a sign between Me and them, that they might know that it is I the LORD who sanctify them.

content: 13 But the House of Israel rebelled against Me in the wilderness; they did not follow My laws and they rejected My rules—by the pursuit of which a man shall live—and they grossly desecrated My sabbaths. Then I thought to pour out My fury upon them in the wilderness and to make an end of them;
content_old: 13 But the House of Israel rebelled against Me in the wilderness; they did not follow My laws and they rejected My rules—by the pursuit of which a man shall live—and they grossly desecrated My sabbaths. Then I thought to pour out My fury upon them in the wilderness and to make an end of them;

content: 14 but I acted for the sake of My name, that it might not be profaned in the sight of the nations before whose eyes I had led them out.
content_old: 14 but I acted for the sake of My name, that it might not be profaned in the sight of the nations before whose eyes I had led them out.

content: 15 However, I swore to them in the wilderness that I would not bring them into the land flowing with milk and honey, the fairest of all lands, which I had assigned to them,
content_old: 15 However, I swore to them in the wilderness that I would not bring them into the land flowing with milk and honey, the fairest of all lands, which I had assigned to them,

content: 16 for they had rejected My rules, disobeyed My laws, and desecrated My sabbaths; their hearts followed after their fetishes.
content_old: 16 for they had rejected My rules, disobeyed My laws, and desecrated My sabbaths; their hearts followed after their fetishes.

content: 17 But I had pity on them and did not destroy them; I did not make an end of them in the wilderness.
content_old: 17 But I had pity on them and did not destroy them; I did not make an end of them in the wilderness.

content: 18 I warned their children in the wilderness: Do not follow the practices of your fathers, do not keep their ways, and do not defile yourselves with their fetishes.
content_old: 18 I warned their children in the wilderness: Do not follow the practices of your fathers, do not keep their ways, and do not defile yourselves with their fetishes.

content: 19 I the LORD am your God: Follow My laws and be careful to observe My rules.
content_old: 19 I the LORD am your God: Follow My laws and be careful to observe My rules.

content: 20 And hallow My sabbaths, that they may be a sign between Me and you, that you may know that I the LORD am your God.
content_old: 20 And hallow My sabbaths, that they may be a sign between Me and you, that you may know that I the LORD am your God.

content: 21 But the children rebelled against Me: they did not follow My laws and did not faithfully observe My rules, by the pursuit of which man shall live; they profaned My sabbaths. Then I resolved to pour out My fury upon them, to vent all My anger upon them, in the wilderness.
content_old: 21 But the children rebelled against Me: they did not follow My laws and did not faithfully observe My rules, by the pursuit of which man shall live; they profaned My sabbaths. Then I resolved to pour out My fury upon them, to vent all My anger upon them, in the wilderness.

content: 22 But I held back My hand and acted for the sake of My name, that it might not be profaned in the sight of the nations before whose eyes I had led them out.
content_old: 22 But I held back My hand and acted for the sake of My name, that it might not be profaned in the sight of the nations before whose eyes I had led them out.

content: 23 However, I swore to them in the wilderness that I would scatter them among the nations and disperse them through the lands,
content_old: 23 However, I swore to them in the wilderness that I would scatter them among the nations and disperse them through the lands,

content: 24 because they did not obey My rules, but rejected My laws, profaned My sabbaths, and looked with longing to the fetishes of their fathers.
content_old: 24 because they did not obey My rules, but rejected My laws, profaned My sabbaths, and looked with longing to the fetishes of their fathers.

content: 25 Moreover, I gave them laws that were not good and rules by which they could not live:
content_old: 25 Moreover, I gave them laws that were not good and rules by which they could not live:

content: 26 When they set aside every first issue of the womb, I defiled them by their very gifts—that I might render them desolate, that they might know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 26 When they set aside every first issue of the womb, I defiled them by their very gifts—that I might render them desolate, that they might know that I am the LORD.

content: 27 Now, O mortal, speak to the House of Israel and say to them: Thus said the Lord GOD: By this too your fathers affronted Me and committed trespass against Me:
content_old: 27 Now, O mortal, speak to the House of Israel and say to them: Thus said the Lord GOD: By this too your fathers affronted Me and committed trespass against Me:

content: 28 When I brought them to the land that I had sworn to give them, and they saw any high hill or any leafy tree, they slaughtered their sacrifices there and presented their offensive offerings there; there they produced their pleasing odors and poured out their libations.
content_old: 28 When I brought them to the land that I had sworn to give them, and they saw any high hill or any leafy tree, they slaughtered their sacrifices there and presented their offensive offerings there; there they produced their pleasing odors and poured out their libations.

content: 29 Then I said to them, “What is this shrine which you visit?” (Therefore such is called bamah to this day.)
content_old: 29 Then I said to them, “What is this shrine which you visit?” (Therefore such is called bamah to this day.)

content: 30 Now say to the House of Israel: Thus said the Lord GOD: If you defile yourselves as your fathers did and go astray after their detestable things,
content_old: 30 Now say to the House of Israel: Thus said the Lord GOD: If you defile yourselves as your fathers did and go astray after their detestable things,

content: 31 and if to this very day you defile yourselves in the presentation of your gifts by making your children pass through the fire to all your fetishes, shall I respond to your inquiry, O House of Israel? As I live—declares the Lord GOD—I will not respond to you.
content_old: 31 and if to this very day you defile yourselves in the presentation of your gifts by making your children pass through the fire to all your fetishes, shall I respond to your inquiry, O House of Israel? As I live—declares the Lord GOD—I will not respond to you.

content: 32 And what you have in mind shall never come to pass—when you say, “We will be like the nations, like the families of the lands, worshiping wood and stone.”
content_old: 32 And what you have in mind shall never come to pass—when you say, “We will be like the nations, like the families of the lands, worshiping wood and stone.”

content: 33 As I live—declares the Lord GOD—I will reign over you with a strong hand, and with an outstretched arm, and with overflowing fury.
content_old: 33 As I live—declares the Lord GOD—I will reign over you with a strong hand, and with an outstretched arm, and with overflowing fury.

content: 34 With a strong hand and an outstretched arm and overflowing fury I will bring you out from the peoples and gather you from the lands where you are scattered,
content_old: 34 With a strong hand and an outstretched arm and overflowing fury I will bring you out from the peoples and gather you from the lands where you are scattered,

content: 35 and I will bring you into the wilderness of the peoples; and there I will enter into judgment with you face to face.
content_old: 35 and I will bring you into the wilderness of the peoples; and there I will enter into judgment with you face to face.

content: 36 As I entered into judgment with your fathers in the wilderness of the land of Egypt, so will I enter into judgment with you—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 36 As I entered into judgment with your fathers in the wilderness of the land of Egypt, so will I enter into judgment with you—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 37 I will make you pass under the shepherd’s staff, and I will bring you into the bond of the covenant.
content_old: 37 I will make you pass under the shepherd’s staff, and I will bring you into the bond of the covenant.

content: 38 I will remove from you those who rebel and transgress against Me; I will take them out of the countries where they sojourn, but they shall not enter the land of Israel. Then you shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 38 I will remove from you those who rebel and transgress against Me; I will take them out of the countries where they sojourn, but they shall not enter the land of Israel. Then you shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 39 As for you, O House of Israel, thus said the Lord GOD: Go, every one of you, and worship his fetishes and continue, if you will not obey Me; but do not profane My holy name any more with your idolatrous gifts.
content_old: 39 As for you, O House of Israel, thus said the Lord GOD: Go, every one of you, and worship his fetishes and continue, if you will not obey Me; but do not profane My holy name any more with your idolatrous gifts.

content: 40 For only on My holy mountain, on the lofty mount of Israel—declares the Lord GOD—there, in the land, the entire House of Israel, all of it, must worship Me. There I will accept them, and there I will take note of your contributions and the choicest offerings of all your sacred things.
content_old: 40 For only on My holy mountain, on the lofty mount of Israel—declares the Lord GOD—there, in the land, the entire House of Israel, all of it, must worship Me. There I will accept them, and there I will take note of your contributions and the choicest offerings of all your sacred things.

content: 41 When I bring you out from the peoples and gather you from the lands in which you are scattered, I will accept you as a pleasing odor; and I will be sanctified through you in the sight of the nations.
content_old: 41 When I bring you out from the peoples and gather you from the lands in which you are scattered, I will accept you as a pleasing odor; and I will be sanctified through you in the sight of the nations.

content: 42 Then, when I have brought you to the land of Israel, to the country that I swore to give to your fathers, you shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 42 Then, when I have brought you to the land of Israel, to the country that I swore to give to your fathers, you shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 43 There you will recall your ways and all the acts by which you defiled yourselves; and you will loathe yourselves for all the evils that you committed.
content_old: 43 There you will recall your ways and all the acts by which you defiled yourselves; and you will loathe yourselves for all the evils that you committed.

content: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 O mortal, set your face toward Teman, and proclaim to Darom, and prophesy against the brushland of the Negeb.
content_old: 2 O mortal, set your face toward Teman, and proclaim to Darom, and prophesy against the brushland of the Negeb.

content: 3 Say to the brushland of the Negeb: Hear the word of the LORD. Thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to kindle a fire in you, which shall devour every tree of yours, both green and withered. Its leaping flame shall not go out, and every face from south to north shall be scorched by it.
content_old: 3 Say to the brushland of the Negeb: Hear the word of the LORD. Thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to kindle a fire in you, which shall devour every tree of yours, both green and withered. Its leaping flame shall not go out, and every face from south to north shall be scorched by it.

content: 4 Then all flesh shall recognize that I the LORD have kindled it; it shall not go out.
content_old: 4 Then all flesh shall recognize that I the LORD have kindled it; it shall not go out.

content: 5 And I said, “Ah, Lord GOD! They say of me: He is just a riddlemonger.”
content_old: 5 And I said, “Ah, Lord GOD! They say of me: He is just a riddlemonger.”

content: 6 Then the word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 6 Then the word of the LORD came to me:

content: 7 O mortal, set your face toward Jerusalem and proclaim against her sanctuaries and prophesy against the land of Israel.
content_old: 7 O mortal, set your face toward Jerusalem and proclaim against her sanctuaries and prophesy against the land of Israel.

content: 8 Say to the land of Israel: Thus said the LORD: I am going to deal with you! I will draw My sword from its sheath, and I will wipe out from you both the righteous and the wicked.
content_old: 8 Say to the land of Israel: Thus said the LORD: I am going to deal with you! I will draw My sword from its sheath, and I will wipe out from you both the righteous and the wicked.

content: 9 In order to wipe out from you both the righteous and the wicked, My sword shall assuredly be unsheathed against all flesh from south to north;
content_old: 9 In order to wipe out from you both the righteous and the wicked, My sword shall assuredly be unsheathed against all flesh from south to north;

content: 10 and all flesh shall know that I the LORD have drawn My sword from its sheath, not to be sheathed again.
content_old: 10 and all flesh shall know that I the LORD have drawn My sword from its sheath, not to be sheathed again.

content: 11 And you, O mortal, sigh; with tottering limbs and bitter grief, sigh before their eyes.
content_old: 11 And you, O mortal, sigh; with tottering limbs and bitter grief, sigh before their eyes.

content: 12 And when they ask you, “Why do you sigh?” answer, “Because of the tidings that have come.” Every heart shall sink and all hands hang nerveless; every spirit shall grow faint and all knees turn to water because of the tidings that have come. It is approaching, it shall come to pass—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 12 And when they ask you, “Why do you sigh?” answer, “Because of the tidings that have come.” Every heart shall sink and all hands hang nerveless; every spirit shall grow faint and all knees turn to water because of the tidings that have come. It is approaching, it shall come to pass—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 13 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 13 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 14 O mortal, prophesy and say: Thus said the Lord GOD: A sword! A sword has been whetted and polished.
content_old: 14 O mortal, prophesy and say: Thus said the Lord GOD: A sword! A sword has been whetted and polished.

content: 15 It has been whetted to wreak slaughter; it has been ground to a brilliant polish. How can we rejoice? My son, it scorns the rod and every stick.
content_old: 15 It has been whetted to wreak slaughter; it has been ground to a brilliant polish. How can we rejoice? My son, it scorns the rod and every stick.

content: 16 It has been given to be polished and then grasped in the hand; for this has the sword been whetted, for this polished—to be put into the hand of a slayer.
content_old: 16 It has been given to be polished and then grasped in the hand; for this has the sword been whetted, for this polished—to be put into the hand of a slayer.

content: 17 Cry and wail, O mortal, for this shall befall My people, this shall befall all the chieftains of Israel: they shall be cast before the sword together with My people; oh, strike the thigh in grief.
content_old: 17 Cry and wail, O mortal, for this shall befall My people, this shall befall all the chieftains of Israel: they shall be cast before the sword together with My people; oh, strike the thigh in grief.

content: 18 Consider: How shall it fail to happen, seeing that it even scorns the rod?—says the Lord GOD.
content_old: 18 Consider: How shall it fail to happen, seeing that it even scorns the rod?—says the Lord GOD.

content: 19 Further, O mortal, prophesy, striking hand against hand. Let the sword strike a second time and yet a third time; it is a sword for massacre, a sword for great carnage, that presses upon them.
content_old: 19 Further, O mortal, prophesy, striking hand against hand. Let the sword strike a second time and yet a third time; it is a sword for massacre, a sword for great carnage, that presses upon them.

content: 20 Thus hearts shall lose courage and many shall fall. At all their gates I have appointed slaughter by the sword. Ah! it is made to flash brilliantly, it is honed for slaughter.
content_old: 20 Thus hearts shall lose courage and many shall fall. At all their gates I have appointed slaughter by the sword. Ah! it is made to flash brilliantly, it is honed for slaughter.

content: 21 Be united, go to the right, turn left; whither are you bound?
content_old: 21 Be united, go to the right, turn left; whither are you bound?

content: 22 I, too, will strike hand against hand and will satisfy My fury upon you; I the LORD have spoken.
content_old: 22 I, too, will strike hand against hand and will satisfy My fury upon you; I the LORD have spoken.

content: 23 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 23 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 24 And you, O mortal, choose two roads on which the sword of the king of Babylon may advance, both issuing from the same country; and select a spot, select it where roads branch off to cities.
content_old: 24 And you, O mortal, choose two roads on which the sword of the king of Babylon may advance, both issuing from the same country; and select a spot, select it where roads branch off to cities.

content: 25 Choose a way for the sword to advance on Rabbah of the Ammonites or on fortified Jerusalem in Judah.
content_old: 25 Choose a way for the sword to advance on Rabbah of the Ammonites or on fortified Jerusalem in Judah.

content: 26 For the king of Babylon has stood at the fork of the road, where two roads branch off, to perform divination: He has shaken arrows, consulted teraphim, and inspected the liver.
content_old: 26 For the king of Babylon has stood at the fork of the road, where two roads branch off, to perform divination: He has shaken arrows, consulted teraphim, and inspected the liver.

content: 27 In his right hand came up the omen against Jerusalem—to set battering rams, to proclaim murder, to raise battle shouts, to set battering rams against the gates, to cast up mounds, to erect towers.
content_old: 27 In his right hand came up the omen against Jerusalem—to set battering rams, to proclaim murder, to raise battle shouts, to set battering rams against the gates, to cast up mounds, to erect towers.

content: 28 In their eyes, the oaths they had sworn to them were like empty divination; but this shall serve to recall their guilt, for which they shall be taken to task.
content_old: 28 In their eyes, the oaths they had sworn to them were like empty divination; but this shall serve to recall their guilt, for which they shall be taken to task.

content: 29 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: For causing your guilt to be recalled, your transgressions to be uncovered, and your sins to be revealed���all your misdeeds—because you have brought yourselves to mind, you shall be taken to task.
content_old: 29 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: For causing your guilt to be recalled, your transgressions to be uncovered, and your sins to be revealed���all your misdeeds—because you have brought yourselves to mind, you shall be taken to task.

content: 30 And to you, O dishonored wicked prince of Israel, whose day has come—the time set for your punishment—
content_old: 30 And to you, O dishonored wicked prince of Israel, whose day has come—the time set for your punishment—

content: 31 thus said the Lord GOD: Remove the turban and lift off the crown! This shall not remain as it is; exalt the low and abase the high.
content_old: 31 thus said the Lord GOD: Remove the turban and lift off the crown! This shall not remain as it is; exalt the low and abase the high.

content: 32 Ruin, an utter ruin I will make it. It shall be no more until he comes to whom it rightfully belongs; and I will give it to him.
content_old: 32 Ruin, an utter ruin I will make it. It shall be no more until he comes to whom it rightfully belongs; and I will give it to him.

content: 33 Further, O mortal, prophesy and say: Thus said the Lord GOD concerning the Ammonites and their blasphemies: Proclaim: O sword! O sword unsheathed for slaughter, polished to the utmost, to a flashing brilliance!
content_old: 33 Further, O mortal, prophesy and say: Thus said the Lord GOD concerning the Ammonites and their blasphemies: Proclaim: O sword! O sword unsheathed for slaughter, polished to the utmost, to a flashing brilliance!

content: 34 Because they have prophesied falsely about you and have divined deceitfully concerning you, you shall be wielded over the necks of the dishonored wicked ones, for their day has come, the time set for their punishment.
content_old: 34 Because they have prophesied falsely about you and have divined deceitfully concerning you, you shall be wielded over the necks of the dishonored wicked ones, for their day has come, the time set for their punishment.

content: 35 Return it to its sheath! In the place where you were created, in the land of your origin, I will judge you.
content_old: 35 Return it to its sheath! In the place where you were created, in the land of your origin, I will judge you.

content: 36 I will pour out My indignation upon you, I will blow upon you with the fire of My wrath; and I will deliver you into the hands of barbarians, craftsmen of destruction.
content_old: 36 I will pour out My indignation upon you, I will blow upon you with the fire of My wrath; and I will deliver you into the hands of barbarians, craftsmen of destruction.

content: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 Further, O mortal, arraign, arraign the city of bloodshed; declare to her all her abhorrent deeds!
content_old: 2 Further, O mortal, arraign, arraign the city of bloodshed; declare to her all her abhorrent deeds!

content: 3 Say: Thus said the Lord GOD: O city in whose midst blood is shed, so that your hour is approaching; within which fetishes are made, so that you have become unclean!
content_old: 3 Say: Thus said the Lord GOD: O city in whose midst blood is shed, so that your hour is approaching; within which fetishes are made, so that you have become unclean!

content: 4 You stand guilty of the blood you have shed, defiled by the fetishes you have made. You have brought on your day; you have reached your year. Therefore I will make you the mockery of the nations and the scorn of all the lands.
content_old: 4 You stand guilty of the blood you have shed, defiled by the fetishes you have made. You have brought on your day; you have reached your year. Therefore I will make you the mockery of the nations and the scorn of all the lands.

content: 5 Both the near and the far shall scorn you, O besmirched of name, O laden with iniquity!
content_old: 5 Both the near and the far shall scorn you, O besmirched of name, O laden with iniquity!

content: 6 Every one of the princes of Israel in your midst used his strength for the shedding of blood.
content_old: 6 Every one of the princes of Israel in your midst used his strength for the shedding of blood.

content: 7 Fathers and mothers have been humiliated within you; strangers have been cheated in your midst; orphans and widows have been wronged within you.
content_old: 7 Fathers and mothers have been humiliated within you; strangers have been cheated in your midst; orphans and widows have been wronged within you.

content: 8 You have despised My holy things and profaned My sabbaths.
content_old: 8 You have despised My holy things and profaned My sabbaths.

content: 9 Base men in your midst were intent on shedding blood; in you they have eaten upon the mountains; and they have practiced depravity in your midst.
content_old: 9 Base men in your midst were intent on shedding blood; in you they have eaten upon the mountains; and they have practiced depravity in your midst.

content: 10 In you they have uncovered their fathers’ nakedness; in you they have ravished women during their impurity.
content_old: 10 In you they have uncovered their fathers’ nakedness; in you they have ravished women during their impurity.

content: 11 They have committed abhorrent acts with other men’s wives; in their depravity they have defiled their own daughters-in-law; in you they have ravished their own sisters, daughters of their fathers.
content_old: 11 They have committed abhorrent acts with other men’s wives; in their depravity they have defiled their own daughters-in-law; in you they have ravished their own sisters, daughters of their fathers.

content: 12 They have taken bribes within you to shed blood. You have taken advance and accrued interest; you have defrauded your countrymen to your profit. You have forgotten Me—declares the Lord GOD.
