content_old: 12 They have taken bribes within you to shed blood. You have taken advance and accrued interest; you have defrauded your countrymen to your profit. You have forgotten Me—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 13 Lo, I will strike My hands over the ill-gotten gains that you have amassed, and over the bloodshed that has been committed in your midst.
content_old: 13 Lo, I will strike My hands over the ill-gotten gains that you have amassed, and over the bloodshed that has been committed in your midst.

content: 14 Will your courage endure, will your hands remain firm in the days when I deal with you? I the LORD have spoken and I will act.
content_old: 14 Will your courage endure, will your hands remain firm in the days when I deal with you? I the LORD have spoken and I will act.

content: 15 I will scatter you among the nations and disperse you through the lands; I will consume the uncleanness out of you.
content_old: 15 I will scatter you among the nations and disperse you through the lands; I will consume the uncleanness out of you.

content: 16 You shall be dishonored in the sight of nations, and you shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 16 You shall be dishonored in the sight of nations, and you shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 17 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 17 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 18 O mortal, the House of Israel has become dross to Me; they are all copper, tin, iron, and lead. But in a crucible, the dross shall turn into silver.
content_old: 18 O mortal, the House of Israel has become dross to Me; they are all copper, tin, iron, and lead. But in a crucible, the dross shall turn into silver.

content: 19 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: Because you have all become dross, I will gather you into Jerusalem.
content_old: 19 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: Because you have all become dross, I will gather you into Jerusalem.

content: 20 As silver, copper, iron, lead, and tin are gathered into a crucible to blow the fire upon them, so as to melt them, so will I gather you in My fierce anger and cast you and melt you.
content_old: 20 As silver, copper, iron, lead, and tin are gathered into a crucible to blow the fire upon them, so as to melt them, so will I gather you in My fierce anger and cast you and melt you.

content: 21 I will gather you and I will blow upon you the fire of My fury, and you shall be melted in it.
content_old: 21 I will gather you and I will blow upon you the fire of My fury, and you shall be melted in it.

content: 22 As silver is melted in a crucible, so shall you be melted in it. And you shall know that I the LORD have poured out My fury upon you.
content_old: 22 As silver is melted in a crucible, so shall you be melted in it. And you shall know that I the LORD have poured out My fury upon you.

content: 23 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 23 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 24 O mortal, say to her: You are an uncleansed land, not to be washed with rain on the day of indignation.
content_old: 24 O mortal, say to her: You are an uncleansed land, not to be washed with rain on the day of indignation.

content: 25 Her gang of prophets are like roaring lions in her midst, rending prey. They devour human beings; they seize treasure and wealth; they have widowed many women in her midst.
content_old: 25 Her gang of prophets are like roaring lions in her midst, rending prey. They devour human beings; they seize treasure and wealth; they have widowed many women in her midst.

content: 26 Her priests have violated My Teaching: they have profaned what is sacred to Me, they have not distinguished between the sacred and the profane, they have not taught the difference between the unclean and the clean, and they have closed their eyes to My sabbaths. I am profaned in their midst.
content_old: 26 Her priests have violated My Teaching: they have profaned what is sacred to Me, they have not distinguished between the sacred and the profane, they have not taught the difference between the unclean and the clean, and they have closed their eyes to My sabbaths. I am profaned in their midst.

content: 27 Her officials are like wolves rending prey in her midst; they shed blood and destroy lives to win ill-gotten gain.
content_old: 27 Her officials are like wolves rending prey in her midst; they shed blood and destroy lives to win ill-gotten gain.

content: 28 Her prophets, too, daub the wall for them with plaster: They prophesy falsely and divine deceitfully for them; they say, “Thus said the Lord GOD,” when the LORD has not spoken.
content_old: 28 Her prophets, too, daub the wall for them with plaster: They prophesy falsely and divine deceitfully for them; they say, “Thus said the Lord GOD,” when the LORD has not spoken.

content: 29 And the people of the land have practiced fraud and committed robbery; they have wronged the poor and needy, have defrauded the stranger without redress.
content_old: 29 And the people of the land have practiced fraud and committed robbery; they have wronged the poor and needy, have defrauded the stranger without redress.

content: 30 And I sought a man among them to repair the wall or to stand in the breach before Me in behalf of this land, that I might not destroy it; but I found none.
content_old: 30 And I sought a man among them to repair the wall or to stand in the breach before Me in behalf of this land, that I might not destroy it; but I found none.

content: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 O mortal, once there were two women, daughters of one mother.
content_old: 2 O mortal, once there were two women, daughters of one mother.

content: 3 They played the whore in Egypt; they played the whore while still young. There their breasts were squeezed, and there their virgin nipples were handled.
content_old: 3 They played the whore in Egypt; they played the whore while still young. There their breasts were squeezed, and there their virgin nipples were handled.

content: 4 Their names were: the elder one, Oholah; and her sister, Oholibah. They became Mine, and they bore sons and daughters. As for their names, Oholah is Samaria, and Oholibah is Jerusalem.
content_old: 4 Their names were: the elder one, Oholah; and her sister, Oholibah. They became Mine, and they bore sons and daughters. As for their names, Oholah is Samaria, and Oholibah is Jerusalem.

content: 5 Oholah whored while she was Mine, and she lusted after her lovers, after the Assyrians, warriors
content_old: 5 Oholah whored while she was Mine, and she lusted after her lovers, after the Assyrians, warriors

content: 6 clothed in blue, governors and prefects, horsemen mounted on steeds—all of them handsome young fellows.
content_old: 6 clothed in blue, governors and prefects, horsemen mounted on steeds—all of them handsome young fellows.

content: 7 She bestowed her favors upon them—upon all the pick of the Assyrians—and defiled herself with all their fetishes after which she lusted.
content_old: 7 She bestowed her favors upon them—upon all the pick of the Assyrians—and defiled herself with all their fetishes after which she lusted.

content: 8 She did not give up the whoring she had begun with the Egyptians; for they had lain with her in her youth, and they had handled her virgin nipples and had poured out their lust upon her.
content_old: 8 She did not give up the whoring she had begun with the Egyptians; for they had lain with her in her youth, and they had handled her virgin nipples and had poured out their lust upon her.

content: 9 Therefore I delivered her into the hands of her lovers, into the hands of the Assyrians after whom she lusted.
content_old: 9 Therefore I delivered her into the hands of her lovers, into the hands of the Assyrians after whom she lusted.

content: 10 They exposed her nakedness; they seized her sons and daughters, and she herself was put to the sword. And because of the punishment inflicted upon her, she became a byword among women.
content_old: 10 They exposed her nakedness; they seized her sons and daughters, and she herself was put to the sword. And because of the punishment inflicted upon her, she became a byword among women.

content: 11 Her sister Oholibah saw this; yet her lusting was more depraved than her sister’s, and her whoring more debased.
content_old: 11 Her sister Oholibah saw this; yet her lusting was more depraved than her sister’s, and her whoring more debased.

content: 12 She lusted after the Assyrians, governors and prefects, warriors gorgeously clad, horsemen mounted on steeds—all of them handsome young fellows.
content_old: 12 She lusted after the Assyrians, governors and prefects, warriors gorgeously clad, horsemen mounted on steeds—all of them handsome young fellows.

content: 13 And I saw how she had defiled herself. Both of them followed the same course,
content_old: 13 And I saw how she had defiled herself. Both of them followed the same course,

content: 14 but she carried her harlotries further. For she saw men sculptured upon the walls, figures of Chaldeans drawn in vermilion,
content_old: 14 but she carried her harlotries further. For she saw men sculptured upon the walls, figures of Chaldeans drawn in vermilion,

content: 15 girded with belts round their waists, and with flowing turbans on their heads, all of them looking like officers—a picture of Babylonians whose native land was Chaldea.
content_old: 15 girded with belts round their waists, and with flowing turbans on their heads, all of them looking like officers—a picture of Babylonians whose native land was Chaldea.

content: 16 At the very sight of them she lusted after them, and she sent messengers for them to Chaldea.
content_old: 16 At the very sight of them she lusted after them, and she sent messengers for them to Chaldea.

content: 17 So the Babylonians came to her for lovemaking and defiled her with their whoring; and she defiled herself with them until she turned from them in disgust.
content_old: 17 So the Babylonians came to her for lovemaking and defiled her with their whoring; and she defiled herself with them until she turned from them in disgust.

content: 18 She flaunted her harlotries and exposed her nakedness, and I turned from her in disgust, as I had turned disgusted from her sister.
content_old: 18 She flaunted her harlotries and exposed her nakedness, and I turned from her in disgust, as I had turned disgusted from her sister.

content: 19 But she whored still more, remembering how in her youth she had played the whore in the land of Egypt;
content_old: 19 But she whored still more, remembering how in her youth she had played the whore in the land of Egypt;

content: 20 she lusted for concubinage with them, whose members were like those of asses and whose organs were like those of stallions.
content_old: 20 she lusted for concubinage with them, whose members were like those of asses and whose organs were like those of stallions.

content: 21 Thus you reverted to the wantonness of your youth, remembering your youthful breasts, when the men of Egypt handled your nipples.
content_old: 21 Thus you reverted to the wantonness of your youth, remembering your youthful breasts, when the men of Egypt handled your nipples.

content: 22 Assuredly, Oholibah, thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to rouse against you the lovers from whom you turned in disgust, and I will bring them upon you from all around—
content_old: 22 Assuredly, Oholibah, thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to rouse against you the lovers from whom you turned in disgust, and I will bring them upon you from all around—

content: 23 the Babylonians and all the Chaldeans, Pekod, Shoa, and Koa, and all the Assyrians with them, all of them handsome young fellows, governors and prefects, officers and warriors, all of them riding on horseback.
content_old: 23 the Babylonians and all the Chaldeans, Pekod, Shoa, and Koa, and all the Assyrians with them, all of them handsome young fellows, governors and prefects, officers and warriors, all of them riding on horseback.

content: 24 They shall attack you with fleets of wheeled chariots and a host of troops; they shall set themselves against you on all sides with bucklers, shields, and helmets. And I will entrust your punishment to them, and they shall inflict their punishments on you.
content_old: 24 They shall attack you with fleets of wheeled chariots and a host of troops; they shall set themselves against you on all sides with bucklers, shields, and helmets. And I will entrust your punishment to them, and they shall inflict their punishments on you.

content: 25 I will direct My passion against you, and they shall deal with you in fury: they shall cut off your nose and ears. The last of you shall fall by the sword; they shall take away your sons and daughters, and your remnant shall be devoured by fire.
content_old: 25 I will direct My passion against you, and they shall deal with you in fury: they shall cut off your nose and ears. The last of you shall fall by the sword; they shall take away your sons and daughters, and your remnant shall be devoured by fire.

content: 26 They shall strip you of your clothing and take away your dazzling jewels.
content_old: 26 They shall strip you of your clothing and take away your dazzling jewels.

content: 27 I will put an end to your wantonness and to your whoring in the land of Egypt, and you shall not long for them or remember Egypt any more.
content_old: 27 I will put an end to your wantonness and to your whoring in the land of Egypt, and you shall not long for them or remember Egypt any more.

content: 28 For thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to deliver you into the hands of those you hate, into the hands of those from whom you turned in disgust.
content_old: 28 For thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to deliver you into the hands of those you hate, into the hands of those from whom you turned in disgust.

content: 29 They shall treat you with hate, and they shall take away all you have toiled for, and leave you naked and bare; your naked whoredom, wantonness, and harlotry will be exposed.
content_old: 29 They shall treat you with hate, and they shall take away all you have toiled for, and leave you naked and bare; your naked whoredom, wantonness, and harlotry will be exposed.

content: 30 These things shall be done to you for your harlotries with the nations, for defiling yourself with their fetishes.
content_old: 30 These things shall be done to you for your harlotries with the nations, for defiling yourself with their fetishes.

content: 31 You walked in your sister’s path; therefore I will put her cup into your hand.
content_old: 31 You walked in your sister’s path; therefore I will put her cup into your hand.

content: 32 Thus said the Lord GOD: You shall drink of your sister’s cup, So deep and wide; It shall cause derision and scorn, It holds so much.
content_old: 32 Thus said the Lord GOD: You shall drink of your sister’s cup, So deep and wide; It shall cause derision and scorn, It holds so much.

content: 33 You shall be filled with drunkenness and woe. The cup of desolation and horror, The cup of your sister Samaria—
content_old: 33 You shall be filled with drunkenness and woe. The cup of desolation and horror, The cup of your sister Samaria—

content: 34 You shall drink it and drain it, And gnaw its shards; And you shall tear your breasts. For I have spoken—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 34 You shall drink it and drain it, And gnaw its shards; And you shall tear your breasts. For I have spoken—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 35 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: Because you have forgotten Me and cast Me behind your back, you in turn must suffer for your wanton whoring.
content_old: 35 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: Because you have forgotten Me and cast Me behind your back, you in turn must suffer for your wanton whoring.

content: 36 Then the LORD said to me: O mortal, arraign Oholah and Oholibah, and charge them with their abominations.
content_old: 36 Then the LORD said to me: O mortal, arraign Oholah and Oholibah, and charge them with their abominations.

content: 37 For they have committed adultery, and blood is on their hands; truly they have committed adultery with their fetishes, and have even offered to them as food the children they bore to Me.
content_old: 37 For they have committed adultery, and blood is on their hands; truly they have committed adultery with their fetishes, and have even offered to them as food the children they bore to Me.

content: 38 At the same time they also did this to Me: they defiled My Sanctuary and profaned My sabbaths.
content_old: 38 At the same time they also did this to Me: they defiled My Sanctuary and profaned My sabbaths.

content: 39 On the very day that they slaughtered their children to their fetishes, they entered My Sanctuary to desecrate it. That is what they did in My House.
content_old: 39 On the very day that they slaughtered their children to their fetishes, they entered My Sanctuary to desecrate it. That is what they did in My House.

content: 40 Moreover, they sent for men to come from afar, to whom a messenger was sent; and they came. For them, you bathed, painted your eyes, and donned your finery;
content_old: 40 Moreover, they sent for men to come from afar, to whom a messenger was sent; and they came. For them, you bathed, painted your eyes, and donned your finery;

content: 41 and you sat on a grand couch with a set table in front of it—and it was My incense and My oil you laid upon it.
content_old: 41 and you sat on a grand couch with a set table in front of it—and it was My incense and My oil you laid upon it.

content: 42 And the noise of a carefree multitude was there, of numerous men brought drunk from the desert; and they put bracelets on their arms and splendid crowns upon their heads.
content_old: 42 And the noise of a carefree multitude was there, of numerous men brought drunk from the desert; and they put bracelets on their arms and splendid crowns upon their heads.

content: 43 Then I said, “To destruction with adultery! Look, they are still going on with those same fornications of hers.”
content_old: 43 Then I said, “To destruction with adultery! Look, they are still going on with those same fornications of hers.”

content: 44 And they would go to her as one goes to a prostitute; that is how they went to Oholah and Oholibah, wanton women.
content_old: 44 And they would go to her as one goes to a prostitute; that is how they went to Oholah and Oholibah, wanton women.

content: 45 But righteous men shall punish them with the punishments for adultery and for bloodshed, for they are adulteresses and have blood on their hands.
content_old: 45 But righteous men shall punish them with the punishments for adultery and for bloodshed, for they are adulteresses and have blood on their hands.

content: 46 For thus said the Lord GOD: Summon an assembly against them, and make them an object of horror and plunder.
content_old: 46 For thus said the Lord GOD: Summon an assembly against them, and make them an object of horror and plunder.

content: 47 Let the assembly pelt them with stones and cut them down with their swords; let them kill their sons and daughters, and burn down their homes.
content_old: 47 Let the assembly pelt them with stones and cut them down with their swords; let them kill their sons and daughters, and burn down their homes.

content: 48 I will put an end to wantonness in the land; and all the women shall take warning not to imitate your wantonness.
content_old: 48 I will put an end to wantonness in the land; and all the women shall take warning not to imitate your wantonness.

content: 1 In the ninth year, on the tenth day of the tenth month, the word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 In the ninth year, on the tenth day of the tenth month, the word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 O mortal, record this date, this exact day; for this very day the king of Babylon has laid siege to Jerusalem.
content_old: 2 O mortal, record this date, this exact day; for this very day the king of Babylon has laid siege to Jerusalem.

content: 3 Further, speak in an allegory to the rebellious breed and say to them: Thus said the Lord GOD: Put the caldron , put it on, And then pour water into it.
content_old: 3 Further, speak in an allegory to the rebellious breed and say to them: Thus said the Lord GOD: Put the caldron , put it on, And then pour water into it.

content: 4 Collect in it the pieces. Every choice piece, thigh and shoulder; Fill it with the best cuts—
content_old: 4 Collect in it the pieces. Every choice piece, thigh and shoulder; Fill it with the best cuts—

content: 5 Take the best of the flock. Also pile the cuts under it; Get it boiling briskly, And cook the cuts in it.
content_old: 5 Take the best of the flock. Also pile the cuts under it; Get it boiling briskly, And cook the cuts in it.

content: 6 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: Woe to the city of blood— A caldron whose scum is in it, Whose scum has not been cleaned out! Empty it piece by piece; No lot has fallen upon it.
content_old: 6 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: Woe to the city of blood— A caldron whose scum is in it, Whose scum has not been cleaned out! Empty it piece by piece; No lot has fallen upon it.

content: 7 For the blood she shed is still in her; She set it upon a bare rock; She did not pour it out on the ground To cover it with earth.
content_old: 7 For the blood she shed is still in her; She set it upon a bare rock; She did not pour it out on the ground To cover it with earth.

content: 8 She set her blood upon the bare rock, So that it was not covered, So that it may stir up fury To take vengeance.
content_old: 8 She set her blood upon the bare rock, So that it was not covered, So that it may stir up fury To take vengeance.

content: 9 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: Woe to the city of blood! I in turn will make a great blaze.
content_old: 9 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: Woe to the city of blood! I in turn will make a great blaze.

content: 10 Pile on the logs, Kindle the fire, Cook the meat through And stew it completely, And let the bones be charred.
content_old: 10 Pile on the logs, Kindle the fire, Cook the meat through And stew it completely, And let the bones be charred.

content: 11 Let it stand empty on the coals, Until it becomes so hot That the copper glows. Then its uncleanness shall melt away in it, And its rust be consumed.
content_old: 11 Let it stand empty on the coals, Until it becomes so hot That the copper glows. Then its uncleanness shall melt away in it, And its rust be consumed.

content: 12 It has frustrated all effort, Its thick scum will not leave it— Into the fire with its scum!
content_old: 12 It has frustrated all effort, Its thick scum will not leave it— Into the fire with its scum!

content: 13 For your vile impurity—because I sought to cleanse you of your impurity, but you would not be cleansed—you shall never be clean again until I have satisfied My fury upon you.
content_old: 13 For your vile impurity—because I sought to cleanse you of your impurity, but you would not be cleansed—you shall never be clean again until I have satisfied My fury upon you.

content: 14 I the LORD have spoken: It shall come to pass and I will do it. I will not refrain or spare or relent. You shall be punished according to your ways and your deeds—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 14 I the LORD have spoken: It shall come to pass and I will do it. I will not refrain or spare or relent. You shall be punished according to your ways and your deeds—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 15 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 15 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 16 O mortal, I am about to take away the delight of your eyes from you through pestilence; but you shall not lament or weep or let your tears flow.
content_old: 16 O mortal, I am about to take away the delight of your eyes from you through pestilence; but you shall not lament or weep or let your tears flow.

content: 17 Moan softly; observe no mourning for the dead: Put on your turban and put your sandals on your feet; do not cover over your upper lip, and do not eat the bread of comforters.”
content_old: 17 Moan softly; observe no mourning for the dead: Put on your turban and put your sandals on your feet; do not cover over your upper lip, and do not eat the bread of comforters.”

content: 18 In the evening my wife died, and in the morning I did as I had been commanded. And when I spoke to the people that morning,
content_old: 18 In the evening my wife died, and in the morning I did as I had been commanded. And when I spoke to the people that morning,

content: 19 the people asked me, “Will you not tell us what these things portend for us, that you are acting so?”
content_old: 19 the people asked me, “Will you not tell us what these things portend for us, that you are acting so?”

content: 20 I answered them, “The word of the LORD has come to me:
content_old: 20 I answered them, “The word of the LORD has come to me:

content: 21 Tell the House of Israel: Thus said the Lord GOD: ‘I am going to desecrate My Sanctuary, your pride and glory, the delight of your eyes and the desire of your heart; and the sons and daughters you have left behind shall fall by the sword.
content_old: 21 Tell the House of Israel: Thus said the Lord GOD: ‘I am going to desecrate My Sanctuary, your pride and glory, the delight of your eyes and the desire of your heart; and the sons and daughters you have left behind shall fall by the sword.

content: 24 And Ezekiel shall become a portent for you: you shall do just as he has done, when it happens; and you shall know that I am the Lord GOD.’
content_old: 24 And Ezekiel shall become a portent for you: you shall do just as he has done, when it happens; and you shall know that I am the Lord GOD.’

content: 22 Accordingly, you shall do as I have done: you shall not cover over your upper lips or eat the bread of comforters;
content_old: 22 Accordingly, you shall do as I have done: you shall not cover over your upper lips or eat the bread of comforters;

content: 23 and your turbans shall remain on your heads, and your sandals upon your feet. You shall not lament or weep, but you shall be heartsick because of your iniquities and shall moan to one another.”
content_old: 23 and your turbans shall remain on your heads, and your sandals upon your feet. You shall not lament or weep, but you shall be heartsick because of your iniquities and shall moan to one another.”

content: 25 You, O mortal, take note: On the day that I take their stronghold from them, their pride and joy, the delight of their eyes and the longing of their hearts—their sons and daughters—
content_old: 25 You, O mortal, take note: On the day that I take their stronghold from them, their pride and joy, the delight of their eyes and the longing of their hearts—their sons and daughters—

content: 26 on that day a fugitive will come to you, to let you hear it with your own ears.
content_old: 26 on that day a fugitive will come to you, to let you hear it with your own ears.

content: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 O mortal, set your face toward the Ammonites and prophesy against them.
content_old: 2 O mortal, set your face toward the Ammonites and prophesy against them.

content: 3 Say to the Ammonites: Hear the word of the Lord GOD! Thus said the Lord GOD: Because you cried “Aha!” over My Sanctuary when it was desecrated, and over the land of Israel when it was laid waste, and over the House of Judah when it went into exile—
content_old: 3 Say to the Ammonites: Hear the word of the Lord GOD! Thus said the Lord GOD: Because you cried “Aha!” over My Sanctuary when it was desecrated, and over the land of Israel when it was laid waste, and over the House of Judah when it went into exile—

content: 4 assuredly, I will deliver you to the Kedemites as a possession. They shall set up their encampments among you and pitch their dwellings in your midst; they shall eat your produce and they shall drink your milk.
content_old: 4 assuredly, I will deliver you to the Kedemites as a possession. They shall set up their encampments among you and pitch their dwellings in your midst; they shall eat your produce and they shall drink your milk.

content: 5 I will make Rabbah a pasture for camels and Ammon a place for sheep to lie down. And you shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 5 I will make Rabbah a pasture for camels and Ammon a place for sheep to lie down. And you shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 6 For thus said the Lord GOD: Because you clapped your hands and stamped your feet and rejoiced over the land of Israel with such utter scorn—
content_old: 6 For thus said the Lord GOD: Because you clapped your hands and stamped your feet and rejoiced over the land of Israel with such utter scorn—

content: 7 assuredly, I will stretch out My hand against you and give you as booty to the nations; I will cut you off from among the peoples and wipe you out from among the countries and destroy you. And you shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 7 assuredly, I will stretch out My hand against you and give you as booty to the nations; I will cut you off from among the peoples and wipe you out from among the countries and destroy you. And you shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 8 Thus said the Lord GOD: Because Moab and Seir said, “See, the House of Judah is like all other nations”—
content_old: 8 Thus said the Lord GOD: Because Moab and Seir said, “See, the House of Judah is like all other nations”—

content: 9 assuredly, I will lay bare the flank of Moab, all its towns to the last one—Beth-jeshimoth, Baal-meon, and Kiriathaim, the glory of the country.
content_old: 9 assuredly, I will lay bare the flank of Moab, all its towns to the last one—Beth-jeshimoth, Baal-meon, and Kiriathaim, the glory of the country.

content: 10 I will deliver it, together with Ammon, to the Kedemites as their possession. Thus Ammon shall not be remembered among the nations,
content_old: 10 I will deliver it, together with Ammon, to the Kedemites as their possession. Thus Ammon shall not be remembered among the nations,

content: 11 and I will mete out punishments to Moab. And they shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 11 and I will mete out punishments to Moab. And they shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 12 Thus said the Lord GOD: Because Edom acted vengefully against the House of Judah and incurred guilt by wreaking revenge upon it—
content_old: 12 Thus said the Lord GOD: Because Edom acted vengefully against the House of Judah and incurred guilt by wreaking revenge upon it—

content: 13 assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: I will stretch out My hand against Edom and cut off from it man and beast, and I will lay it in ruins; from Tema to Dedan they shall fall by the sword.
content_old: 13 assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: I will stretch out My hand against Edom and cut off from it man and beast, and I will lay it in ruins; from Tema to Dedan they shall fall by the sword.

content: 14 I will wreak My vengeance on Edom through My people Israel, and they shall take action against Edom in accordance with My blazing anger; and they shall know My vengeance—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 14 I will wreak My vengeance on Edom through My people Israel, and they shall take action against Edom in accordance with My blazing anger; and they shall know My vengeance—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 15 Thus said the Lord GOD: Because the Philistines, in their ancient hatred, acted vengefully, and with utter scorn sought revenge and destruction—
content_old: 15 Thus said the Lord GOD: Because the Philistines, in their ancient hatred, acted vengefully, and with utter scorn sought revenge and destruction—

content: 16 assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: I will stretch out My hand against the Philistines and cut off the Cherethites and wipe out the last survivors of the seacoast.
content_old: 16 assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: I will stretch out My hand against the Philistines and cut off the Cherethites and wipe out the last survivors of the seacoast.

content: 1 In the eleventh year, on the first of the month, the word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 In the eleventh year, on the first of the month, the word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 O mortal, because Tyre gloated over Jerusalem, “Aha! The gateway of the peoples is broken, it has become mine; I shall be filled, now that it is laid in ruins”—
content_old: 2 O mortal, because Tyre gloated over Jerusalem, “Aha! The gateway of the peoples is broken, it has become mine; I shall be filled, now that it is laid in ruins”—

content: 3 assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to deal with you, O Tyre! I will hurl many nations against you, As the sea hurls its waves.
content_old: 3 assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to deal with you, O Tyre! I will hurl many nations against you, As the sea hurls its waves.

content: 4 They shall destroy the walls of Tyre And demolish her towers; And I will scrape her soil off her And leave her a naked rock.
content_old: 4 They shall destroy the walls of Tyre And demolish her towers; And I will scrape her soil off her And leave her a naked rock.

content: 5 She shall be in the heart of the sea A place for drying nets; For I have spoken it —declares the Lord GOD. She shall become spoil for the nations,
content_old: 5 She shall be in the heart of the sea A place for drying nets; For I have spoken it —declares the Lord GOD. She shall become spoil for the nations,

content: 6 And her daughter-towns in the country Shall be put to the sword. And they shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 6 And her daughter-towns in the country Shall be put to the sword. And they shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 7 For thus said the Lord GOD: I will bring from the north, against Tyre, King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, a king of kings, with horses, chariots, and horsemen—a great mass of troops.
content_old: 7 For thus said the Lord GOD: I will bring from the north, against Tyre, King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, a king of kings, with horses, chariots, and horsemen—a great mass of troops.

content: 8 Your daughter-towns in the country He shall put to the sword; He shall erect towers against you, And cast up mounds against you, And raise bucklers against you.
content_old: 8 Your daughter-towns in the country He shall put to the sword; He shall erect towers against you, And cast up mounds against you, And raise bucklers against you.

content: 9 He shall turn the force of his battering rams Against your walls And smash your towers with his axes.
content_old: 9 He shall turn the force of his battering rams Against your walls And smash your towers with his axes.

content: 10 From the cloud raised by his horses Dust shall cover you; From the clatter of horsemen And wheels and chariots, Your walls shall shake— When he enters your gates As men enter a breached city.
content_old: 10 From the cloud raised by his horses Dust shall cover you; From the clatter of horsemen And wheels and chariots, Your walls shall shake— When he enters your gates As men enter a breached city.

content: 11 With the hoofs of his steeds He shall trample all your streets. He shall put your people to the sword, And your mighty pillars shall crash to the ground.
content_old: 11 With the hoofs of his steeds He shall trample all your streets. He shall put your people to the sword, And your mighty pillars shall crash to the ground.

content: 12 They shall plunder your wealth And loot your merchandise. They shall raze your walls And tear down your splendid houses, And they shall cast into the water Your stones and timber and soil.
content_old: 12 They shall plunder your wealth And loot your merchandise. They shall raze your walls And tear down your splendid houses, And they shall cast into the water Your stones and timber and soil.

content: 13 I will put an end to the murmur of your songs, And the sound of your lyres shall be heard no more.
content_old: 13 I will put an end to the murmur of your songs, And the sound of your lyres shall be heard no more.

content: 14 I will make you a naked rock, You shall be a place for drying nets; You shall never be rebuilt. For I have spoken —declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 14 I will make you a naked rock, You shall be a place for drying nets; You shall never be rebuilt. For I have spoken —declares the Lord GOD.

content: 15 Thus said the Lord GOD to Tyre: The coastlands shall quake at the sound of your downfall, when the wounded groan, when slaughter is rife within you.
content_old: 15 Thus said the Lord GOD to Tyre: The coastlands shall quake at the sound of your downfall, when the wounded groan, when slaughter is rife within you.

content: 16 All the rulers of the sea shall descend from their thrones; they shall remove their robes and strip off their embroidered garments. They shall clothe themselves with trembling, and shall sit on the ground; they shall tremble every moment, and they shall be aghast at you.
content_old: 16 All the rulers of the sea shall descend from their thrones; they shall remove their robes and strip off their embroidered garments. They shall clothe themselves with trembling, and shall sit on the ground; they shall tremble every moment, and they shall be aghast at you.

content: 17 And they shall intone a dirge over you, and they shall say to you: How you have perished, you who were peopled from the seas, O renowned city! Mighty on the sea were she and her inhabitants, Who cast their terror on all its inhabitants.
content_old: 17 And they shall intone a dirge over you, and they shall say to you: How you have perished, you who were peopled from the seas, O renowned city! Mighty on the sea were she and her inhabitants, Who cast their terror on all its inhabitants.

content: 18 Now shall the coastlands tremble On the day of your downfall, And the coastlands by the sea Be terrified at your end.
content_old: 18 Now shall the coastlands tremble On the day of your downfall, And the coastlands by the sea Be terrified at your end.

content: 19 For thus said the Lord GOD: When I make you a ruined city, like cities empty of inhabitants; when I bring the deep over you, and its mighty waters cover you,
content_old: 19 For thus said the Lord GOD: When I make you a ruined city, like cities empty of inhabitants; when I bring the deep over you, and its mighty waters cover you,

content: 20 then I will bring you down, with those who go down to the Pit, to the people of old. I will install you in the netherworld, with those that go down to the Pit, like the ruins of old, so that you shall not be inhabited and shall not radiate splendor in the land of the living.
content_old: 20 then I will bring you down, with those who go down to the Pit, to the people of old. I will install you in the netherworld, with those that go down to the Pit, like the ruins of old, so that you shall not be inhabited and shall not radiate splendor in the land of the living.

content: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 Now you, O mortal, intone a dirge over Tyre.
content_old: 2 Now you, O mortal, intone a dirge over Tyre.

content: 3 Say to Tyre: O you who dwell at the gateway of the sea, Who trade with the peoples on many coastlands: Thus said the Lord GOD: O Tyre, you boasted, I am perfect in beauty.
content_old: 3 Say to Tyre: O you who dwell at the gateway of the sea, Who trade with the peoples on many coastlands: Thus said the Lord GOD: O Tyre, you boasted, I am perfect in beauty.

content: 4 Your frontiers were on the high seas, Your builders perfected your beauty.
content_old: 4 Your frontiers were on the high seas, Your builders perfected your beauty.

content: 5 From cypress trees of Senir They fashioned your planks; They took a cedar from Lebanon To make a mast for you.
content_old: 5 From cypress trees of Senir They fashioned your planks; They took a cedar from Lebanon To make a mast for you.

content: 6 From oak trees of Bashan They made your oars; Of boxwood from the isles of Kittim, Inlaid with ivory, They made your decks.
content_old: 6 From oak trees of Bashan They made your oars; Of boxwood from the isles of Kittim, Inlaid with ivory, They made your decks.

content: 7 Embroidered linen from Egypt Was the cloth That served you for sails; Of blue and purple from the coasts of Elishah Were your awnings.
content_old: 7 Embroidered linen from Egypt Was the cloth That served you for sails; Of blue and purple from the coasts of Elishah Were your awnings.

content: 8 The inhabitants of Sidon and Arvad Were your rowers; Your skilled men, O Tyre, were within you, They were your pilots.
content_old: 8 The inhabitants of Sidon and Arvad Were your rowers; Your skilled men, O Tyre, were within you, They were your pilots.

content: 9 Gebal’s elders and craftsmen were within you, Making your repairs. All the ships of the sea, with their crews, Were in your harbor To traffic in your wares.
content_old: 9 Gebal’s elders and craftsmen were within you, Making your repairs. All the ships of the sea, with their crews, Were in your harbor To traffic in your wares.

content: 10 Men of Paras, Lud, and Put Were in your army, Your fighting men; They hung shields and helmets in your midst, They lent splendor to you.
content_old: 10 Men of Paras, Lud, and Put Were in your army, Your fighting men; They hung shields and helmets in your midst, They lent splendor to you.

content: 11 Men of Arvad and Helech Manned your walls all around, And men of Gammad were stationed in your towers; They hung their quivers all about your walls; They perfected your beauty.
content_old: 11 Men of Arvad and Helech Manned your walls all around, And men of Gammad were stationed in your towers; They hung their quivers all about your walls; They perfected your beauty.

content: 12 Tarshish traded with you because of your wealth of all kinds of goods; they bartered silver, iron, tin, and lead for your wares.
content_old: 12 Tarshish traded with you because of your wealth of all kinds of goods; they bartered silver, iron, tin, and lead for your wares.

content: 13 Javan, Tubal, and Meshech—they were your merchants; they trafficked with you in human beings and copper utensils.
content_old: 13 Javan, Tubal, and Meshech—they were your merchants; they trafficked with you in human beings and copper utensils.

content: 14 From Beth-togarmah they bartered horses, horsemen, and mules for your wares.
content_old: 14 From Beth-togarmah they bartered horses, horsemen, and mules for your wares.

content: 15 The people of Dedan were your merchants; many coastlands traded under your rule and rendered you tribute in ivory tusks and ebony.
content_old: 15 The people of Dedan were your merchants; many coastlands traded under your rule and rendered you tribute in ivory tusks and ebony.

content: 16 Aram traded with you because of your wealth of merchandise, dealing with you in turquoise, purple stuff, embroidery, fine linen, coral, and agate.
content_old: 16 Aram traded with you because of your wealth of merchandise, dealing with you in turquoise, purple stuff, embroidery, fine linen, coral, and agate.

content: 17 Judah and the land of Israel were your merchants; they trafficked with you in wheat of Minnith and Pannag, honey, oil, and balm.
content_old: 17 Judah and the land of Israel were your merchants; they trafficked with you in wheat of Minnith and Pannag, honey, oil, and balm.

content: 18 Because of your wealth of merchandise, because of your great wealth, Damascus traded with you in Helbon wine and white wool.
content_old: 18 Because of your wealth of merchandise, because of your great wealth, Damascus traded with you in Helbon wine and white wool.

content: 19 Vedan and Javan from Uzal traded for your wares; they trafficked with you in polished iron, cassia, and calamus.
content_old: 19 Vedan and Javan from Uzal traded for your wares; they trafficked with you in polished iron, cassia, and calamus.

content: 20 Dedan was your merchant in saddlecloths for riding.
content_old: 20 Dedan was your merchant in saddlecloths for riding.

content: 21 Arabia and all Kedar’s chiefs were traders under your rule; they traded with you in lambs, rams, and goats.
content_old: 21 Arabia and all Kedar’s chiefs were traders under your rule; they traded with you in lambs, rams, and goats.

content: 22 The merchants of Sheba and Raamah were your merchants; they bartered for your wares all the finest spices, all kinds of precious stones, and gold.
content_old: 22 The merchants of Sheba and Raamah were your merchants; they bartered for your wares all the finest spices, all kinds of precious stones, and gold.

content: 23 Haran, Canneh, and Eden, the merchants of Sheba, Assyria, and Chilmad traded with you.
content_old: 23 Haran, Canneh, and Eden, the merchants of Sheba, Assyria, and Chilmad traded with you.

content: 24 These were your merchants in choice fabrics, embroidered cloaks of blue, and many-colored carpets tied up with cords and preserved with cedar—among your wares.
content_old: 24 These were your merchants in choice fabrics, embroidered cloaks of blue, and many-colored carpets tied up with cords and preserved with cedar—among your wares.

content: 25 The ships of Tarshish were in the service of your trade. So you were full and richly laden On the high seas.
content_old: 25 The ships of Tarshish were in the service of your trade. So you were full and richly laden On the high seas.

content: 26 Your oarsmen brought you out Into the mighty waters; The tempest wrecked you On the high seas.
content_old: 26 Your oarsmen brought you out Into the mighty waters; The tempest wrecked you On the high seas.

content: 27 Your wealth, your wares, your merchandise, Your sailors and your pilots, The men who made your repairs, Those who carried on your traffic, And all the fighting men within you— All the multitude within you— Shall go down into the depths of the sea On the day of your downfall.
content_old: 27 Your wealth, your wares, your merchandise, Your sailors and your pilots, The men who made your repairs, Those who carried on your traffic, And all the fighting men within you— All the multitude within you— Shall go down into the depths of the sea On the day of your downfall.

content: 28 At the outcry of your pilots The billows shall heave;
content_old: 28 At the outcry of your pilots The billows shall heave;

content: 29 And all the oarsmen and mariners, All the pilots of the sea, Shall come down from their ships And stand on the ground.
content_old: 29 And all the oarsmen and mariners, All the pilots of the sea, Shall come down from their ships And stand on the ground.

content: 30 They shall raise their voices over you And cry out bitterly; They shall cast dust on their heads And strew ashes on themselves.
content_old: 30 They shall raise their voices over you And cry out bitterly; They shall cast dust on their heads And strew ashes on themselves.

content: 31 On your account, they shall make Bald patches on their heads, And shall gird themselves with sackcloth. They shall weep over you, brokenhearted, With bitter lamenting;
content_old: 31 On your account, they shall make Bald patches on their heads, And shall gird themselves with sackcloth. They shall weep over you, brokenhearted, With bitter lamenting;

content: 32 They shall intone a dirge over you as they wail, And lament for you thus: Who was like Tyre when she was silenced In the midst of the sea?
content_old: 32 They shall intone a dirge over you as they wail, And lament for you thus: Who was like Tyre when she was silenced In the midst of the sea?

content: 33 When your wares were unloaded from the seas, You satisfied many peoples; With your great wealth and merchandise You enriched the kings of the earth.
content_old: 33 When your wares were unloaded from the seas, You satisfied many peoples; With your great wealth and merchandise You enriched the kings of the earth.

content: 34 But when you were wrecked on the seas, In the deep waters sank your merchandise And all the crew aboard you.
content_old: 34 But when you were wrecked on the seas, In the deep waters sank your merchandise And all the crew aboard you.

content: 35 All the inhabitants of the coastlands Are appalled over you; Their kings are aghast, Their faces contorted.
content_old: 35 All the inhabitants of the coastlands Are appalled over you; Their kings are aghast, Their faces contorted.

content: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 O mortal, say to the prince of Tyre: Thus said the Lord GOD: Because you have been so haughty and have said, “I am a god; I sit enthroned like a god in the heart of the seas,” whereas you are not a god but a man, though you deemed your mind equal to a god’s—
content_old: 2 O mortal, say to the prince of Tyre: Thus said the Lord GOD: Because you have been so haughty and have said, “I am a god; I sit enthroned like a god in the heart of the seas,” whereas you are not a god but a man, though you deemed your mind equal to a god’s—

content: 3 Yes, you are wiser than Daniel; In no hidden matter can anyone Compare to you.
content_old: 3 Yes, you are wiser than Daniel; In no hidden matter can anyone Compare to you.

content: 4 By your shrewd understanding You have gained riches, And have amassed gold and silver In your treasuries.
content_old: 4 By your shrewd understanding You have gained riches, And have amassed gold and silver In your treasuries.

content: 5 By your great shrewdness in trade You have increased your wealth, And you have grown haughty Because of your wealth.
content_old: 5 By your great shrewdness in trade You have increased your wealth, And you have grown haughty Because of your wealth.

content: 6 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: Because you have deemed your mind equal to a god’s,
content_old: 6 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: Because you have deemed your mind equal to a god’s,

content: 7 I swear I will bring against you Strangers, the most ruthless of nations. They shall unsheathe their swords Against your prized shrewdness, And they shall strike down your splendor.
content_old: 7 I swear I will bring against you Strangers, the most ruthless of nations. They shall unsheathe their swords Against your prized shrewdness, And they shall strike down your splendor.

content: 8 They shall bring you down to the Pit; In the heart of the sea you shall die The death of the slain.
content_old: 8 They shall bring you down to the Pit; In the heart of the sea you shall die The death of the slain.

content: 9 Will you still say, “I am a god” Before your slayers, When you are proved a man, not a god, At the hands of those who strike you down?
content_old: 9 Will you still say, “I am a god” Before your slayers, When you are proved a man, not a god, At the hands of those who strike you down?

content: 10 By the hands of strangers you shall die The death of the uncircumcised; For I have spoken —declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 10 By the hands of strangers you shall die The death of the uncircumcised; For I have spoken —declares the Lord GOD.

content: 11 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 11 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 12 O mortal, intone a dirge over the king of Tyre and say to him: Thus said the Lord GOD: You were the seal of perfection, Full of wisdom and flawless in beauty.
content_old: 12 O mortal, intone a dirge over the king of Tyre and say to him: Thus said the Lord GOD: You were the seal of perfection, Full of wisdom and flawless in beauty.

content: 13 You were in Eden, the garden of God; Every precious stone was your adornment: Carnelian, chrysolite, and amethyst; Beryl, lapis lazuli, and jasper; Sapphire, turquoise, and emerald; And gold beautifully wrought for you, Mined for you, prepared the day you were created.
content_old: 13 You were in Eden, the garden of God; Every precious stone was your adornment: Carnelian, chrysolite, and amethyst; Beryl, lapis lazuli, and jasper; Sapphire, turquoise, and emerald; And gold beautifully wrought for you, Mined for you, prepared the day you were created.

content: 14 I created you as a cherub With outstretched shielding wings; And you resided on God’s holy mountain; You walked among stones of fire.
content_old: 14 I created you as a cherub With outstretched shielding wings; And you resided on God’s holy mountain; You walked among stones of fire.

content: 15 You were blameless in your ways, From the day you were created Until wrongdoing was found in you.
content_old: 15 You were blameless in your ways, From the day you were created Until wrongdoing was found in you.

content: 16 By your far-flung commerce You were filled with lawlessness And you sinned. So I have struck you down From the mountain of God, And I have destroyed you, O shielding cherub, From among the stones of fire.
content_old: 16 By your far-flung commerce You were filled with lawlessness And you sinned. So I have struck you down From the mountain of God, And I have destroyed you, O shielding cherub, From among the stones of fire.

content: 17 You grew haughty because of your beauty, You debased your wisdom for the sake of your splendor; I have cast you to the ground, I have made you an object for kings to stare at.
content_old: 17 You grew haughty because of your beauty, You debased your wisdom for the sake of your splendor; I have cast you to the ground, I have made you an object for kings to stare at.

content: 18 By the greatness of your guilt, Through the dishonesty of your trading, You desecrated your sanctuaries. So I made a fire issue from you, And it has devoured you; I have reduced you to ashes on the ground, In the sight of all who behold you.
content_old: 18 By the greatness of your guilt, Through the dishonesty of your trading, You desecrated your sanctuaries. So I made a fire issue from you, And it has devoured you; I have reduced you to ashes on the ground, In the sight of all who behold you.

content: 19 All who knew you among the peoples Are appalled at your doom. You have become a horror And have ceased to be forever.
content_old: 19 All who knew you among the peoples Are appalled at your doom. You have become a horror And have ceased to be forever.

content: 20 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 20 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 21 O mortal, set your face toward Sidon and prophesy against her.
content_old: 21 O mortal, set your face toward Sidon and prophesy against her.

content: 22 Say: Thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to deal with you, O Sidon. I will gain glory in your midst; And they shall know that I am the LORD, When I wreak punishment upon her And show Myself holy through her.
content_old: 22 Say: Thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to deal with you, O Sidon. I will gain glory in your midst; And they shall know that I am the LORD, When I wreak punishment upon her And show Myself holy through her.

content: 23 I will let pestilence loose against her And bloodshed into her streets. And the slain shall fall in her midst When the sword comes upon her from all sides. And they shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 23 I will let pestilence loose against her And bloodshed into her streets. And the slain shall fall in her midst When the sword comes upon her from all sides. And they shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 24 Then shall the House of Israel no longer be afflicted with prickling briers and lacerating thorns from all the neighbors who despise them; and they shall know that I am the Lord GOD.
content_old: 24 Then shall the House of Israel no longer be afflicted with prickling briers and lacerating thorns from all the neighbors who despise them; and they shall know that I am the Lord GOD.

content: 25 Thus said the Lord GOD: When I have gathered the House of Israel from the peoples among which they have been dispersed, and have shown Myself holy through them in the sight of the nations, they shall settle on their own soil, which I gave to My servant Jacob,
content_old: 25 Thus said the Lord GOD: When I have gathered the House of Israel from the peoples among which they have been dispersed, and have shown Myself holy through them in the sight of the nations, they shall settle on their own soil, which I gave to My servant Jacob,

content: 1 In the tenth year, on the twelfth day of the tenth month, the word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 In the tenth year, on the twelfth day of the tenth month, the word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 O mortal, turn your face against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and prophesy against him and against all Egypt.
content_old: 2 O mortal, turn your face against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and prophesy against him and against all Egypt.

content: 3 Speak these words: Thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to deal with you, O Pharaoh king of Egypt, Mighty monster, sprawling in your channels, Who said, My Nile is my own; I made it for myself.
content_old: 3 Speak these words: Thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to deal with you, O Pharaoh king of Egypt, Mighty monster, sprawling in your channels, Who said, My Nile is my own; I made it for myself.

content: 4 I will put hooks in your jaws, And make the fish of your channels Cling to your scales; I will haul you up from your channels, With all the fish of your channels Clinging to your scales.
content_old: 4 I will put hooks in your jaws, And make the fish of your channels Cling to your scales; I will haul you up from your channels, With all the fish of your channels Clinging to your scales.

content: 5 And I will fling you into the desert, With all the fish of your channels. You shall be left lying in the open, Ungathered and unburied: I have given you as food To the beasts of the earth And the birds of the sky.
content_old: 5 And I will fling you into the desert, With all the fish of your channels. You shall be left lying in the open, Ungathered and unburied: I have given you as food To the beasts of the earth And the birds of the sky.

content: 6 Then all the inhabitants of Egypt shall know That I am the LORD. Because you were a staff of reed To the House of Israel:
content_old: 6 Then all the inhabitants of Egypt shall know That I am the LORD. Because you were a staff of reed To the House of Israel:

content: 7 When they grasped you with the hand, you would splinter, And wound all their shoulders, And when they leaned on you, you would break, And make all their loins unsteady.
content_old: 7 When they grasped you with the hand, you would splinter, And wound all their shoulders, And when they leaned on you, you would break, And make all their loins unsteady.

content: 8 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: Lo, I will bring a sword against you, and will cut off man and beast from you,
content_old: 8 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: Lo, I will bring a sword against you, and will cut off man and beast from you,

content: 9 so that the land of Egypt shall fall into desolation and ruin. And they shall know that I am the LORD—because he boasted, “The Nile is mine, and I made it.”
content_old: 9 so that the land of Egypt shall fall into desolation and ruin. And they shall know that I am the LORD—because he boasted, “The Nile is mine, and I made it.”

content: 10 Assuredly, I am going to deal with you and your channels, and I will reduce the land of Egypt to utter ruin and desolation, from Migdol to Syene, all the way to the border of Nubia.
content_old: 10 Assuredly, I am going to deal with you and your channels, and I will reduce the land of Egypt to utter ruin and desolation, from Migdol to Syene, all the way to the border of Nubia.

content: 11 No foot of man shall traverse it, and no foot of beast shall traverse it; and it shall remain uninhabited for forty years.
content_old: 11 No foot of man shall traverse it, and no foot of beast shall traverse it; and it shall remain uninhabited for forty years.

content: 12 For forty years I will make the land of Egypt the most desolate of desolate lands, and its cities shall be the most desolate of ruined cities. And I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them throughout the countries.
content_old: 12 For forty years I will make the land of Egypt the most desolate of desolate lands, and its cities shall be the most desolate of ruined cities. And I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them throughout the countries.

content: 13 Further, thus said the Lord GOD: After a period of forty years I will gather the Egyptians from the peoples among whom they were dispersed.
content_old: 13 Further, thus said the Lord GOD: After a period of forty years I will gather the Egyptians from the peoples among whom they were dispersed.

content: 14 I will restore the fortunes of the Egyptians and bring them back to the land of their origin, the land of Pathros, and there they shall be a lowly kingdom.
content_old: 14 I will restore the fortunes of the Egyptians and bring them back to the land of their origin, the land of Pathros, and there they shall be a lowly kingdom.

content: 15 It shall be the lowliest of all the kingdoms, and shall not lord it over the nations again. I will reduce the Egyptians, so that they shall have no dominion over the nations.
content_old: 15 It shall be the lowliest of all the kingdoms, and shall not lord it over the nations again. I will reduce the Egyptians, so that they shall have no dominion over the nations.

content: 16 Never again shall they be the trust of the House of Israel, recalling its guilt in having turned to them. And they shall know that I am the Lord GOD.
content_old: 16 Never again shall they be the trust of the House of Israel, recalling its guilt in having turned to them. And they shall know that I am the Lord GOD.

content: 17 In the twenty-seventh year, on the first day of the first month, the word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 17 In the twenty-seventh year, on the first day of the first month, the word of the LORD came to me:

content: 18 O mortal, King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon has made his army expend vast labor on Tyre; every head is rubbed bald and every shoulder scraped. But he and his army have had no return for the labor he expended on Tyre.
content_old: 18 O mortal, King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon has made his army expend vast labor on Tyre; every head is rubbed bald and every shoulder scraped. But he and his army have had no return for the labor he expended on Tyre.

content: 19 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: I will give the land of Egypt to Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon. He shall carry off her wealth and take her spoil and seize her booty; and she shall be the recompense of his army.
content_old: 19 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: I will give the land of Egypt to Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon. He shall carry off her wealth and take her spoil and seize her booty; and she shall be the recompense of his army.

content: 20 As the wage for which he labored, for what they did for Me, I give him the land of Egypt—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 20 As the wage for which he labored, for what they did for Me, I give him the land of Egypt—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 O mortal, prophesy and say: Thus said the Lord GOD: Wail, alas for the day!
content_old: 2 O mortal, prophesy and say: Thus said the Lord GOD: Wail, alas for the day!

content: 3 For a day is near; A day of the LORD is near. It will be a day of cloud, An hour of nations.
content_old: 3 For a day is near; A day of the LORD is near. It will be a day of cloud, An hour of nations.

content: 4 A sword shall pierce Egypt, And Nubia shall be seized with trembling, When men fall slain in Egypt And her wealth is seized And her foundations are overthrown.
content_old: 4 A sword shall pierce Egypt, And Nubia shall be seized with trembling, When men fall slain in Egypt And her wealth is seized And her foundations are overthrown.

content: 5 Nubia, Put, and Lud, and all the mixed populations, and Cub, and the inhabitants of the allied countries shall fall by the sword with them.
content_old: 5 Nubia, Put, and Lud, and all the mixed populations, and Cub, and the inhabitants of the allied countries shall fall by the sword with them.

content: 6 Thus said the LORD: Those who support Egypt shall fall, And her proud strength shall sink; There they shall fall by the sword, From Migdol to Syene —declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 6 Thus said the LORD: Those who support Egypt shall fall, And her proud strength shall sink; There they shall fall by the sword, From Migdol to Syene —declares the Lord GOD.

content: 7 They shall be the most desolate of desolate lands, and her cities shall be the most ruined of cities,
content_old: 7 They shall be the most desolate of desolate lands, and her cities shall be the most ruined of cities,

content: 8 when I set fire to Egypt and all who help her are broken. Thus they shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 8 when I set fire to Egypt and all who help her are broken. Thus they shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 9 On that day, messengers shall set out at My bidding to strike terror into confident Nubia. And they shall be seized with trembling on Egypt’s day of doom—for it is at hand.
content_old: 9 On that day, messengers shall set out at My bidding to strike terror into confident Nubia. And they shall be seized with trembling on Egypt’s day of doom—for it is at hand.

content: 10 Thus said the Lord GOD: I will put an end to the wealth of Egypt through King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon.
content_old: 10 Thus said the Lord GOD: I will put an end to the wealth of Egypt through King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon.

content: 11 He, together with his troops, the most ruthless of the nations, shall be brought to ravage the land. And they shall unsheathe the sword against Egypt and fill the land with the slain.
content_old: 11 He, together with his troops, the most ruthless of the nations, shall be brought to ravage the land. And they shall unsheathe the sword against Egypt and fill the land with the slain.

content: 12 I will turn the channels into dry ground, and I will deliver the land into the hands of evil men. I will lay waste the land and everything in it by the hands of strangers. I the LORD have spoken.
content_old: 12 I will turn the channels into dry ground, and I will deliver the land into the hands of evil men. I will lay waste the land and everything in it by the hands of strangers. I the LORD have spoken.

content: 13 Thus said the Lord GOD: I will destroy the fetishes and make an end of the idols in Noph; and no longer shall there be a prince in the land of Egypt; and I will strike the land of Egypt with fear.
content_old: 13 Thus said the Lord GOD: I will destroy the fetishes and make an end of the idols in Noph; and no longer shall there be a prince in the land of Egypt; and I will strike the land of Egypt with fear.

content: 14 I will lay Pathros waste, I will set fire to Zoan, and I will execute judgment on No.
content_old: 14 I will lay Pathros waste, I will set fire to Zoan, and I will execute judgment on No.

content: 15 I will pour out my anger upon Sin, the stronghold of Egypt, and I will destroy the wealth of No.
content_old: 15 I will pour out my anger upon Sin, the stronghold of Egypt, and I will destroy the wealth of No.

content: 16 I will set fire to Egypt; Sin shall writhe in anguish and No shall be torn apart; and Noph shall face adversaries in broad daylight.
content_old: 16 I will set fire to Egypt; Sin shall writhe in anguish and No shall be torn apart; and Noph shall face adversaries in broad daylight.

content: 17 The young men of Aven and Pi-beseth shall fall by the sword, and those shall go into captivity.
content_old: 17 The young men of Aven and Pi-beseth shall fall by the sword, and those shall go into captivity.

content: 18 In Tehaphnehes daylight shall be withheld, when I break there the power of Egypt, and there her proud strength comes to an end. The city itself shall be covered with cloud, and its daughter towns shall go into captivity.
content_old: 18 In Tehaphnehes daylight shall be withheld, when I break there the power of Egypt, and there her proud strength comes to an end. The city itself shall be covered with cloud, and its daughter towns shall go into captivity.

content: 19 Thus I will execute judgment on Egypt; And they shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 19 Thus I will execute judgment on Egypt; And they shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 20 In the eleventh year, on the seventh day of the first month, the word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 20 In the eleventh year, on the seventh day of the first month, the word of the LORD came to me:

content: 21 O mortal, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt; it has not been bound up to be healed nor firmly bandaged to make it strong enough to grasp the sword.
content_old: 21 O mortal, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt; it has not been bound up to be healed nor firmly bandaged to make it strong enough to grasp the sword.

content: 22 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to deal with Pharaoh king of Egypt. I will break his arms, both the sound one and the injured, and make the sword drop from his hand.
content_old: 22 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to deal with Pharaoh king of Egypt. I will break his arms, both the sound one and the injured, and make the sword drop from his hand.

content: 23 I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them throughout the countries.
content_old: 23 I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them throughout the countries.

content: 24 I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon and put My sword in his hand; and I will break the arms of Pharaoh, and he shall groan before him with the groans of one struck down.
content_old: 24 I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon and put My sword in his hand; and I will break the arms of Pharaoh, and he shall groan before him with the groans of one struck down.

content: 25 I will make firm the arms of the king of Babylon, but the arms of Pharaoh shall fail. And they shall know that I am the LORD, when I put My sword into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he lifts it against the land of Egypt.
content_old: 25 I will make firm the arms of the king of Babylon, but the arms of Pharaoh shall fail. And they shall know that I am the LORD, when I put My sword into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he lifts it against the land of Egypt.

content: 1 In the eleventh year, on the first day of the third month, the word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 In the eleventh year, on the first day of the third month, the word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 O mortal, say to Pharaoh king of Egypt and his hordes: Who was comparable to you in greatness?
content_old: 2 O mortal, say to Pharaoh king of Egypt and his hordes: Who was comparable to you in greatness?

content: 3 Assyria was a cedar in Lebanon With beautiful branches and shady thickets, Of lofty stature, With its top among leafy trees.
content_old: 3 Assyria was a cedar in Lebanon With beautiful branches and shady thickets, Of lofty stature, With its top among leafy trees.

content: 4 Waters nourished it, The deep made it grow tall, Washing with its streams The place where it was planted, Making its channels well up To all the trees of the field.
content_old: 4 Waters nourished it, The deep made it grow tall, Washing with its streams The place where it was planted, Making its channels well up To all the trees of the field.

content: 5 Therefore it exceeded in stature All the trees of the field; Its branches multiplied and its boughs grew long Because of the abundant water That welled up for it.
content_old: 5 Therefore it exceeded in stature All the trees of the field; Its branches multiplied and its boughs grew long Because of the abundant water That welled up for it.

content: 6 In its branches nested All the birds of the sky; All the beasts of the field Bore their young under its boughs, And in its shadow lived All the great nations.
content_old: 6 In its branches nested All the birds of the sky; All the beasts of the field Bore their young under its boughs, And in its shadow lived All the great nations.

content: 7 It was beautiful in its height, In the length of its branches, Because its stock stood By abundant waters.
content_old: 7 It was beautiful in its height, In the length of its branches, Because its stock stood By abundant waters.

content: 8 Cedars in the garden of God Could not compare with it; Cypresses could not match its boughs, And plane trees could not vie with its branches; No tree in the garden of God Was its peer in beauty.
content_old: 8 Cedars in the garden of God Could not compare with it; Cypresses could not match its boughs, And plane trees could not vie with its branches; No tree in the garden of God Was its peer in beauty.

content: 9 I made it beautiful In the profusion of its branches; And all the trees of Eden envied it In the garden of God.
content_old: 9 I made it beautiful In the profusion of its branches; And all the trees of Eden envied it In the garden of God.

content: 10 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: Because it towered high in stature, and thrust its top up among the leafy trees, and it was arrogant in its height,
content_old: 10 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: Because it towered high in stature, and thrust its top up among the leafy trees, and it was arrogant in its height,

content: 11 I delivered it into the hands of the mightiest of nations. They treated it as befitted its wickedness. I banished it.
content_old: 11 I delivered it into the hands of the mightiest of nations. They treated it as befitted its wickedness. I banished it.

content: 12 Strangers, the most ruthless of nations, cut it down and abandoned it; its branches fell on the mountains and in every valley; its boughs were splintered in every watercourse of the earth; and all the peoples of the earth departed from its shade and abandoned it.
content_old: 12 Strangers, the most ruthless of nations, cut it down and abandoned it; its branches fell on the mountains and in every valley; its boughs were splintered in every watercourse of the earth; and all the peoples of the earth departed from its shade and abandoned it.

content: 13 Upon its fallen trunk all the birds of the sky nest, and all the beasts of the field lodge among its boughs—
content_old: 13 Upon its fallen trunk all the birds of the sky nest, and all the beasts of the field lodge among its boughs—

content: 14 so that no trees by water should exalt themselves in stature or set their tops among the leafy trees, and that no well-watered tree may reach up to them in height. For they are all consigned to death, to the lowest part of the netherworld, together with human beings who descend into the Pit.
content_old: 14 so that no trees by water should exalt themselves in stature or set their tops among the leafy trees, and that no well-watered tree may reach up to them in height. For they are all consigned to death, to the lowest part of the netherworld, together with human beings who descend into the Pit.

content: 15 Thus said the Lord GOD: On the day it went down to Sheol, I closed the deep over it and covered it; I held back its streams, and the great waters were checked. I made Lebanon mourn deeply for it, and all the trees of the field languished on its account.
content_old: 15 Thus said the Lord GOD: On the day it went down to Sheol, I closed the deep over it and covered it; I held back its streams, and the great waters were checked. I made Lebanon mourn deeply for it, and all the trees of the field languished on its account.

content: 16 I made nations quake at the crash of its fall, when I cast it down to Sheol with those who descend into the Pit; and all the trees of Eden, the choicest and best of Lebanon, all that were well watered, were consoled in the lowest part of the netherworld.
content_old: 16 I made nations quake at the crash of its fall, when I cast it down to Sheol with those who descend into the Pit; and all the trees of Eden, the choicest and best of Lebanon, all that were well watered, were consoled in the lowest part of the netherworld.

content: 17 They also descended with it into Sheol, to those slain by the sword, together with its supporters, they who had lived under its shadow among the nations.
content_old: 17 They also descended with it into Sheol, to those slain by the sword, together with its supporters, they who had lived under its shadow among the nations.

content: 1 In the twelfth year, on the first day of the twelfth month, the word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 In the twelfth year, on the first day of the twelfth month, the word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 O mortal, intone a dirge over Pharaoh king of Egypt. Say to him: O great beast among the nations, you are doomed! You are like the dragon in the seas, Thrusting through their streams, Stirring up the water with your feet And muddying their streams!
content_old: 2 O mortal, intone a dirge over Pharaoh king of Egypt. Say to him: O great beast among the nations, you are doomed! You are like the dragon in the seas, Thrusting through their streams, Stirring up the water with your feet And muddying their streams!

content: 3 Thus said the Lord GOD: I will cast My net over you In an assembly of many peoples, And you shall be hauled up in My toils.
content_old: 3 Thus said the Lord GOD: I will cast My net over you In an assembly of many peoples, And you shall be hauled up in My toils.

content: 4 And I will fling you to the ground, Hurl you upon the open field. I will cause all the birds of the sky To settle upon you. I will cause the beasts of all the earth To batten on you.
content_old: 4 And I will fling you to the ground, Hurl you upon the open field. I will cause all the birds of the sky To settle upon you. I will cause the beasts of all the earth To batten on you.

content: 5 I will cast your carcass upon the hills And fill the valleys with your rotting flesh.
content_old: 5 I will cast your carcass upon the hills And fill the valleys with your rotting flesh.

content: 6 I will drench the earth With your oozing blood upon the hills, And the watercourses shall be filled with your gore.
content_old: 6 I will drench the earth With your oozing blood upon the hills, And the watercourses shall be filled with your gore.

content: 7 When you are snuffed out, I will cover the sky And darken its stars; I will cover the sun with clouds And the moon shall not give its light.
content_old: 7 When you are snuffed out, I will cover the sky And darken its stars; I will cover the sun with clouds And the moon shall not give its light.

content: 8 All the lights that shine in the sky I will darken above you; And I will bring darkness upon your land —declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 8 All the lights that shine in the sky I will darken above you; And I will bring darkness upon your land —declares the Lord GOD.

content: 9 I will vex the hearts of many peoples When I bring your shattered remnants among the nations, To countries which you never knew.
content_old: 9 I will vex the hearts of many peoples When I bring your shattered remnants among the nations, To countries which you never knew.
