content: 10 I will strike many peoples with horror over your fate; And their kings shall be aghast over you, When I brandish My sword before them. They shall tremble continually, Each man for his own life, On the day of your downfall.
content_old: 10 I will strike many peoples with horror over your fate; And their kings shall be aghast over you, When I brandish My sword before them. They shall tremble continually, Each man for his own life, On the day of your downfall.

content: 11 For thus said the Lord GOD: The sword of the king of Babylon shall come upon you.
content_old: 11 For thus said the Lord GOD: The sword of the king of Babylon shall come upon you.

content: 12 I will cause your multitude to fall By the swords of warriors, All the most ruthless among the nations. They shall ravage the splendor of Egypt, And all her masses shall be wiped out.
content_old: 12 I will cause your multitude to fall By the swords of warriors, All the most ruthless among the nations. They shall ravage the splendor of Egypt, And all her masses shall be wiped out.

content: 13 I will make all her cattle vanish from beside abundant waters; The feet of man shall not muddy them any more, Nor shall the hoofs of cattle muddy them.
content_old: 13 I will make all her cattle vanish from beside abundant waters; The feet of man shall not muddy them any more, Nor shall the hoofs of cattle muddy them.

content: 14 Then I will let their waters settle, And make their rivers flow like oil —declares the Lord GOD:
content_old: 14 Then I will let their waters settle, And make their rivers flow like oil —declares the Lord GOD:

content: 15 When I lay the land of Egypt waste, When the land is emptied of that filled it, When I strike down all its inhabitants. And they shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 15 When I lay the land of Egypt waste, When the land is emptied of that filled it, When I strike down all its inhabitants. And they shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 16 This is a dirge, and it shall be intoned; The women of the nations shall intone it, They shall intone it over Egypt and all her multitude —declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 16 This is a dirge, and it shall be intoned; The women of the nations shall intone it, They shall intone it over Egypt and all her multitude —declares the Lord GOD.

content: 17 In the twelfth year, on the fifteenth day of the month, the word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 17 In the twelfth year, on the fifteenth day of the month, the word of the LORD came to me:

content: 18 O mortal, wail—along with the women of the mighty nations—over the masses of Egypt, accompanying their descent to the lowest part of the netherworld, among those who have gone down into the Pit.
content_old: 18 O mortal, wail—along with the women of the mighty nations—over the masses of Egypt, accompanying their descent to the lowest part of the netherworld, among those who have gone down into the Pit.

content: 19 Whom do you surpass in beauty? Down with you, and be laid to rest with the uncircumcised!
content_old: 19 Whom do you surpass in beauty? Down with you, and be laid to rest with the uncircumcised!

content: 20 They shall lie amid those slain by the sword, amid those slain by the sword Egypt has been dragged and left with all her masses.
content_old: 20 They shall lie amid those slain by the sword, amid those slain by the sword Egypt has been dragged and left with all her masses.

content: 21 From the depths of Sheol the mightiest of warriors speak to him and his allies; the uncircumcised, the slain by the sword, have gone down and lie.
content_old: 21 From the depths of Sheol the mightiest of warriors speak to him and his allies; the uncircumcised, the slain by the sword, have gone down and lie.

content: 22 Assyria is there with all her company, their graves round about, all of them slain, fallen by the sword.
content_old: 22 Assyria is there with all her company, their graves round about, all of them slain, fallen by the sword.

content: 23 Their graves set in the farthest recesses of the Pit, all her company are round about her tomb, all of them slain, fallen by the sword—they who struck terror in the land of the living.
content_old: 23 Their graves set in the farthest recesses of the Pit, all her company are round about her tomb, all of them slain, fallen by the sword—they who struck terror in the land of the living.

content: 24 There too is Elam and all her masses round about her tomb, all of them slain, fallen by the sword—they who descended uncircumcised to the lowest part of the netherworld, who struck terror in the land of the living—now they bear their shame with those who have gone down to the Pit.
content_old: 24 There too is Elam and all her masses round about her tomb, all of them slain, fallen by the sword—they who descended uncircumcised to the lowest part of the netherworld, who struck terror in the land of the living—now they bear their shame with those who have gone down to the Pit.

content: 25 They made a bed for her among the slain, with all her masses; their graves are round about her. They are all uncircumcised, slain by the sword. Though their terror was once spread over the land of the living, they bear their shame with those who have gone into the Pit; they are placed among the slain.
content_old: 25 They made a bed for her among the slain, with all her masses; their graves are round about her. They are all uncircumcised, slain by the sword. Though their terror was once spread over the land of the living, they bear their shame with those who have gone into the Pit; they are placed among the slain.

content: 26 Meshech and Tubal and all their masses are there; their graves are round about. They are all uncircumcised, pierced through by the sword—they who once struck terror in the land of the living.
content_old: 26 Meshech and Tubal and all their masses are there; their graves are round about. They are all uncircumcised, pierced through by the sword—they who once struck terror in the land of the living.

content: 27 And they do not lie with the fallen uncircumcised warriors, who went down to Sheol with their battle gear, who put their swords beneath their heads and their iniquities upon their bones—for the terror of the warriors was upon the land of the living.
content_old: 27 And they do not lie with the fallen uncircumcised warriors, who went down to Sheol with their battle gear, who put their swords beneath their heads and their iniquities upon their bones—for the terror of the warriors was upon the land of the living.

content: 28 And you too shall be shattered amid the uncircumcised, and lie among those slain by the sword.
content_old: 28 And you too shall be shattered amid the uncircumcised, and lie among those slain by the sword.

content: 29 Edom is there, her kings and all her chieftains, who, for all their might, are laid among those who are slain by the sword; they too lie with the uncircumcised and with those who have gone down to the Pit.
content_old: 29 Edom is there, her kings and all her chieftains, who, for all their might, are laid among those who are slain by the sword; they too lie with the uncircumcised and with those who have gone down to the Pit.

content: 30 All the princes of the north and all the Sidonians are there, who went down in disgrace with the slain, in spite of the terror that their might inspired; and they lie, uncircumcised, with those who are slain by the sword, and bear their shame with those who have gone down to the Pit.
content_old: 30 All the princes of the north and all the Sidonians are there, who went down in disgrace with the slain, in spite of the terror that their might inspired; and they lie, uncircumcised, with those who are slain by the sword, and bear their shame with those who have gone down to the Pit.

content: 31 These Pharaoh shall see, and he shall be consoled for all his masses, those of Pharaoh’s men slain by the sword and all his army—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 31 These Pharaoh shall see, and he shall be consoled for all his masses, those of Pharaoh’s men slain by the sword and all his army—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 O mortal, speak to your fellow countrymen and say to them: When I bring the sword against a country, the citizens of that country take one of their number and appoint him their watchman.
content_old: 2 O mortal, speak to your fellow countrymen and say to them: When I bring the sword against a country, the citizens of that country take one of their number and appoint him their watchman.

content: 3 Suppose he sees the sword advancing against the country, and he blows the horn and warns the people.
content_old: 3 Suppose he sees the sword advancing against the country, and he blows the horn and warns the people.

content: 4 If anybody hears the sound of the horn but ignores the warning, and the sword comes and dispatches him, his blood shall be on his own head.
content_old: 4 If anybody hears the sound of the horn but ignores the warning, and the sword comes and dispatches him, his blood shall be on his own head.

content: 5 Since he heard the sound of the horn but ignored the warning, his bloodguilt shall be upon himself; had he taken the warning, he would have saved his life.
content_old: 5 Since he heard the sound of the horn but ignored the warning, his bloodguilt shall be upon himself; had he taken the warning, he would have saved his life.

content: 6 But if the watchman sees the sword advancing and does not blow the horn, so that the people are not warned, and the sword comes and destroys one of them, that person was destroyed for his own sins; however, I will demand a reckoning for his blood from the watchman.
content_old: 6 But if the watchman sees the sword advancing and does not blow the horn, so that the people are not warned, and the sword comes and destroys one of them, that person was destroyed for his own sins; however, I will demand a reckoning for his blood from the watchman.

content: 7 Now, O mortal, I have appointed you a watchman for the House of Israel; and whenever you hear a message from My mouth, you must transmit My warning to them.
content_old: 7 Now, O mortal, I have appointed you a watchman for the House of Israel; and whenever you hear a message from My mouth, you must transmit My warning to them.

content: 8 When I say to the wicked, “Wicked man, you shall die,” but you have not spoken to warn the wicked man against his way, he, that wicked man, shall die for his sins, but I will demand a reckoning for his blood from you.
content_old: 8 When I say to the wicked, “Wicked man, you shall die,” but you have not spoken to warn the wicked man against his way, he, that wicked man, shall die for his sins, but I will demand a reckoning for his blood from you.

content: 9 But if you have warned the wicked man to turn back from his way, and he has not turned from his way, he shall die for his own sins, but you will have saved your life.
content_old: 9 But if you have warned the wicked man to turn back from his way, and he has not turned from his way, he shall die for his own sins, but you will have saved your life.

content: 10 Now, O mortal, say to the House of Israel: This is what you have been saying: “Our transgressions and our sins weigh heavily upon us; we are sick at heart about them. How can we survive?”
content_old: 10 Now, O mortal, say to the House of Israel: This is what you have been saying: “Our transgressions and our sins weigh heavily upon us; we are sick at heart about them. How can we survive?”

content: 11 Say to them: As I live—declares the Lord GOD—it is not My desire that the wicked shall die, but that the wicked turn from his evil ways and live. Turn back, turn back from your evil ways, that you may not die, O House of Israel!
content_old: 11 Say to them: As I live—declares the Lord GOD—it is not My desire that the wicked shall die, but that the wicked turn from his evil ways and live. Turn back, turn back from your evil ways, that you may not die, O House of Israel!

content: 12 Now, O mortal, say to your fellow countrymen: The righteousness of the righteous shall not save him when he transgresses, nor shall the wickedness of the wicked cause him to stumble when he turns back from his wickedness. The righteous shall not survive through his righteousness when he sins.
content_old: 12 Now, O mortal, say to your fellow countrymen: The righteousness of the righteous shall not save him when he transgresses, nor shall the wickedness of the wicked cause him to stumble when he turns back from his wickedness. The righteous shall not survive through his righteousness when he sins.

content: 13 When I say of the righteous “He shall surely live,” and, relying on his righteousness, he commits iniquity, none of his righteous deeds shall be remembered; but for the iniquity that he has committed he shall die.
content_old: 13 When I say of the righteous “He shall surely live,” and, relying on his righteousness, he commits iniquity, none of his righteous deeds shall be remembered; but for the iniquity that he has committed he shall die.

content: 14 So, too, when I say to the wicked, “You shall die,” and he turns back from his sinfulness and does what is just and right—
content_old: 14 So, too, when I say to the wicked, “You shall die,” and he turns back from his sinfulness and does what is just and right—

content: 15 if the wicked man restores a pledge, makes good what he has taken by robbery, follows the laws of life, and does not commit iniquity—he shall live, he shall not die.
content_old: 15 if the wicked man restores a pledge, makes good what he has taken by robbery, follows the laws of life, and does not commit iniquity—he shall live, he shall not die.

content: 16 None of the sins that he committed shall be remembered against him; since he does what is just and right, he shall live.
content_old: 16 None of the sins that he committed shall be remembered against him; since he does what is just and right, he shall live.

content: 17 Your fellow countrymen say, “The way of the Lord is unfair.” But it is their way that is unfair!
content_old: 17 Your fellow countrymen say, “The way of the Lord is unfair.” But it is their way that is unfair!

content: 18 When a righteous man turns away from his righteous deeds and commits iniquity, he shall die for it.
content_old: 18 When a righteous man turns away from his righteous deeds and commits iniquity, he shall die for it.

content: 19 And when a wicked man turns back from his wickedness and does what is just and right, it is he who shall live by virtue of these things.
content_old: 19 And when a wicked man turns back from his wickedness and does what is just and right, it is he who shall live by virtue of these things.

content: 20 And will you say, “The way of the Lord is unfair”? I will judge each one of you according to his ways, O House of Israel!
content_old: 20 And will you say, “The way of the Lord is unfair”? I will judge each one of you according to his ways, O House of Israel!

content: 21 In the twelfth year of our exile, on the fifth day of the tenth month, a fugitive came to me from Jerusalem and reported, “The city has fallen.”
content_old: 21 In the twelfth year of our exile, on the fifth day of the tenth month, a fugitive came to me from Jerusalem and reported, “The city has fallen.”

content: 22 Now the hand of the LORD had come upon me the evening before the fugitive arrived, and He opened my mouth before he came to me in the morning; thus my mouth was opened and I was no longer speechless.
content_old: 22 Now the hand of the LORD had come upon me the evening before the fugitive arrived, and He opened my mouth before he came to me in the morning; thus my mouth was opened and I was no longer speechless.

content: 23 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 23 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 24 O mortal, those who live in these ruins in the land of Israel argue, “Abraham was but one man, yet he was granted possession of the land. We are many; surely, the land has been given as a possession to us.”
content_old: 24 O mortal, those who live in these ruins in the land of Israel argue, “Abraham was but one man, yet he was granted possession of the land. We are many; surely, the land has been given as a possession to us.”

content: 25 Therefore say to them: Thus said the Lord GOD: You eat with the blood, you raise your eyes to your fetishes, and you shed blood—yet you expect to possess the land!
content_old: 25 Therefore say to them: Thus said the Lord GOD: You eat with the blood, you raise your eyes to your fetishes, and you shed blood—yet you expect to possess the land!

content: 26 You have relied on your sword, you have committed abominations, you have all defiled other men’s wives—yet you expect to possess the land!
content_old: 26 You have relied on your sword, you have committed abominations, you have all defiled other men’s wives—yet you expect to possess the land!

content: 27 Thus shall you speak to them: Thus said the Lord GOD: As I live, those who are in the ruins shall fall by the sword, and those who are in the open I have allotted as food to the beasts, and those who are in the strongholds and caves shall die by pestilence.
content_old: 27 Thus shall you speak to them: Thus said the Lord GOD: As I live, those who are in the ruins shall fall by the sword, and those who are in the open I have allotted as food to the beasts, and those who are in the strongholds and caves shall die by pestilence.

content: 28 I will make the land a desolate waste, and her proud glory shall cease; and the mountains of Israel shall be desolate, with none passing through.
content_old: 28 I will make the land a desolate waste, and her proud glory shall cease; and the mountains of Israel shall be desolate, with none passing through.

content: 29 And they shall know that I am the LORD, when I make the land a desolate waste on account of all the abominations which they have committed.
content_old: 29 And they shall know that I am the LORD, when I make the land a desolate waste on account of all the abominations which they have committed.

content: 30 Note well, O mortal: your fellow countrymen who converse about you by the walls and in the doorways of their houses and say to each other and propose to one another, “Come and hear what word has issued from the LORD.”
content_old: 30 Note well, O mortal: your fellow countrymen who converse about you by the walls and in the doorways of their houses and say to each other and propose to one another, “Come and hear what word has issued from the LORD.”

content: 31 They will come to you in crowds and sit before you in throngs and will hear your words, but they will not obey them. For they produce nothing but lust with their mouths; and their hearts pursue nothing but gain.
content_old: 31 They will come to you in crowds and sit before you in throngs and will hear your words, but they will not obey them. For they produce nothing but lust with their mouths; and their hearts pursue nothing but gain.

content: 32 To them you are just a singer of bawdy songs, who has a sweet voice and plays skillfully; they hear your words, but will not obey them.
content_old: 32 To them you are just a singer of bawdy songs, who has a sweet voice and plays skillfully; they hear your words, but will not obey them.

content: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 O mortal, prophesy against the shepherds of Israel. Prophesy, and say to them: To the shepherds: Thus said the Lord GOD: Ah, you shepherds of Israel, who have been tending yourselves! Is it not the flock that the shepherds ought to tend?
content_old: 2 O mortal, prophesy against the shepherds of Israel. Prophesy, and say to them: To the shepherds: Thus said the Lord GOD: Ah, you shepherds of Israel, who have been tending yourselves! Is it not the flock that the shepherds ought to tend?

content: 3 You partake of the fat, you clothe yourselves with the wool, and you slaughter the fatlings; but you do not tend the flock.
content_old: 3 You partake of the fat, you clothe yourselves with the wool, and you slaughter the fatlings; but you do not tend the flock.

content: 4 You have not sustained the weak, healed the sick, or bandaged the injured; you have not brought back the strayed, or looked for the lost; but you have driven them with harsh rigor,
content_old: 4 You have not sustained the weak, healed the sick, or bandaged the injured; you have not brought back the strayed, or looked for the lost; but you have driven them with harsh rigor,

content: 5 and they have been scattered for want of anyone to tend them; scattered, they have become prey for every wild beast.
content_old: 5 and they have been scattered for want of anyone to tend them; scattered, they have become prey for every wild beast.

content: 6 My sheep stray through all the mountains and over every lofty hill; My flock is scattered all over the face of the earth, with none to take thought of them and none to seek them.
content_old: 6 My sheep stray through all the mountains and over every lofty hill; My flock is scattered all over the face of the earth, with none to take thought of them and none to seek them.

content: 7 Hear then, O shepherds, the word of the LORD!
content_old: 7 Hear then, O shepherds, the word of the LORD!

content: 8 As I live—declares the Lord GOD: Because My flock has been a spoil—My flock has been a prey for all the wild beasts, for want of anyone to tend them since My shepherds have not taken thought of My flock, for the shepherds tended themselves instead of tending the flock—
content_old: 8 As I live—declares the Lord GOD: Because My flock has been a spoil—My flock has been a prey for all the wild beasts, for want of anyone to tend them since My shepherds have not taken thought of My flock, for the shepherds tended themselves instead of tending the flock—

content: 9 hear indeed, O shepherds, the word of the LORD:
content_old: 9 hear indeed, O shepherds, the word of the LORD:

content: 10 Thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to deal with the shepherds! I will demand a reckoning of them for My flock, and I will dismiss them from tending the flock. The shepherds shall not tend themselves any more; for I will rescue My flock from their mouths, and it shall not be their prey.
content_old: 10 Thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to deal with the shepherds! I will demand a reckoning of them for My flock, and I will dismiss them from tending the flock. The shepherds shall not tend themselves any more; for I will rescue My flock from their mouths, and it shall not be their prey.

content: 11 For thus said the Lord GOD: Here am I! I am going to take thought for My flock and I will seek them out.
content_old: 11 For thus said the Lord GOD: Here am I! I am going to take thought for My flock and I will seek them out.

content: 12 As a shepherd seeks out his flock when some in his flock have gotten separated, so I will seek out My flock, I will rescue them from all the places to which they were scattered on a day of cloud and gloom.
content_old: 12 As a shepherd seeks out his flock when some in his flock have gotten separated, so I will seek out My flock, I will rescue them from all the places to which they were scattered on a day of cloud and gloom.

content: 13 I will take them out from the peoples and gather them from the countries, and I will bring them to their own land, and will pasture them on the mountains of Israel, by the watercourses and in all the settled portions of the land.
content_old: 13 I will take them out from the peoples and gather them from the countries, and I will bring them to their own land, and will pasture them on the mountains of Israel, by the watercourses and in all the settled portions of the land.

content: 14 I will feed them in good grazing land, and the lofty hills of Israel shall be their pasture. There, in the hills of Israel, they shall lie down in a good pasture and shall feed on rich grazing land.
content_old: 14 I will feed them in good grazing land, and the lofty hills of Israel shall be their pasture. There, in the hills of Israel, they shall lie down in a good pasture and shall feed on rich grazing land.

content: 15 I Myself will graze My flock, and I Myself will let them lie down—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 15 I Myself will graze My flock, and I Myself will let them lie down—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 16 I will look for the lost, and I will bring back the strayed; I will bandage the injured, and I will sustain the weak; and the fat and healthy ones I will destroy. I will tend them rightly.
content_old: 16 I will look for the lost, and I will bring back the strayed; I will bandage the injured, and I will sustain the weak; and the fat and healthy ones I will destroy. I will tend them rightly.

content: 17 And as for you, My flock, thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to judge between one animal and another. To the rams and the bucks:
content_old: 17 And as for you, My flock, thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to judge between one animal and another. To the rams and the bucks:

content: 18 Is it not enough for you to graze on choice grazing ground, but you must also trample with your feet what is left from your grazing? And is it not enough for you to drink clear water, but you must also muddy with your feet what is left?
content_old: 18 Is it not enough for you to graze on choice grazing ground, but you must also trample with your feet what is left from your grazing? And is it not enough for you to drink clear water, but you must also muddy with your feet what is left?

content: 19 And must My flock graze on what your feet have trampled and drink what your feet have muddied?
content_old: 19 And must My flock graze on what your feet have trampled and drink what your feet have muddied?

content: 20 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD to them: Here am I, I am going to decide between the stout animals and the lean.
content_old: 20 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD to them: Here am I, I am going to decide between the stout animals and the lean.

content: 21 Because you pushed with flank and shoulder against the feeble ones and butted them with your horns until you scattered them abroad,
content_old: 21 Because you pushed with flank and shoulder against the feeble ones and butted them with your horns until you scattered them abroad,

content: 22 I will rescue My flock and they shall no longer be a spoil. I will decide between one animal and another.
content_old: 22 I will rescue My flock and they shall no longer be a spoil. I will decide between one animal and another.

content: 23 Then I will appoint a single shepherd over them to tend them—My servant David. He shall tend them, he shall be a shepherd to them.
content_old: 23 Then I will appoint a single shepherd over them to tend them—My servant David. He shall tend them, he shall be a shepherd to them.

content: 24 I the LORD will be their God, and My servant David shall be a ruler among them—I the LORD have spoken.
content_old: 24 I the LORD will be their God, and My servant David shall be a ruler among them—I the LORD have spoken.

content: 25 And I will grant them a covenant of friendship. I will banish vicious beasts from their land, and they shall live secure in the wasteland, they shall even sleep in the woodland.
content_old: 25 And I will grant them a covenant of friendship. I will banish vicious beasts from their land, and they shall live secure in the wasteland, they shall even sleep in the woodland.

content: 26 I will make these and the environs of My hill a blessing: I will send down the rain in its season, rains that bring blessing.
content_old: 26 I will make these and the environs of My hill a blessing: I will send down the rain in its season, rains that bring blessing.

content: 27 The trees of the field shall yield their fruit and the land shall yield its produce. shall continue secure on its own soil. They shall know that I am the LORD when I break the bars of their yoke and rescue them from those who enslave them.
content_old: 27 The trees of the field shall yield their fruit and the land shall yield its produce. shall continue secure on its own soil. They shall know that I am the LORD when I break the bars of their yoke and rescue them from those who enslave them.

content: 28 They shall no longer be a spoil for the nations, and the beasts of the earth shall not devour them; they shall dwell secure and untroubled.
content_old: 28 They shall no longer be a spoil for the nations, and the beasts of the earth shall not devour them; they shall dwell secure and untroubled.

content: 29 I shall establish for them a planting of renown; they shall no more be carried off by famine, and they shall not have to bear again the taunts of the nations.
content_old: 29 I shall establish for them a planting of renown; they shall no more be carried off by famine, and they shall not have to bear again the taunts of the nations.

content: 30 They shall know that I the LORD their God am with them and they, the House of Israel, are My people—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 30 They shall know that I the LORD their God am with them and they, the House of Israel, are My people—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 O mortal, set your face against Mount Seir and prophesy against it.
content_old: 2 O mortal, set your face against Mount Seir and prophesy against it.

content: 3 Say to it: Thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to deal with you, Mount Seir: I will stretch out My hand against you and make you an utter waste.
content_old: 3 Say to it: Thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to deal with you, Mount Seir: I will stretch out My hand against you and make you an utter waste.

content: 4 I will turn your towns into ruins, and you shall be a desolation; then you shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 4 I will turn your towns into ruins, and you shall be a desolation; then you shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 5 Because you harbored an ancient hatred and handed the people of Israel over to the sword in their time of calamity, the time set for their punishment—
content_old: 5 Because you harbored an ancient hatred and handed the people of Israel over to the sword in their time of calamity, the time set for their punishment—

content: 6 assuredly, as I live, declares the Lord GOD, I will doom you with blood; blood shall pursue you; I swear that, for your bloodthirsty hatred, blood shall pursue you.
content_old: 6 assuredly, as I live, declares the Lord GOD, I will doom you with blood; blood shall pursue you; I swear that, for your bloodthirsty hatred, blood shall pursue you.

content: 7 I will make Mount Seir an utter waste, and I will keep all passersby away from it.
content_old: 7 I will make Mount Seir an utter waste, and I will keep all passersby away from it.

content: 8 I will cover its mountains with the slain; men slain by the sword shall lie on your hills, in your valleys, and in all your watercourses.
content_old: 8 I will cover its mountains with the slain; men slain by the sword shall lie on your hills, in your valleys, and in all your watercourses.

content: 9 I will make you a desolation for all time; your towns shall never be inhabited. And you shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 9 I will make you a desolation for all time; your towns shall never be inhabited. And you shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 10 Because you thought “The two nations and the two lands shall be mine and we shall possess them”—although the LORD was there—
content_old: 10 Because you thought “The two nations and the two lands shall be mine and we shall possess them”—although the LORD was there—

content: 11 assuredly, as I live, declares the Lord GOD, I will act with the same anger and passion that you acted with in your hatred of them. And I will make Myself known through them when I judge you.
content_old: 11 assuredly, as I live, declares the Lord GOD, I will act with the same anger and passion that you acted with in your hatred of them. And I will make Myself known through them when I judge you.

content: 12 You shall know that I the LORD have heard all the taunts you uttered against the hills of Israel: “They have been laid waste; they have been given to us as prey.”
content_old: 12 You shall know that I the LORD have heard all the taunts you uttered against the hills of Israel: “They have been laid waste; they have been given to us as prey.”

content: 13 And you spoke arrogantly against Me and multiplied your words against Me: I have heard it.
content_old: 13 And you spoke arrogantly against Me and multiplied your words against Me: I have heard it.

content: 14 Thus said the LORD God: When the whole earth rejoices, I will make you a desolation.
content_old: 14 Thus said the LORD God: When the whole earth rejoices, I will make you a desolation.

content: 1 And you, O mortal, prophesy to the mountains of Israel and say: O mountains of Israel, hear the word of the LORD:
content_old: 1 And you, O mortal, prophesy to the mountains of Israel and say: O mountains of Israel, hear the word of the LORD:

content: 2 Thus said the Lord GOD: Because the enemy gloated over you, “Aha! Those ancient heights have become our possession!”
content_old: 2 Thus said the Lord GOD: Because the enemy gloated over you, “Aha! Those ancient heights have become our possession!”

content: 3 therefore prophesy, and say: Thus said the Lord GOD: Just because they eagerly lusted to see you become a possession of the other nations round about, so that you have become the butt of gossip in every language and of the jibes from every people—
content_old: 3 therefore prophesy, and say: Thus said the Lord GOD: Just because they eagerly lusted to see you become a possession of the other nations round about, so that you have become the butt of gossip in every language and of the jibes from every people—

content: 4 truly, you mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord GOD: Thus said the Lord GOD to the mountains and the hills, to the watercourses and the valleys, and to the desolate wastes and deserted cities which have become a prey and a laughingstock to the other nations round about:
content_old: 4 truly, you mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord GOD: Thus said the Lord GOD to the mountains and the hills, to the watercourses and the valleys, and to the desolate wastes and deserted cities which have become a prey and a laughingstock to the other nations round about:

content: 5 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: I have indeed spoken in My blazing wrath against the other nations and against all of Edom which, with wholehearted glee and with contempt, have made My land a possession for themselves for pasture and for prey.
content_old: 5 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: I have indeed spoken in My blazing wrath against the other nations and against all of Edom which, with wholehearted glee and with contempt, have made My land a possession for themselves for pasture and for prey.

content: 6 Yes, prophesy about the land of Israel, and say to the mountains and the hills, to the watercourses and to the valleys, Thus said the Lord GOD: Behold, I declare in My blazing wrath: Because you have suffered the taunting of the nations,
content_old: 6 Yes, prophesy about the land of Israel, and say to the mountains and the hills, to the watercourses and to the valleys, Thus said the Lord GOD: Behold, I declare in My blazing wrath: Because you have suffered the taunting of the nations,

content: 7 thus said the Lord GOD: I hereby swear that the nations which surround you shall, in their turn, suffer disgrace.
content_old: 7 thus said the Lord GOD: I hereby swear that the nations which surround you shall, in their turn, suffer disgrace.

content: 8 But you, O mountains of Israel, shall yield your produce and bear your fruit for My people Israel, for their return is near.
content_old: 8 But you, O mountains of Israel, shall yield your produce and bear your fruit for My people Israel, for their return is near.

content: 9 For I will care for you: I will turn to you, and you shall be tilled and sown.
content_old: 9 For I will care for you: I will turn to you, and you shall be tilled and sown.

content: 10 I will settle a large population on you, the whole House of Israel; the towns shall be resettled, and the ruined sites rebuilt.
content_old: 10 I will settle a large population on you, the whole House of Israel; the towns shall be resettled, and the ruined sites rebuilt.

content: 11 I will multiply men and beasts upon you, and they shall increase and be fertile, and I will resettle you as you were formerly, and will make you more prosperous than you were at first. And you shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 11 I will multiply men and beasts upon you, and they shall increase and be fertile, and I will resettle you as you were formerly, and will make you more prosperous than you were at first. And you shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 12 I will lead men—My people Israel—to you, and they shall possess you. You shall be their heritage, and you shall not again cause them to be bereaved.
content_old: 12 I will lead men—My people Israel—to you, and they shall possess you. You shall be their heritage, and you shall not again cause them to be bereaved.

content: 13 Thus said the Lord GOD: Because they say to you, “You are that devours men, you have been a bereaver of your nations,”
content_old: 13 Thus said the Lord GOD: Because they say to you, “You are that devours men, you have been a bereaver of your nations,”

content: 14 assuredly, you shall devour men no more, you shall never again bereave your nations—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 14 assuredly, you shall devour men no more, you shall never again bereave your nations—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 15 No more will I allow the jibes of the nations to be heard against you, no longer shall you suffer the taunting of the peoples; and never again shall you cause your nations to stumble—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 15 No more will I allow the jibes of the nations to be heard against you, no longer shall you suffer the taunting of the peoples; and never again shall you cause your nations to stumble—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 16 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 16 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 17 O mortal, when the House of Israel dwelt on their own soil, they defiled it with their ways and their deeds; their ways were in My sight like the uncleanness of a menstruous woman.
content_old: 17 O mortal, when the House of Israel dwelt on their own soil, they defiled it with their ways and their deeds; their ways were in My sight like the uncleanness of a menstruous woman.

content: 18 So I poured out My wrath on them for the blood which they shed upon their land, and for the fetishes with which they defiled it.
content_old: 18 So I poured out My wrath on them for the blood which they shed upon their land, and for the fetishes with which they defiled it.

content: 19 I scattered them among the nations, and they were dispersed through the countries: I punished them in accordance with their ways and their deeds.
content_old: 19 I scattered them among the nations, and they were dispersed through the countries: I punished them in accordance with their ways and their deeds.

content: 20 But when they came to those nations, they caused My holy name to be profaned, in that it was said of them, “These are the people of the LORD, yet they had to leave His land.”
content_old: 20 But when they came to those nations, they caused My holy name to be profaned, in that it was said of them, “These are the people of the LORD, yet they had to leave His land.”

content: 21 Therefore I am concerned for My holy name, which the House of Israel have caused to be profaned among the nations to which they have come.
content_old: 21 Therefore I am concerned for My holy name, which the House of Israel have caused to be profaned among the nations to which they have come.

content: 22 Say to the House of Israel: Thus said the Lord GOD: Not for your sake will I act, O House of Israel, but for My holy name, which you have caused to be profaned among the nations to which you have come.
content_old: 22 Say to the House of Israel: Thus said the Lord GOD: Not for your sake will I act, O House of Israel, but for My holy name, which you have caused to be profaned among the nations to which you have come.

content: 23 I will sanctify My great name which has been profaned among the nations—among whom you have caused it to be profaned. And the nations shall know that I am the LORD—declares the Lord GOD—when I manifest My holiness before their eyes through you.
content_old: 23 I will sanctify My great name which has been profaned among the nations—among whom you have caused it to be profaned. And the nations shall know that I am the LORD—declares the Lord GOD—when I manifest My holiness before their eyes through you.

content: 24 I will take you from among the nations and gather you from all the countries, and I will bring you back to your own land.
content_old: 24 I will take you from among the nations and gather you from all the countries, and I will bring you back to your own land.

content: 25 I will sprinkle clean water upon you, and you shall be clean: I will cleanse you from all your uncleanness and from all your fetishes.
content_old: 25 I will sprinkle clean water upon you, and you shall be clean: I will cleanse you from all your uncleanness and from all your fetishes.

content: 26 And I will give you a new heart and put a new spirit into you: I will remove the heart of stone from your body and give you a heart of flesh;
content_old: 26 And I will give you a new heart and put a new spirit into you: I will remove the heart of stone from your body and give you a heart of flesh;

content: 27 and I will put My spirit into you. Thus I will cause you to follow My laws and faithfully to observe My rules.
content_old: 27 and I will put My spirit into you. Thus I will cause you to follow My laws and faithfully to observe My rules.

content: 28 Then you shall dwell in the land which I gave to your fathers, and you shall be My people and I will be your God.
content_old: 28 Then you shall dwell in the land which I gave to your fathers, and you shall be My people and I will be your God.

content: 29 And when I have delivered you from all your uncleanness, I will summon the grain and make it abundant, and I will not bring famine upon you.
content_old: 29 And when I have delivered you from all your uncleanness, I will summon the grain and make it abundant, and I will not bring famine upon you.

content: 30 I will make the fruit of your trees and the crops of your fields abundant, so that you shall never again be humiliated before the nations because of famine.
content_old: 30 I will make the fruit of your trees and the crops of your fields abundant, so that you shall never again be humiliated before the nations because of famine.

content: 31 Then you shall recall your evil ways and your base conduct, and you shall loathe yourselves for your iniquities and your abhorrent practices.
content_old: 31 Then you shall recall your evil ways and your base conduct, and you shall loathe yourselves for your iniquities and your abhorrent practices.

content: 32 Not for your sake will I act—declares the Lord GOD—take good note! Be ashamed and humiliated because of your ways, O House of Israel!
content_old: 32 Not for your sake will I act—declares the Lord GOD—take good note! Be ashamed and humiliated because of your ways, O House of Israel!

content: 33 Thus said the Lord GOD: When I have cleansed you of all your iniquities, I will people your settlements, and the ruined places shall be rebuilt;
content_old: 33 Thus said the Lord GOD: When I have cleansed you of all your iniquities, I will people your settlements, and the ruined places shall be rebuilt;

content: 34 and the desolate land, after lying waste in the sight of every passerby, shall again be tilled.
content_old: 34 and the desolate land, after lying waste in the sight of every passerby, shall again be tilled.

content: 35 And men shall say, “That land, once desolate, has become like the garden of Eden; and the cities, once ruined, desolate, and ravaged, are now populated and fortified.”
content_old: 35 And men shall say, “That land, once desolate, has become like the garden of Eden; and the cities, once ruined, desolate, and ravaged, are now populated and fortified.”

content: 36 And the nations that are left around you shall know that I the LORD have rebuilt the ravaged places and replanted the desolate land. I the LORD have spoken and will act.
content_old: 36 And the nations that are left around you shall know that I the LORD have rebuilt the ravaged places and replanted the desolate land. I the LORD have spoken and will act.

content: 37 Thus said the Lord GOD: Moreover, in this I will respond to the House of Israel and act for their sake: I will multiply their people like sheep.
content_old: 37 Thus said the Lord GOD: Moreover, in this I will respond to the House of Israel and act for their sake: I will multiply their people like sheep.

content: 1 The hand of the LORD came upon me. He took me out by the spirit of the LORD and set me down in the valley. It was full of bones.
content_old: 1 The hand of the LORD came upon me. He took me out by the spirit of the LORD and set me down in the valley. It was full of bones.

content: 2 He led me all around them; there were very many of them spread over the valley, and they were very dry.
content_old: 2 He led me all around them; there were very many of them spread over the valley, and they were very dry.

content: 3 He said to me, “O mortal, can these bones live again?” I replied, “O Lord GOD, only You know.”
content_old: 3 He said to me, “O mortal, can these bones live again?” I replied, “O Lord GOD, only You know.”

content: 4 And He said to me, “Prophesy over these bones and say to them: O dry bones, hear the word of the LORD!
content_old: 4 And He said to me, “Prophesy over these bones and say to them: O dry bones, hear the word of the LORD!

content: 5 Thus said the Lord GOD to these bones: I will cause breath to enter you and you shall live again.
content_old: 5 Thus said the Lord GOD to these bones: I will cause breath to enter you and you shall live again.

content: 6 I will lay sinews upon you, and cover you with flesh, and form skin over you. And I will put breath into you, and you shall live again. And you shall know that I am the LORD!”
content_old: 6 I will lay sinews upon you, and cover you with flesh, and form skin over you. And I will put breath into you, and you shall live again. And you shall know that I am the LORD!”

content: 7 I prophesied as I had been commanded. And while I was prophesying, suddenly there was a sound of rattling, and the bones came together, bone to matching bone.
content_old: 7 I prophesied as I had been commanded. And while I was prophesying, suddenly there was a sound of rattling, and the bones came together, bone to matching bone.

content: 8 I looked, and there were sinews on them, and flesh had grown, and skin had formed over them; but there was no breath in them.
content_old: 8 I looked, and there were sinews on them, and flesh had grown, and skin had formed over them; but there was no breath in them.

content: 9 Then He said to me, “Prophesy to the breath, prophesy, O mortal! Say to the breath: Thus said the Lord GOD: Come, O breath, from the four winds, and breathe into these slain, that they may live again.”
content_old: 9 Then He said to me, “Prophesy to the breath, prophesy, O mortal! Say to the breath: Thus said the Lord GOD: Come, O breath, from the four winds, and breathe into these slain, that they may live again.”

content: 10 I prophesied as He commanded me. The breath entered them, and they came to life and stood up on their feet, a vast multitude.
content_old: 10 I prophesied as He commanded me. The breath entered them, and they came to life and stood up on their feet, a vast multitude.

content: 11 And He said to me, “O mortal, these bones are the whole House of Israel. They say, ‘Our bones are dried up, our hope is gone; we are doomed.’
content_old: 11 And He said to me, “O mortal, these bones are the whole House of Israel. They say, ‘Our bones are dried up, our hope is gone; we are doomed.’

content: 12 Prophesy, therefore, and say to them: Thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to open your graves and lift you out of the graves, O My people, and bring you to the land of Israel.
content_old: 12 Prophesy, therefore, and say to them: Thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to open your graves and lift you out of the graves, O My people, and bring you to the land of Israel.

content: 13 You shall know, O My people, that I am the LORD, when I have opened your graves and lifted you out of your graves.
content_old: 13 You shall know, O My people, that I am the LORD, when I have opened your graves and lifted you out of your graves.

content: 14 I will put My breath into you and you shall live again, and I will set you upon your own soil. Then you shall know that I the LORD have spoken and have acted”—declares the LORD.
content_old: 14 I will put My breath into you and you shall live again, and I will set you upon your own soil. Then you shall know that I the LORD have spoken and have acted”—declares the LORD.

content: 15 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 15 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 16 And you, O mortal, take a stick and write on it, “Of Judah and the Israelites associated with him”; and take another stick and write on it, “Of Joseph—the stick of Ephraim—and all the House of Israel associated with him.”
content_old: 16 And you, O mortal, take a stick and write on it, “Of Judah and the Israelites associated with him”; and take another stick and write on it, “Of Joseph—the stick of Ephraim—and all the House of Israel associated with him.”

content: 17 Bring them close to each other, so that they become one stick, joined together in your hand.
content_old: 17 Bring them close to each other, so that they become one stick, joined together in your hand.

content: 18 And when any of your people ask you, “Won’t you tell us what these actions of yours mean?”
content_old: 18 And when any of your people ask you, “Won’t you tell us what these actions of yours mean?”

content: 19 answer them, “Thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to take the stick of Joseph—which is in the hand of Ephraim—and of the tribes of Israel associated with him, and I will place the stick of Judah upon it and make them into one stick; they shall be joined in My hand.”
content_old: 19 answer them, “Thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to take the stick of Joseph—which is in the hand of Ephraim—and of the tribes of Israel associated with him, and I will place the stick of Judah upon it and make them into one stick; they shall be joined in My hand.”

content: 20 You shall hold up before their eyes the sticks which you have inscribed,
content_old: 20 You shall hold up before their eyes the sticks which you have inscribed,

content: 21 and you shall declare to them: Thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to take the Israelite people from among the nations they have gone to, and gather them from every quarter, and bring them to their own land.
content_old: 21 and you shall declare to them: Thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to take the Israelite people from among the nations they have gone to, and gather them from every quarter, and bring them to their own land.

content: 22 I will make them a single nation in the land, on the hills of Israel, and one king shall be king of them all. Never again shall they be two nations, and never again shall they be divided into two kingdoms.
content_old: 22 I will make them a single nation in the land, on the hills of Israel, and one king shall be king of them all. Never again shall they be two nations, and never again shall they be divided into two kingdoms.

content: 23 Nor shall they ever again defile themselves by their fetishes and their abhorrent things, and by their other transgressions. I will save them in all their settlements where they sinned, and I will cleanse them. Then they shall be My people, and I will be their God.
content_old: 23 Nor shall they ever again defile themselves by their fetishes and their abhorrent things, and by their other transgressions. I will save them in all their settlements where they sinned, and I will cleanse them. Then they shall be My people, and I will be their God.

content: 24 My servant David shall be king over them; there shall be one shepherd for all of them. They shall follow My rules and faithfully obey My laws.
content_old: 24 My servant David shall be king over them; there shall be one shepherd for all of them. They shall follow My rules and faithfully obey My laws.

content: 25 Thus they shall remain in the land which I gave to My servant Jacob and in which your fathers dwelt; they and their children and their children’s children shall dwell there forever, with My servant David as their prince for all time.
content_old: 25 Thus they shall remain in the land which I gave to My servant Jacob and in which your fathers dwelt; they and their children and their children’s children shall dwell there forever, with My servant David as their prince for all time.

content: 26 I will make a covenant of friendship with them—it shall be an everlasting covenant with them—I will establish them and multiply them, and I will place My Sanctuary among them forever.
content_old: 26 I will make a covenant of friendship with them—it shall be an everlasting covenant with them—I will establish them and multiply them, and I will place My Sanctuary among them forever.

content: 27 My Presence shall rest over them; I will be their God and they shall be My people.
content_old: 27 My Presence shall rest over them; I will be their God and they shall be My people.

content: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD came to me:

content: 2 O mortal, turn your face toward Gog of the land of Magog, the chief prince of Meshech and Tubal. Prophesy against him
content_old: 2 O mortal, turn your face toward Gog of the land of Magog, the chief prince of Meshech and Tubal. Prophesy against him

content: 3 and say: Thus said the Lord GOD: Lo, I am coming to deal with you, O Gog, chief prince of Meshech and Tubal!
content_old: 3 and say: Thus said the Lord GOD: Lo, I am coming to deal with you, O Gog, chief prince of Meshech and Tubal!

content: 4 I will turn you around and put hooks in your jaws, and lead you out with all your army, horses, and horsemen, all of them clothed in splendor, a vast assembly, all of them with bucklers and shields, wielding swords.
content_old: 4 I will turn you around and put hooks in your jaws, and lead you out with all your army, horses, and horsemen, all of them clothed in splendor, a vast assembly, all of them with bucklers and shields, wielding swords.

content: 5 Among them shall be Persia, Cush, and Put, everyone with shield and helmet;
content_old: 5 Among them shall be Persia, Cush, and Put, everyone with shield and helmet;

content: 6 Gomer and all its cohorts, Beth-togarmah the remotest parts of the north and all its cohorts—the many peoples with you.
content_old: 6 Gomer and all its cohorts, Beth-togarmah the remotest parts of the north and all its cohorts—the many peoples with you.

content: 7 Be ready, prepare yourselves, you and all the battalions mustered about you, and hold yourself in reserve for them.
content_old: 7 Be ready, prepare yourselves, you and all the battalions mustered about you, and hold yourself in reserve for them.

content: 8 After a long time you shall be summoned; in the distant future you shall march against the land restored from the sword, gathered from the midst of many peoples—against the mountains of Israel, which have long lain desolate—liberated from the nations, and now all dwelling secure.
content_old: 8 After a long time you shall be summoned; in the distant future you shall march against the land restored from the sword, gathered from the midst of many peoples—against the mountains of Israel, which have long lain desolate—liberated from the nations, and now all dwelling secure.

content: 9 You shall advance, coming like a storm; you shall be like a cloud covering the earth, you and all your cohorts, and the many peoples with you.
content_old: 9 You shall advance, coming like a storm; you shall be like a cloud covering the earth, you and all your cohorts, and the many peoples with you.

content: 10 Thus said the Lord GOD: On that day, a thought will occur to you, and you will conceive a wicked design.
content_old: 10 Thus said the Lord GOD: On that day, a thought will occur to you, and you will conceive a wicked design.

content: 11 You will say, “I will invade a land of open towns, I will fall upon a tranquil people living secure, all of them living in unwalled towns and lacking bars and gates,
content_old: 11 You will say, “I will invade a land of open towns, I will fall upon a tranquil people living secure, all of them living in unwalled towns and lacking bars and gates,

content: 12 in order to take spoil and seize plunder”—to turn your hand against repopulated wastes, and against a people gathered from among nations, acquiring livestock and possessions, living at the center of the earth.
content_old: 12 in order to take spoil and seize plunder”—to turn your hand against repopulated wastes, and against a people gathered from among nations, acquiring livestock and possessions, living at the center of the earth.

content: 13 Sheba and Dedan, and the merchants and all the magnates of Tarshish will say to you, “Have you come to take spoil? Is it to seize plunder that you assembled your hordes—to carry off silver and gold, to make off with livestock and goods, to gather an immense booty?”
content_old: 13 Sheba and Dedan, and the merchants and all the magnates of Tarshish will say to you, “Have you come to take spoil? Is it to seize plunder that you assembled your hordes—to carry off silver and gold, to make off with livestock and goods, to gather an immense booty?”

content: 14 Therefore prophesy, O mortal, and say to Gog: Thus said the Lord GOD: Surely, on that day, when My people Israel are living secure, you will take note,
content_old: 14 Therefore prophesy, O mortal, and say to Gog: Thus said the Lord GOD: Surely, on that day, when My people Israel are living secure, you will take note,

content: 15 and you will come from your home in the farthest north, you and many peoples with you—all of them mounted on horses, a vast horde, a mighty army—
content_old: 15 and you will come from your home in the farthest north, you and many peoples with you—all of them mounted on horses, a vast horde, a mighty army—

content: 16 and you will advance upon My people Israel, like a cloud covering the earth. This shall happen on that distant day: I will bring you to My land, that the nations may know Me when, before their eyes, I manifest My holiness through you, O Gog!
content_old: 16 and you will advance upon My people Israel, like a cloud covering the earth. This shall happen on that distant day: I will bring you to My land, that the nations may know Me when, before their eyes, I manifest My holiness through you, O Gog!

content: 17 Thus said the Lord GOD: Why, you are the one I spoke of in ancient days through My servants, the prophets of Israel, who prophesied for years in those days that I would bring you against them!
content_old: 17 Thus said the Lord GOD: Why, you are the one I spoke of in ancient days through My servants, the prophets of Israel, who prophesied for years in those days that I would bring you against them!

content: 18 On that day, when Gog sets foot on the soil of Israel—declares the Lord GOD—My raging anger shall flare up.
content_old: 18 On that day, when Gog sets foot on the soil of Israel—declares the Lord GOD—My raging anger shall flare up.

content: 19 For I have decreed in My indignation and in My blazing wrath: On that day, a terrible earthquake shall befall the land of Israel.
content_old: 19 For I have decreed in My indignation and in My blazing wrath: On that day, a terrible earthquake shall befall the land of Israel.

content: 20 The fish of the sea, the birds of the sky, the beasts of the field, all creeping things that move on the ground, and every human being on earth shall quake before Me. Mountains shall be overthrown, cliffs shall topple, and every wall shall crumble to the ground.
content_old: 20 The fish of the sea, the birds of the sky, the beasts of the field, all creeping things that move on the ground, and every human being on earth shall quake before Me. Mountains shall be overthrown, cliffs shall topple, and every wall shall crumble to the ground.

content: 21 I will then summon the sword against him throughout My mountains—declares the Lord GOD—and every man’s sword shall be turned against his brother.
content_old: 21 I will then summon the sword against him throughout My mountains—declares the Lord GOD—and every man’s sword shall be turned against his brother.

content: 22 I will punish him with pestilence and with bloodshed; and I will pour torrential rain, hailstones, and sulfurous fire upon him and his hordes and the many peoples with him.
content_old: 22 I will punish him with pestilence and with bloodshed; and I will pour torrential rain, hailstones, and sulfurous fire upon him and his hordes and the many peoples with him.

content: 1 And you, O mortal, prophesy against Gog and say: Thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to deal with you, O Gog, chief prince of Meshech and Tubal!
content_old: 1 And you, O mortal, prophesy against Gog and say: Thus said the Lord GOD: I am going to deal with you, O Gog, chief prince of Meshech and Tubal!

content: 2 I will turn you around and drive you on, and I will take you from the far north and lead you toward the mountains of Israel.
content_old: 2 I will turn you around and drive you on, and I will take you from the far north and lead you toward the mountains of Israel.

content: 3 I will strike your bow from your left hand and I will loosen the arrows from your right hand.
content_old: 3 I will strike your bow from your left hand and I will loosen the arrows from your right hand.

content: 4 You shall fall on the mountains of Israel, you and all your battalions and the peoples who are with you; and I will give you as food to carrion birds of every sort and to the beasts of the field,
content_old: 4 You shall fall on the mountains of Israel, you and all your battalions and the peoples who are with you; and I will give you as food to carrion birds of every sort and to the beasts of the field,

content: 5 as you lie in the open field. For I have spoken—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 5 as you lie in the open field. For I have spoken—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 6 And I will send a fire against Magog and against those who dwell secure in the coastlands. And they shall know that I am the LORD.
content_old: 6 And I will send a fire against Magog and against those who dwell secure in the coastlands. And they shall know that I am the LORD.

content: 7 I will make My holy name known among My people Israel, and never again will I let My holy name be profaned. And the nations shall know that I the LORD am holy in Israel.
content_old: 7 I will make My holy name known among My people Israel, and never again will I let My holy name be profaned. And the nations shall know that I the LORD am holy in Israel.

content: 8 Ah! it has come, it has happened—declares the Lord GOD: this is that day that I decreed.
content_old: 8 Ah! it has come, it has happened—declares the Lord GOD: this is that day that I decreed.

content: 9 Then the inhabitants of the cities of Israel will go out and make fires and feed them with the weapons—shields and bucklers, bows and arrows, clubs and spears; they shall use them as fuel for seven years.
content_old: 9 Then the inhabitants of the cities of Israel will go out and make fires and feed them with the weapons—shields and bucklers, bows and arrows, clubs and spears; they shall use them as fuel for seven years.

content: 10 They will not gather firewood in the fields or cut any in the forests, but will use the weapons as fuel for their fires. They will despoil those who despoiled them and plunder those who plundered them—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 10 They will not gather firewood in the fields or cut any in the forests, but will use the weapons as fuel for their fires. They will despoil those who despoiled them and plunder those who plundered them—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 11 On that day I will assign to Gog a burial site there in Israel—the Valley of the Travelers, east of the Sea. It shall block the path of travelers, for there Gog and all his multitude will be buried. It shall be called the Valley of Gog’s Multitude.
content_old: 11 On that day I will assign to Gog a burial site there in Israel—the Valley of the Travelers, east of the Sea. It shall block the path of travelers, for there Gog and all his multitude will be buried. It shall be called the Valley of Gog’s Multitude.

content: 12 The House of Israel shall spend seven months burying them, in order to cleanse the land;
content_old: 12 The House of Israel shall spend seven months burying them, in order to cleanse the land;

content: 13 all the people of the land shall bury them. The day I manifest My glory shall bring renown to them—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 13 all the people of the land shall bury them. The day I manifest My glory shall bring renown to them—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 14 And they shall appoint men to serve permanently, to traverse the land and bury any invaders who remain above ground, in order to cleanse it. The search shall go on for a period of seven months.
content_old: 14 And they shall appoint men to serve permanently, to traverse the land and bury any invaders who remain above ground, in order to cleanse it. The search shall go on for a period of seven months.

content: 15 As those who traverse the country make their rounds, any one of them who sees a human bone shall erect a marker beside it, until the buriers have interred them in the Valley of Gog’s Multitude.
content_old: 15 As those who traverse the country make their rounds, any one of them who sees a human bone shall erect a marker beside it, until the buriers have interred them in the Valley of Gog’s Multitude.

content: 16 There shall also be a city named Multitude. And thus the land shall be cleansed.
content_old: 16 There shall also be a city named Multitude. And thus the land shall be cleansed.

content: 17 And you, O mortal, say to every winged bird and to all the wild beasts: Thus said the Lord GOD: Assemble, come and gather from all around for the sacrificial feast that I am preparing for you—a great sacrificial feast—upon the mountains of Israel, and eat flesh and drink blood.
content_old: 17 And you, O mortal, say to every winged bird and to all the wild beasts: Thus said the Lord GOD: Assemble, come and gather from all around for the sacrificial feast that I am preparing for you—a great sacrificial feast—upon the mountains of Israel, and eat flesh and drink blood.

content: 18 You shall eat the flesh of warriors and drink the blood of the princes of the earth: rams, lambs, he-goats, and bulls—fatlings of Bashan all of them.
content_old: 18 You shall eat the flesh of warriors and drink the blood of the princes of the earth: rams, lambs, he-goats, and bulls—fatlings of Bashan all of them.

content: 19 You shall eat fat to satiety and drink your fill of blood from the sacrificial feast that I have prepared for you.
content_old: 19 You shall eat fat to satiety and drink your fill of blood from the sacrificial feast that I have prepared for you.

content: 20 And you shall sate yourselves at My table with horses, charioteers, warriors, and all fighting men—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 20 And you shall sate yourselves at My table with horses, charioteers, warriors, and all fighting men—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 21 Thus will I manifest My glory among the nations, and all the nations shall see the judgment that I executed and the power that I wielded against them.
content_old: 21 Thus will I manifest My glory among the nations, and all the nations shall see the judgment that I executed and the power that I wielded against them.

content: 22 From that time on, the House of Israel shall know that I the LORD am their God.
content_old: 22 From that time on, the House of Israel shall know that I the LORD am their God.

content: 23 And the nations shall know that the House of Israel were exiled only for their iniquity, because they trespassed against Me, so that I hid My face from them and delivered them into the hands of their adversaries, and they all fell by the sword.
content_old: 23 And the nations shall know that the House of Israel were exiled only for their iniquity, because they trespassed against Me, so that I hid My face from them and delivered them into the hands of their adversaries, and they all fell by the sword.

content: 24 When I hid My face from them, I dealt with them according to their uncleanness and their transgressions.
content_old: 24 When I hid My face from them, I dealt with them according to their uncleanness and their transgressions.

content: 25 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: I will now restore the fortunes of Jacob and take the whole House of Israel back in love; and I will be zealous for My holy name.
content_old: 25 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: I will now restore the fortunes of Jacob and take the whole House of Israel back in love; and I will be zealous for My holy name.

content: 26 They will bear their shame and all their trespasses that they committed against Me, when they dwell in their land secure and untroubled,
content_old: 26 They will bear their shame and all their trespasses that they committed against Me, when they dwell in their land secure and untroubled,

content: 27 when I have brought them back from among the peoples and gathered them out of the lands of their enemies and have manifested My holiness through them in the sight of many nations.
content_old: 27 when I have brought them back from among the peoples and gathered them out of the lands of their enemies and have manifested My holiness through them in the sight of many nations.

content: 28 They shall know that I the Lord am their GOD when, having exiled them among the nations, I gather them back into their land and leave none of them behind.
content_old: 28 They shall know that I the Lord am their GOD when, having exiled them among the nations, I gather them back into their land and leave none of them behind.

content: 1 In the twenty-fifth year of our exile, the fourteenth year after the city had fallen, at the beginning of the year, the tenth day of the month—on that very day—the hand of the LORD came upon me, and He brought me there.
content_old: 1 In the twenty-fifth year of our exile, the fourteenth year after the city had fallen, at the beginning of the year, the tenth day of the month—on that very day—the hand of the LORD came upon me, and He brought me there.

content: 2 He brought me, in visions of God, to the Land of Israel, and He set me down on a very high mountain on which there seemed to be the outline of a city on the south.
content_old: 2 He brought me, in visions of God, to the Land of Israel, and He set me down on a very high mountain on which there seemed to be the outline of a city on the south.

content: 3 He brought me over to it, and there, standing at the gate, was a man who shone like copper. In his hand were a cord of linen and a measuring rod.
content_old: 3 He brought me over to it, and there, standing at the gate, was a man who shone like copper. In his hand were a cord of linen and a measuring rod.

content: 4 The man spoke to me: “Mortal, look closely and listen attentively and note well everything I am going to show you—for you have been brought here in order to be shown—and report everything you see to the House of Israel.”
content_old: 4 The man spoke to me: “Mortal, look closely and listen attentively and note well everything I am going to show you—for you have been brought here in order to be shown—and report everything you see to the House of Israel.”

content: 5 Along the outside of the Temple area ran a wall on every side. The rod that the man held was six cubits long, plus one handbreadth for each cubit; and when he applied it to that structure, it measured one rod deep and one rod high.
content_old: 5 Along the outside of the Temple area ran a wall on every side. The rod that the man held was six cubits long, plus one handbreadth for each cubit; and when he applied it to that structure, it measured one rod deep and one rod high.

content: 6 He went up to the gate that faced eastward and mounted its steps. He measured the threshold of the gate; it was one rod deep—the one threshold was one rod deep.
content_old: 6 He went up to the gate that faced eastward and mounted its steps. He measured the threshold of the gate; it was one rod deep—the one threshold was one rod deep.

content: 7 Each recess was one rod wide and one rod deep, with 5 cubits between recesses; and the threshold of the gate, at the inner vestibule of the gate, was one rod deep.
content_old: 7 Each recess was one rod wide and one rod deep, with 5 cubits between recesses; and the threshold of the gate, at the inner vestibule of the gate, was one rod deep.

content: 8 For when he measured it at the inner vestibule of the gate, it was one rod.
content_old: 8 For when he measured it at the inner vestibule of the gate, it was one rod.

content: 9 Next he measured the vestibule of the gate, and it measured 8 cubits and its supports 2 cubits; the vestibule of the gate was at its inner end.
content_old: 9 Next he measured the vestibule of the gate, and it measured 8 cubits and its supports 2 cubits; the vestibule of the gate was at its inner end.

content: 10 On either side of this eastern gate there were three recesses, all three of the same size; of identical sizes were also the supports on either side.
content_old: 10 On either side of this eastern gate there were three recesses, all three of the same size; of identical sizes were also the supports on either side.

content: 11 He measured the opening of the gate and found it 10 cubits wide, while the gate itself measured 13 cubits across.
content_old: 11 He measured the opening of the gate and found it 10 cubits wide, while the gate itself measured 13 cubits across.

content: 12 At the fronts of the recesses on either side were barriers of one cubit; the recesses on either side were 6 cubits.
content_old: 12 At the fronts of the recesses on either side were barriers of one cubit; the recesses on either side were 6 cubits.

content: 13 Their openings faced each other directly across the gate passage, so that when he measured from rear of recess to rear of recess he obtained a width of 25 cubits.
content_old: 13 Their openings faced each other directly across the gate passage, so that when he measured from rear of recess to rear of recess he obtained a width of 25 cubits.

content: 14 He made the vestibule—60 cubits—and the gate next to the support on every side of the court.
content_old: 14 He made the vestibule—60 cubits—and the gate next to the support on every side of the court.

content: 15 And from the front of the outer gate to the front of the inner vestibule of the gate was 50 cubits.
content_old: 15 And from the front of the outer gate to the front of the inner vestibule of the gate was 50 cubits.

content: 16 The recesses—and their supports—had windows with frames on the interior of the gate complex on both sides, and the interiors of the vestibules also had windows on both sides; and the supports were adorned with palms.
content_old: 16 The recesses—and their supports—had windows with frames on the interior of the gate complex on both sides, and the interiors of the vestibules also had windows on both sides; and the supports were adorned with palms.

content: 17 He took me into the outer court. There were chambers there, and there was a pavement laid out all around the court. There were 30 chambers on the pavement.
content_old: 17 He took me into the outer court. There were chambers there, and there was a pavement laid out all around the court. There were 30 chambers on the pavement.

content: 18 The pavements flanked the gates; the depth of the lower pavements paralleled that of the gates.
content_old: 18 The pavements flanked the gates; the depth of the lower pavements paralleled that of the gates.

content: 19 Then he measured the width of the lower court, from in front of the inner gate to in front of the outer gate—100 cubits. After the east, the north.
content_old: 19 Then he measured the width of the lower court, from in front of the inner gate to in front of the outer gate—100 cubits. After the east, the north.

content: 20 Next he measured the gate of the outer court that faced north: its length and its width,
content_old: 20 Next he measured the gate of the outer court that faced north: its length and its width,

content: 21 its three recesses on either side and its supports, as also its vestibule. It measured, like the first gate, 50 cubits in length and 25 cubits in width.
content_old: 21 its three recesses on either side and its supports, as also its vestibule. It measured, like the first gate, 50 cubits in length and 25 cubits in width.

content: 22 Its windows and those of its vestibule, as also its palm trees, corresponded to those of the gate that faced east. one had to climb 7 steps to reach it, and its vestibule was ahead of them.
content_old: 22 Its windows and those of its vestibule, as also its palm trees, corresponded to those of the gate that faced east. one had to climb 7 steps to reach it, and its vestibule was ahead of them.

content: 23 Like the east gate, the north gate faced a gate leading into the inner forecourt; and when he measured the distance from gate to gate, it was 100 cubits.
content_old: 23 Like the east gate, the north gate faced a gate leading into the inner forecourt; and when he measured the distance from gate to gate, it was 100 cubits.

content: 24 Then he took me to the south side. There was also a gate on the south side, and he got the same measurements as before for its supports and its vestibule.
content_old: 24 Then he took me to the south side. There was also a gate on the south side, and he got the same measurements as before for its supports and its vestibule.

content: 25 Both it and its vestibule had windows like the aforementioned ones. It was 50 cubits long and 25 cubits wide.
content_old: 25 Both it and its vestibule had windows like the aforementioned ones. It was 50 cubits long and 25 cubits wide.

content: 26 Its staircase consisted of 7 steps; its vestibule was ahead of them, and its supports were decorated on both sides with palm trees.
content_old: 26 Its staircase consisted of 7 steps; its vestibule was ahead of them, and its supports were decorated on both sides with palm trees.

content: 27 The inner court likewise had a gate facing south; and on the south side, too, he measured a distance of 100 cubits from the gate to the inner gate.
