content_old: 27 The inner court likewise had a gate facing south; and on the south side, too, he measured a distance of 100 cubits from the gate to the inner gate.

content: 28 He now took me into the inner forecourt through its south gate. When he measured this south gate, it had the same measurements as the foregoing.
content_old: 28 He now took me into the inner forecourt through its south gate. When he measured this south gate, it had the same measurements as the foregoing.

content: 29 Its recesses, its supports, and its vestibule had the same measurements. Both it and its vestibule had windows on both sides; it was 50 cubits long and 25 cubits wide—
content_old: 29 Its recesses, its supports, and its vestibule had the same measurements. Both it and its vestibule had windows on both sides; it was 50 cubits long and 25 cubits wide—

content: 30 vestibules on both sides, 25 cubits long, 5 cubits wide.
content_old: 30 vestibules on both sides, 25 cubits long, 5 cubits wide.

content: 31 Its vestibule, however, gave on the outer court. Its supports were adorned on either side with palms, and its staircase consisted of 8 steps.
content_old: 31 Its vestibule, however, gave on the outer court. Its supports were adorned on either side with palms, and its staircase consisted of 8 steps.

content: 32 Then he took me to the eastern side of the inner forecourt; and when he measured the gate there, he got the same measurements:
content_old: 32 Then he took me to the eastern side of the inner forecourt; and when he measured the gate there, he got the same measurements:

content: 33 its recesses, supports, and vestibule had the above measurements. Both it and its vestibule had windows on both sides; it was 50 cubits long and 25 cubits wide,
content_old: 33 its recesses, supports, and vestibule had the above measurements. Both it and its vestibule had windows on both sides; it was 50 cubits long and 25 cubits wide,

content: 34 and its vestibule gave on the outer court. Its supports were decorated on both sides with palm trees, and its staircase consisted of 8 steps.
content_old: 34 and its vestibule gave on the outer court. Its supports were decorated on both sides with palm trees, and its staircase consisted of 8 steps.

content: 35 Then he took me to the north gate, and found its measurements to be identical,
content_old: 35 Then he took me to the north gate, and found its measurements to be identical,

content: 36 with the same recesses, supports, vestibule, windows on both sides, and a length of 50 cubits and a width of 25 cubits.
content_old: 36 with the same recesses, supports, vestibule, windows on both sides, and a length of 50 cubits and a width of 25 cubits.

content: 37 Its supports gave on the outer court; its supports were decorated on both sides with palm trees; and its staircase consisted of eight steps.
content_old: 37 Its supports gave on the outer court; its supports were decorated on both sides with palm trees; and its staircase consisted of eight steps.

content: 38 A chamber opened into the gate; there the burnt offering would be washed.
content_old: 38 A chamber opened into the gate; there the burnt offering would be washed.

content: 39 And inside the vestibule of the gate, there were two tables on each side, at which the burnt offering, the sin offering, and the guilt offering were to be slaughtered;
content_old: 39 And inside the vestibule of the gate, there were two tables on each side, at which the burnt offering, the sin offering, and the guilt offering were to be slaughtered;

content: 40 while outside—as one goes up toward the opening of the north gate—there were two tables on one side, and there were two tables on the other side of the gate’s vestibule.
content_old: 40 while outside—as one goes up toward the opening of the north gate—there were two tables on one side, and there were two tables on the other side of the gate’s vestibule.

content: 41 Thus there were four tables on either flank of the gate—eight tables in all—at which were to be slaughtered.
content_old: 41 Thus there were four tables on either flank of the gate—eight tables in all—at which were to be slaughtered.

content: 42 As for the four tables for the burnt offering—they were of hewn stone, one and a half cubits long, one and a half cubits wide, and one cubit high—on them were laid out the instruments with which burnt offerings and sacrifices were slaughtered.
content_old: 42 As for the four tables for the burnt offering—they were of hewn stone, one and a half cubits long, one and a half cubits wide, and one cubit high—on them were laid out the instruments with which burnt offerings and sacrifices were slaughtered.

content: 43 Shelves, one handbreadth wide, were attached all around the inside; and the sacrificial flesh was laid on the tables.
content_old: 43 Shelves, one handbreadth wide, were attached all around the inside; and the sacrificial flesh was laid on the tables.

content: 44 There were chambers for singers in the inner forecourt: beside the north gate facing south, and one beside the east gate facing north.
content_old: 44 There were chambers for singers in the inner forecourt: beside the north gate facing south, and one beside the east gate facing north.

content: 45 explained to me: “The chamber that faces south is for the priests who perform the duties of the Temple;
content_old: 45 explained to me: “The chamber that faces south is for the priests who perform the duties of the Temple;

content: 46 and the chamber that faces north is for the priests who perform the duties of the altar—they are the descendants of Zadok, who alone of the descendants of Levi may approach the LORD to minister to Him.”
content_old: 46 and the chamber that faces north is for the priests who perform the duties of the altar—they are the descendants of Zadok, who alone of the descendants of Levi may approach the LORD to minister to Him.”

content: 47 He then measured the forecourt: 100 cubits long and 100 cubits broad—foursquare. In front of the Temple stood the altar.
content_old: 47 He then measured the forecourt: 100 cubits long and 100 cubits broad—foursquare. In front of the Temple stood the altar.

content: 48 He took me into the portico of the Temple and measured it. The jambs of the portico were 5 cubits deep on either side. The width of the gate-opening was 14 cubits, and the flanking wall of the gate was 3 cubits on either side.
content_old: 48 He took me into the portico of the Temple and measured it. The jambs of the portico were 5 cubits deep on either side. The width of the gate-opening was 14 cubits, and the flanking wall of the gate was 3 cubits on either side.

content: 1 He then led me into the great hall. He measured the jambs, 6 cubits on either side; such was the depth of each jamb.
content_old: 1 He then led me into the great hall. He measured the jambs, 6 cubits on either side; such was the depth of each jamb.

content: 2 The entrance was 10 cubits wide, and the flanking walls of the entrance were each 5 cubits wide. Next he measured the depth, 40 cubits, and the width, 20 cubits.
content_old: 2 The entrance was 10 cubits wide, and the flanking walls of the entrance were each 5 cubits wide. Next he measured the depth, 40 cubits, and the width, 20 cubits.

content: 3 And then he entered the inner room. He measured each jamb of the entrance, 2 cubits; the entrance itself, 6 cubits across; and the width of the flanking wall on either side of the entrance, 7 cubits.
content_old: 3 And then he entered the inner room. He measured each jamb of the entrance, 2 cubits; the entrance itself, 6 cubits across; and the width of the flanking wall on either side of the entrance, 7 cubits.

content: 4 Then he measured the depth, 20 cubits; and the width at the inner end of the great hall was also 20 cubits. And he said to me, “This is the Holy of Holies.”
content_old: 4 Then he measured the depth, 20 cubits; and the width at the inner end of the great hall was also 20 cubits. And he said to me, “This is the Holy of Holies.”

content: 5 Then he measured the wall of the Temple. 6 cubits thick on every side of the Temple, and the side-chamber measured 4 cubits.
content_old: 5 Then he measured the wall of the Temple. 6 cubits thick on every side of the Temple, and the side-chamber measured 4 cubits.

content: 6 The side chambers were arranged one above the other, in 33 sections. All around, there were projections in the Temple wall to serve the side chambers as supports, so that supports should not be the Temple wall itself.
content_old: 6 The side chambers were arranged one above the other, in 33 sections. All around, there were projections in the Temple wall to serve the side chambers as supports, so that supports should not be the Temple wall itself.

content: 7 The winding passage of the side chambers widened from story to story; and since the structure was furnished all over with winding passages from story to story, the structure itself became wider from story to story. It was by this means that one ascended from the bottom story to the top one by way of the middle one.
content_old: 7 The winding passage of the side chambers widened from story to story; and since the structure was furnished all over with winding passages from story to story, the structure itself became wider from story to story. It was by this means that one ascended from the bottom story to the top one by way of the middle one.

content: 8 I observed that the Temple was surrounded by a raised pavement—the foundations of the side chambers; its elevation was a rod’s length, or 6 cubits.
content_old: 8 I observed that the Temple was surrounded by a raised pavement—the foundations of the side chambers; its elevation was a rod’s length, or 6 cubits.

content: 9 The outer wall of the side chamber was 5 cubits thick, and that which served as a walk between the Temple’s side chambers
content_old: 9 The outer wall of the side chamber was 5 cubits thick, and that which served as a walk between the Temple’s side chambers

content: 10 and the chamber complexes was 20 cubits wide all around the Temple.
content_old: 10 and the chamber complexes was 20 cubits wide all around the Temple.

content: 11 Of entrances to the side chambers giving on the walk, there was one entrance on the north side and one entrance on the south side; and the space of the walk was 5 cubits thick all around.
content_old: 11 Of entrances to the side chambers giving on the walk, there was one entrance on the north side and one entrance on the south side; and the space of the walk was 5 cubits thick all around.

content: 12 And the structure that fronted on the vacant space at the western end was 70 cubits deep; the walls of the structure were 5 cubits thick on every side; and it was 90 cubits wide.
content_old: 12 And the structure that fronted on the vacant space at the western end was 70 cubits deep; the walls of the structure were 5 cubits thick on every side; and it was 90 cubits wide.

content: 13 He measured the depth of the Temple, 100 cubits; and the depth of the vacant space and of the structure, with its walls, also came to 100 cubits.
content_old: 13 He measured the depth of the Temple, 100 cubits; and the depth of the vacant space and of the structure, with its walls, also came to 100 cubits.

content: 14 The front side of the Temple, like the vacant space on the east, was 100 cubits wide.
content_old: 14 The front side of the Temple, like the vacant space on the east, was 100 cubits wide.

content: 15 He also measured the width of the structure facing the vacant space in the rear, inclusive of its ledges, 100 cubits. Both the great hall inside and the portico next to the court
content_old: 15 He also measured the width of the structure facing the vacant space in the rear, inclusive of its ledges, 100 cubits. Both the great hall inside and the portico next to the court

content: 16 —the thresholds—and the windows with frames and the ledges at the threshold, all over the three parts of each, were completely overlaid with wood. There was wainscoting from the floor to the windows, including the windows
content_old: 16 —the thresholds—and the windows with frames and the ledges at the threshold, all over the three parts of each, were completely overlaid with wood. There was wainscoting from the floor to the windows, including the windows

content: 17 and extending above the openings, both in the inner Temple and outside. And all over the wall, both in the inner one and in the outer, ran a pattern.
content_old: 17 and extending above the openings, both in the inner Temple and outside. And all over the wall, both in the inner one and in the outer, ran a pattern.

content: 18 It consisted of cherubs and palm trees, with a palm tree between every two cherubs. Each cherub had two faces:
content_old: 18 It consisted of cherubs and palm trees, with a palm tree between every two cherubs. Each cherub had two faces:

content: 19 a human face turned toward the palm tree on one side and a lion’s face turned toward the palm tree on the other side. This was repeated all over the Temple;
content_old: 19 a human face turned toward the palm tree on one side and a lion’s face turned toward the palm tree on the other side. This was repeated all over the Temple;

content: 20 the cherubs and the palm trees were carved on the wall from the floor to above the openings. As regards the great hall,
content_old: 20 the cherubs and the palm trees were carved on the wall from the floor to above the openings. As regards the great hall,

content: 21 the great hall had four doorposts; and before the Shrine was something resembling
content_old: 21 the great hall had four doorposts; and before the Shrine was something resembling

content: 22 a wooden altar 3 cubits high and 2 cubits long and having inner corners; and its length and its walls were of wood. And he said to me, “This is the table that stands before the LORD.”
content_old: 22 a wooden altar 3 cubits high and 2 cubits long and having inner corners; and its length and its walls were of wood. And he said to me, “This is the table that stands before the LORD.”

content: 23 The great hall had a double door, and the Shrine likewise had
content_old: 23 The great hall had a double door, and the Shrine likewise had

content: 24 a double door, and each door had two swinging leaves: two for the one door and two such leaves for the other.
content_old: 24 a double door, and each door had two swinging leaves: two for the one door and two such leaves for the other.

content: 25 Cherubs and palm trees were carved on these—on the doors of the hall—just as they were carved on the walls; and there was a lattice of wood outside in front of the portico.
content_old: 25 Cherubs and palm trees were carved on these—on the doors of the hall—just as they were carved on the walls; and there was a lattice of wood outside in front of the portico.

content: 1 He took me out, by way of the northern gate, into the outer court, and he led me up to a complex of chambers that ran parallel to the northern ends of the vacant space and the structure.
content_old: 1 He took me out, by way of the northern gate, into the outer court, and he led me up to a complex of chambers that ran parallel to the northern ends of the vacant space and the structure.

content: 2 The width of its façade—its north side, the one from which it was entered—was 100 cubits, and its depth was 50 cubits.
content_old: 2 The width of its façade—its north side, the one from which it was entered—was 100 cubits, and its depth was 50 cubits.

content: 3 At right angles to the 20 cubits of the inner court and to the pavement of the outer court, the complex rose ledge by ledge in three tiers.
content_old: 3 At right angles to the 20 cubits of the inner court and to the pavement of the outer court, the complex rose ledge by ledge in three tiers.

content: 4 There was an areaway, 10 cubits wide and a road of one cubit, running along the inner-court side of the chamber complex, but its entrances were on its north side.
content_old: 4 There was an areaway, 10 cubits wide and a road of one cubit, running along the inner-court side of the chamber complex, but its entrances were on its north side.

content: 5 Here its upper chambers were cut back, because ledges took away from them as construction proceeded backward from the bottom ones and then from the middle ones.
content_old: 5 Here its upper chambers were cut back, because ledges took away from them as construction proceeded backward from the bottom ones and then from the middle ones.

content: 6 For they were arranged in three tiers, and they had no columns like those of the chambers in the courts. That is why the rise proceeded by stages: from the ground, from the bottom ones, and from the middle ones.
content_old: 6 For they were arranged in three tiers, and they had no columns like those of the chambers in the courts. That is why the rise proceeded by stages: from the ground, from the bottom ones, and from the middle ones.

content: 7 In the outer court, a wall 50 cubits long ran parallel to the chamber complex up to the chambers in the outer court;
content_old: 7 In the outer court, a wall 50 cubits long ran parallel to the chamber complex up to the chambers in the outer court;

content: 8 for the chambers in the outer court were themselves 50 cubits deep, thus completing 100 cubits alongside the edifice.
content_old: 8 for the chambers in the outer court were themselves 50 cubits deep, thus completing 100 cubits alongside the edifice.

content: 9 Thus, at the foot of that complex of chambers ran a passage—of a width set by the wall in the outer court—which one entered from the east in order to gain access to them from the outer court.
content_old: 9 Thus, at the foot of that complex of chambers ran a passage—of a width set by the wall in the outer court—which one entered from the east in order to gain access to them from the outer court.

content: 10 There was another chamber complex to the east of the vacant space and the structure,
content_old: 10 There was another chamber complex to the east of the vacant space and the structure,

content: 11 likewise with a passage in front—just like the complex on the north side, with which this one agreed in width and depth and in the exact layout of its exits and entrances.
content_old: 11 likewise with a passage in front—just like the complex on the north side, with which this one agreed in width and depth and in the exact layout of its exits and entrances.

content: 12 Accordingly, the entrances to the chamber complex on the south side were approached from the east by the entrance at the head of the corresponding passage along the matching wall.
content_old: 12 Accordingly, the entrances to the chamber complex on the south side were approached from the east by the entrance at the head of the corresponding passage along the matching wall.

content: 13 And he said to me, “The northern chambers and the southern chambers by the vacant space are the consecrated chambers in which the priests who have access to the LORD shall eat the most holy offerings. There they shall deposit the most holy offerings—the meal offerings, the sin offerings, and the guilt offerings, for the place is consecrated.
content_old: 13 And he said to me, “The northern chambers and the southern chambers by the vacant space are the consecrated chambers in which the priests who have access to the LORD shall eat the most holy offerings. There they shall deposit the most holy offerings—the meal offerings, the sin offerings, and the guilt offerings, for the place is consecrated.

content: 14 When the priests enter, they shall not proceed from the consecrated place to the outer court without first leaving here the vestments in which they minister; for the are consecrated. Before proceeding to the area open to the people, they shall put on other garments.”
content_old: 14 When the priests enter, they shall not proceed from the consecrated place to the outer court without first leaving here the vestments in which they minister; for the are consecrated. Before proceeding to the area open to the people, they shall put on other garments.”

content: 15 When he had finished the measurements of the inner Temple area, he led me out by way of the gate which faces east, and he measured off the entire area.
content_old: 15 When he had finished the measurements of the inner Temple area, he led me out by way of the gate which faces east, and he measured off the entire area.

content: 16 He measured the east side with the measuring rod, 500 cubits—in rods, by the measuring rod. He turned
content_old: 16 He measured the east side with the measuring rod, 500 cubits—in rods, by the measuring rod. He turned

content: 17 and measured the north side: 500 cubits—in rods, by the measuring rod. He turned
content_old: 17 and measured the north side: 500 cubits—in rods, by the measuring rod. He turned

content: 18 and measured the south side: 500 cubits—in rods, by the measuring rod.
content_old: 18 and measured the south side: 500 cubits—in rods, by the measuring rod.

content: 19 Then he turned to the west side and measured it: 500 cubits—in rods, by the measuring rod.
content_old: 19 Then he turned to the west side and measured it: 500 cubits—in rods, by the measuring rod.

content: 1 Then he led me to a gate, the gate that faced east.
content_old: 1 Then he led me to a gate, the gate that faced east.

content: 2 And there, coming from the east with a roar like the roar of mighty waters, was the Presence of the God of Israel, and the earth was lit up by His Presence.
content_old: 2 And there, coming from the east with a roar like the roar of mighty waters, was the Presence of the God of Israel, and the earth was lit up by His Presence.

content: 3 The vision was like the vision I had seen when I came to destroy the city, the very same vision that I had seen by the Chebar Canal. Forthwith, I fell on my face.
content_old: 3 The vision was like the vision I had seen when I came to destroy the city, the very same vision that I had seen by the Chebar Canal. Forthwith, I fell on my face.

content: 4 The Presence of the LORD entered the Temple by the gate that faced eastward.
content_old: 4 The Presence of the LORD entered the Temple by the gate that faced eastward.

content: 5 A spirit carried me into the inner court, and lo, the Presence of the LORD filled the Temple;
content_old: 5 A spirit carried me into the inner court, and lo, the Presence of the LORD filled the Temple;

content: 6 and I heard speech addressed to me from the Temple, though the man was standing beside me.
content_old: 6 and I heard speech addressed to me from the Temple, though the man was standing beside me.

content: 7 It said to me: O mortal, this is the place of My throne and the place for the soles of My feet, where I will dwell in the midst of the people Israel forever. The House of Israel and their kings must not again defile My holy name by their apostasy and by the corpses of their kings at their death.
content_old: 7 It said to me: O mortal, this is the place of My throne and the place for the soles of My feet, where I will dwell in the midst of the people Israel forever. The House of Israel and their kings must not again defile My holy name by their apostasy and by the corpses of their kings at their death.

content: 8 When they placed their threshold next to My threshold and their doorposts next to My doorposts with only a wall between Me and them, they would defile My holy name by the abominations that they committed, and I consumed them in My anger.
content_old: 8 When they placed their threshold next to My threshold and their doorposts next to My doorposts with only a wall between Me and them, they would defile My holy name by the abominations that they committed, and I consumed them in My anger.

content: 9 Therefore, let them put their apostasy and the corpses of their kings far from Me, and I will dwell among them forever.
content_old: 9 Therefore, let them put their apostasy and the corpses of their kings far from Me, and I will dwell among them forever.

content: 10 you, O mortal, describe the Temple to the House of Israel, and let them measure its design. But let them be ashamed of their iniquities:
content_old: 10 you, O mortal, describe the Temple to the House of Israel, and let them measure its design. But let them be ashamed of their iniquities:

content: 11 When they are ashamed of all they have done, make known to them the plan of the Temple and its layout, its exits and entrances—its entire plan, and all the laws and instructions pertaining to its entire plan. Write it down before their eyes, that they may faithfully follow its entire plan and all its laws.
content_old: 11 When they are ashamed of all they have done, make known to them the plan of the Temple and its layout, its exits and entrances—its entire plan, and all the laws and instructions pertaining to its entire plan. Write it down before their eyes, that they may faithfully follow its entire plan and all its laws.

content: 12 Such are the instructions for the Temple on top of the mountain: the entire area of its enclosure shall be most holy. Thus far the instructions for the Temple.
content_old: 12 Such are the instructions for the Temple on top of the mountain: the entire area of its enclosure shall be most holy. Thus far the instructions for the Temple.

content: 13 And these are the dimensions of the altar, in cubits where each is a cubit and a handbreadth. The trench shall be a cubit deep and a cubit wide, with a rim one span high around its edge. And the height shall be as follows:
content_old: 13 And these are the dimensions of the altar, in cubits where each is a cubit and a handbreadth. The trench shall be a cubit deep and a cubit wide, with a rim one span high around its edge. And the height shall be as follows:

content: 14 From the trench in the ground to the lower ledge, which shall be a cubit wide: 2 cubits; from the lower ledge to the upper ledge, which shall likewise be a cubit wide: 4 cubits;
content_old: 14 From the trench in the ground to the lower ledge, which shall be a cubit wide: 2 cubits; from the lower ledge to the upper ledge, which shall likewise be a cubit wide: 4 cubits;

content: 15 and the height of the altar hearth shall be 4 cubits, with 4 horns projecting upward from the hearth: 4 cubits.
content_old: 15 and the height of the altar hearth shall be 4 cubits, with 4 horns projecting upward from the hearth: 4 cubits.

content: 16 Now the hearth shall be 12 cubits long and 12 broad, square, with 4 equal sides.
content_old: 16 Now the hearth shall be 12 cubits long and 12 broad, square, with 4 equal sides.

content: 17 Hence, the base shall be 14 cubits broad, with 4 equal sides. The surrounding rim shall be half a cubit, and the surrounding trench shall measure one cubit. And the ramp shall face east.
content_old: 17 Hence, the base shall be 14 cubits broad, with 4 equal sides. The surrounding rim shall be half a cubit, and the surrounding trench shall measure one cubit. And the ramp shall face east.

content: 18 Then he said to me: O mortal, thus said the Lord GOD: These are the directions for the altar on the day it is erected, so that burnt offerings may be offered up on it and blood dashed against it.
content_old: 18 Then he said to me: O mortal, thus said the Lord GOD: These are the directions for the altar on the day it is erected, so that burnt offerings may be offered up on it and blood dashed against it.

content: 19 You shall give to the levitical priests who are of the stock of Zadok, and so eligible to minister to Me—declares the Lord GOD—a young bull of the herd for a sin offering.
content_old: 19 You shall give to the levitical priests who are of the stock of Zadok, and so eligible to minister to Me—declares the Lord GOD—a young bull of the herd for a sin offering.

content: 20 You shall take some of its blood and apply it to the four horns of the altar, to the four corners of the base, and to the surrounding rim; thus you shall purge it and perform purification upon it.
content_old: 20 You shall take some of its blood and apply it to the four horns of the altar, to the four corners of the base, and to the surrounding rim; thus you shall purge it and perform purification upon it.

content: 21 Then you shall take the bull of sin offering and burn it in the designated area of the Temple, outside the Sanctuary.
content_old: 21 Then you shall take the bull of sin offering and burn it in the designated area of the Temple, outside the Sanctuary.

content: 22 On the following day, you shall offer a goat without blemish as a sin offering; and the altar shall be purged just as it was purged with the bull.
content_old: 22 On the following day, you shall offer a goat without blemish as a sin offering; and the altar shall be purged just as it was purged with the bull.

content: 23 When you have completed the ritual of purging, you shall offer a bull of the herd without blemish and a ram of the flock without blemish.
content_old: 23 When you have completed the ritual of purging, you shall offer a bull of the herd without blemish and a ram of the flock without blemish.

content: 24 Offer them to the LORD; let the priests throw salt on them and offer them up as a burnt offering to the LORD.
content_old: 24 Offer them to the LORD; let the priests throw salt on them and offer them up as a burnt offering to the LORD.

content: 25 Every day, for seven days, you shall present a goat of sin offering, as well as a bull of the herd and a ram of the flock; you shall present unblemished ones.
content_old: 25 Every day, for seven days, you shall present a goat of sin offering, as well as a bull of the herd and a ram of the flock; you shall present unblemished ones.

content: 26 Seven days they shall purge the altar and cleanse it; thus shall it be consecrated.
content_old: 26 Seven days they shall purge the altar and cleanse it; thus shall it be consecrated.

content: 1 Then he led me back to the outer gate of the Sanctuary that faced eastward; it was shut.
content_old: 1 Then he led me back to the outer gate of the Sanctuary that faced eastward; it was shut.

content: 2 And the LORD said to me: This gate is to be kept shut and is not to be opened! No one shall enter by it because the LORD, the God of Israel, has entered by it; therefore it shall remain shut.
content_old: 2 And the LORD said to me: This gate is to be kept shut and is not to be opened! No one shall enter by it because the LORD, the God of Israel, has entered by it; therefore it shall remain shut.

content: 3 Only the prince may sit in it and eat bread before the LORD, since he is a prince; he shall enter by way of the vestibule of the gate, and shall depart by the same way.
content_old: 3 Only the prince may sit in it and eat bread before the LORD, since he is a prince; he shall enter by way of the vestibule of the gate, and shall depart by the same way.

content: 4 Then he led me, by way of the north gate, to the front of the Temple. I looked, and lo! the Presence of the LORD filled the Temple of the LORD; and I fell upon my face.
content_old: 4 Then he led me, by way of the north gate, to the front of the Temple. I looked, and lo! the Presence of the LORD filled the Temple of the LORD; and I fell upon my face.

content: 5 Then the LORD said to me: O mortal, mark well, look closely and listen carefully to everything that I tell you regarding all the laws of the Temple of the LORD and all the instructions regarding it. Note well who may enter the Temple and all who must be excluded from the Sanctuary.
content_old: 5 Then the LORD said to me: O mortal, mark well, look closely and listen carefully to everything that I tell you regarding all the laws of the Temple of the LORD and all the instructions regarding it. Note well who may enter the Temple and all who must be excluded from the Sanctuary.

content: 6 And say to the rebellious House of Israel: Thus said the Lord GOD: Too long, O House of Israel, have you committed all your abominations,
content_old: 6 And say to the rebellious House of Israel: Thus said the Lord GOD: Too long, O House of Israel, have you committed all your abominations,

content: 7 admitting aliens, uncircumcised of spirit and uncircumcised of flesh, to be in My Sanctuary and profane My very Temple, when you offer up My food—the fat and the blood. You have broken My covenant with all your abominations.
content_old: 7 admitting aliens, uncircumcised of spirit and uncircumcised of flesh, to be in My Sanctuary and profane My very Temple, when you offer up My food—the fat and the blood. You have broken My covenant with all your abominations.

content: 8 You have not discharged the duties concerning My sacred offerings, but have appointed them to discharge the duties of My Sanctuary for you.
content_old: 8 You have not discharged the duties concerning My sacred offerings, but have appointed them to discharge the duties of My Sanctuary for you.

content: 9 Thus said the Lord GOD: Let no alien, uncircumcised in spirit and flesh, enter My Sanctuary—no alien whatsoever among the people of Israel.
content_old: 9 Thus said the Lord GOD: Let no alien, uncircumcised in spirit and flesh, enter My Sanctuary—no alien whatsoever among the people of Israel.

content: 10 But the Levites who forsook Me when Israel went astray—straying from Me to follow their fetishes—shall suffer their punishment:
content_old: 10 But the Levites who forsook Me when Israel went astray—straying from Me to follow their fetishes—shall suffer their punishment:

content: 11 They shall be servitors in My Sanctuary, appointed over the Temple gates, and performing the chores of My Temple; they shall slaughter the burnt offerings and the sacrifices for the people. They shall attend on them and serve them.
content_old: 11 They shall be servitors in My Sanctuary, appointed over the Temple gates, and performing the chores of My Temple; they shall slaughter the burnt offerings and the sacrifices for the people. They shall attend on them and serve them.

content: 12 Because they served the House of Israel in the presence of their fetishes and made them stumble into guilt, therefore—declares the Lord GOD—I have sworn concerning them that they shall suffer their punishment:
content_old: 12 Because they served the House of Israel in the presence of their fetishes and made them stumble into guilt, therefore—declares the Lord GOD—I have sworn concerning them that they shall suffer their punishment:

content: 13 They shall not approach Me to serve Me as priests, to come near any of My sacred offerings, the most holy things. They shall bear their shame for the abominations that they committed.
content_old: 13 They shall not approach Me to serve Me as priests, to come near any of My sacred offerings, the most holy things. They shall bear their shame for the abominations that they committed.

content: 14 I will make them watchmen of the Temple, to perform all its chores, everything that needs to be done in it.
content_old: 14 I will make them watchmen of the Temple, to perform all its chores, everything that needs to be done in it.

content: 15 But the levitical priests descended from Zadok, who maintained the service of My Sanctuary when the people of Israel went astray from Me—they shall approach Me to minister to Me; they shall stand before Me to offer Me fat and blood—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 15 But the levitical priests descended from Zadok, who maintained the service of My Sanctuary when the people of Israel went astray from Me—they shall approach Me to minister to Me; they shall stand before Me to offer Me fat and blood—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 16 They alone may enter My Sanctuary and they alone shall approach My table to minister to Me; and they shall keep My charge.
content_old: 16 They alone may enter My Sanctuary and they alone shall approach My table to minister to Me; and they shall keep My charge.

content: 17 And when they enter the gates of the inner court, they shall wear linen vestments: they shall have nothing woolen upon them when they minister inside the gates of the inner court.
content_old: 17 And when they enter the gates of the inner court, they shall wear linen vestments: they shall have nothing woolen upon them when they minister inside the gates of the inner court.

content: 18 They shall have linen turbans on their heads and linen breeches on their loins; they shall not gird themselves with anything that causes sweat.
content_old: 18 They shall have linen turbans on their heads and linen breeches on their loins; they shall not gird themselves with anything that causes sweat.

content: 19 When they go out to the outer court—the outer court where the people are—they shall remove the vestments in which they minister and shall deposit them in the sacred chambers; they shall put on other garments, lest they make the people consecrated by their vestments.
content_old: 19 When they go out to the outer court—the outer court where the people are—they shall remove the vestments in which they minister and shall deposit them in the sacred chambers; they shall put on other garments, lest they make the people consecrated by their vestments.

content: 20 They shall neither shave their heads nor let their hair go untrimmed; they shall keep their hair trimmed.
content_old: 20 They shall neither shave their heads nor let their hair go untrimmed; they shall keep their hair trimmed.

content: 21 No priest shall drink wine when he enters into the inner court.
content_old: 21 No priest shall drink wine when he enters into the inner court.

content: 22 They shall not marry widows or divorced women; they may marry only virgins of the stock of the House of Israel, or widows who are widows of priests.
content_old: 22 They shall not marry widows or divorced women; they may marry only virgins of the stock of the House of Israel, or widows who are widows of priests.

content: 23 They shall declare to My people what is sacred and what is profane, and inform them what is clean and what is unclean.
content_old: 23 They shall declare to My people what is sacred and what is profane, and inform them what is clean and what is unclean.

content: 24 In lawsuits, too, it is they who shall act as judges; they shall decide them in accordance with My rules. They shall preserve My teachings and My laws regarding all My fixed occasions; and they shall maintain the sanctity of My sabbaths.
content_old: 24 In lawsuits, too, it is they who shall act as judges; they shall decide them in accordance with My rules. They shall preserve My teachings and My laws regarding all My fixed occasions; and they shall maintain the sanctity of My sabbaths.

content: 25 shall not defile himself by entering where there is a dead person. He shall defile himself only for father or mother, son or daughter, brother or unmarried sister.
content_old: 25 shall not defile himself by entering where there is a dead person. He shall defile himself only for father or mother, son or daughter, brother or unmarried sister.

content: 26 After he has become clean, seven days shall be counted off for him;
content_old: 26 After he has become clean, seven days shall be counted off for him;

content: 27 and on the day that he reenters the inner court of the Sanctuary to minister in the Sanctuary, he shall present his sin offering—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 27 and on the day that he reenters the inner court of the Sanctuary to minister in the Sanctuary, he shall present his sin offering—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 28 This shall be their portion, for I am their portion; and no holding shall be given them in Israel, for I am their holding.
content_old: 28 This shall be their portion, for I am their portion; and no holding shall be given them in Israel, for I am their holding.

content: 29 The meal offerings, sin offerings, and guilt offerings shall be consumed by them. Everything proscribed in Israel shall be theirs.
content_old: 29 The meal offerings, sin offerings, and guilt offerings shall be consumed by them. Everything proscribed in Israel shall be theirs.

content: 30 All the choice first fruits of every kind, and all the gifts of every kind—of all your contributions—shall go to the priests. You shall further give the first of the yield of your baking to the priest, that a blessing may rest upon your home.
content_old: 30 All the choice first fruits of every kind, and all the gifts of every kind—of all your contributions—shall go to the priests. You shall further give the first of the yield of your baking to the priest, that a blessing may rest upon your home.

content: 1 When you allot the land as an inheritance, you shall set aside from the land, as a gift sacred to the LORD, an area 25,000 cubits long and 10,000 wide: this shall be holy through its entire extent.
content_old: 1 When you allot the land as an inheritance, you shall set aside from the land, as a gift sacred to the LORD, an area 25,000 cubits long and 10,000 wide: this shall be holy through its entire extent.

content: 2 Of this, a square measuring a full 500 by 500 shall be reserved for the Sanctuary, and 50 cubits for an open space all around it.
content_old: 2 Of this, a square measuring a full 500 by 500 shall be reserved for the Sanctuary, and 50 cubits for an open space all around it.

content: 3 Of the aforesaid area, you shall measure off, as most holy and destined to include the Sanctuary, a space 25,000 long by 10,000 wide;
content_old: 3 Of the aforesaid area, you shall measure off, as most holy and destined to include the Sanctuary, a space 25,000 long by 10,000 wide;

content: 4 it is a sacred portion of the land; it shall provide space for houses for the priests, the ministrants of the Sanctuary who are qualified to minister to the LORD, as well as holy ground for the Sanctuary.
content_old: 4 it is a sacred portion of the land; it shall provide space for houses for the priests, the ministrants of the Sanctuary who are qualified to minister to the LORD, as well as holy ground for the Sanctuary.

content: 5 Another space, 25,000 long by 10,000 wide, shall be the property of the Levites, the servants of the Temple—twenty chambers.
content_old: 5 Another space, 25,000 long by 10,000 wide, shall be the property of the Levites, the servants of the Temple—twenty chambers.

content: 6 Alongside the sacred reserve, you shall set aside 25,000 long by 5,000 wide, as the property of the city; it shall belong to the whole House of Israel.
content_old: 6 Alongside the sacred reserve, you shall set aside 25,000 long by 5,000 wide, as the property of the city; it shall belong to the whole House of Israel.

content: 7 And to the prince shall belong, on both sides of the sacred reserve and the property of the city and alongside the sacred reserve and the property of the city, on the west extending westward and on the east extending eastward, a portion corresponding to one of the portions that extend from the western border to the eastern border
content_old: 7 And to the prince shall belong, on both sides of the sacred reserve and the property of the city and alongside the sacred reserve and the property of the city, on the west extending westward and on the east extending eastward, a portion corresponding to one of the portions that extend from the western border to the eastern border

content: 8 of the land. That shall be his property in Israel; and My princes shall no more defraud My people, but shall leave the rest of the land to the several tribes of the House of Israel.
content_old: 8 of the land. That shall be his property in Israel; and My princes shall no more defraud My people, but shall leave the rest of the land to the several tribes of the House of Israel.

content: 9 Thus said the Lord GOD: Enough, princes of Israel! Make an end of lawlessness and rapine, and do what is right and just! Put a stop to your evictions of My people—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 9 Thus said the Lord GOD: Enough, princes of Israel! Make an end of lawlessness and rapine, and do what is right and just! Put a stop to your evictions of My people—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 10 Have honest balances, an honest ephah, and an honest bath.
content_old: 10 Have honest balances, an honest ephah, and an honest bath.

content: 11 The ephah and the bath shall comprise the same volume, the bath a tenth of a homer and the ephah a tenth of a homer; their capacity shall be gauged by the homer.
content_old: 11 The ephah and the bath shall comprise the same volume, the bath a tenth of a homer and the ephah a tenth of a homer; their capacity shall be gauged by the homer.

content: 12 And the shekel shall weigh 20 gerahs. 20 shekels, 25 shekels and 10 plus 5 shekels shall count with you as a mina.
content_old: 12 And the shekel shall weigh 20 gerahs. 20 shekels, 25 shekels and 10 plus 5 shekels shall count with you as a mina.

content: 13 This is the contribution you shall make: One-sixth of an ephah from every homer of wheat and one-sixth of an ephah from every homer of barley,
content_old: 13 This is the contribution you shall make: One-sixth of an ephah from every homer of wheat and one-sixth of an ephah from every homer of barley,

content: 14 while the due from the oil—the oil being measured by the bath—shall be one-tenth of a bath from every kor.—As 10 baths make a homer, so 10 baths make a homer.—
content_old: 14 while the due from the oil—the oil being measured by the bath—shall be one-tenth of a bath from every kor.—As 10 baths make a homer, so 10 baths make a homer.—

content: 15 And the due from the flock shall be one animal from every 200. from Israel’s products for meal offerings, burnt offerings, and offerings of well-being, to make expiation for them—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 15 And the due from the flock shall be one animal from every 200. from Israel’s products for meal offerings, burnt offerings, and offerings of well-being, to make expiation for them—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 16 In this contribution, the entire population must join with the prince in Israel.
content_old: 16 In this contribution, the entire population must join with the prince in Israel.

content: 17 But the burnt offerings, the meal offerings, and the libations on festivals, new moons, sabbaths—all fixed occasions—of the House of Israel shall be the obligation of the prince; he shall provide the sin offerings, the meal offerings, the burnt offerings, and the offerings of well-being, to make expiation for the House of Israel.
content_old: 17 But the burnt offerings, the meal offerings, and the libations on festivals, new moons, sabbaths—all fixed occasions—of the House of Israel shall be the obligation of the prince; he shall provide the sin offerings, the meal offerings, the burnt offerings, and the offerings of well-being, to make expiation for the House of Israel.

content: 18 Thus said the Lord GOD: On the first day of the first month, you shall take a bull of the herd without blemish, and you shall cleanse the Sanctuary.
content_old: 18 Thus said the Lord GOD: On the first day of the first month, you shall take a bull of the herd without blemish, and you shall cleanse the Sanctuary.

content: 19 The priest shall take some of the blood of the sin offering and apply it to the doorposts of the Temple, to the four corners of the ledge of the altar, and to the doorposts of the gate of the inner court.
content_old: 19 The priest shall take some of the blood of the sin offering and apply it to the doorposts of the Temple, to the four corners of the ledge of the altar, and to the doorposts of the gate of the inner court.

content: 20 You shall do the same on the seventh day of the month to purge the Temple from uncleanness caused by unwitting or ignorant persons.
content_old: 20 You shall do the same on the seventh day of the month to purge the Temple from uncleanness caused by unwitting or ignorant persons.

content: 21 On the fourteenth day of the first month you shall have the passover sacrifice; and during a festival of seven days unleavened bread shall be eaten.
content_old: 21 On the fourteenth day of the first month you shall have the passover sacrifice; and during a festival of seven days unleavened bread shall be eaten.

content: 22 On that day, the prince shall provide a bull of sin offering on behalf of himself and of the entire population;
content_old: 22 On that day, the prince shall provide a bull of sin offering on behalf of himself and of the entire population;

content: 23 and during the seven days of the festival, he shall provide daily—for seven days—seven bulls and seven rams, without blemish, for a burnt offering to the LORD, and one goat daily for a sin offering.
content_old: 23 and during the seven days of the festival, he shall provide daily—for seven days—seven bulls and seven rams, without blemish, for a burnt offering to the LORD, and one goat daily for a sin offering.

content: 24 He shall provide a meal offering of an ephah for each bull and an ephah for each ram, with a hin of oil to every ephah.
content_old: 24 He shall provide a meal offering of an ephah for each bull and an ephah for each ram, with a hin of oil to every ephah.

content: 1 Thus said the Lord GOD: The gate of the inner court which faces east shall be closed on the six working days; it shall be opened on the sabbath day and it shall be opened on the day of the new moon.
content_old: 1 Thus said the Lord GOD: The gate of the inner court which faces east shall be closed on the six working days; it shall be opened on the sabbath day and it shall be opened on the day of the new moon.

content: 2 The prince shall enter by way of the vestibule outside the gate, and shall attend at the gatepost while the priests sacrifice his burnt offering and his offering of well-being; he shall then bow low at the threshold of the gate and depart. The gate, however, shall not be closed until evening.
content_old: 2 The prince shall enter by way of the vestibule outside the gate, and shall attend at the gatepost while the priests sacrifice his burnt offering and his offering of well-being; he shall then bow low at the threshold of the gate and depart. The gate, however, shall not be closed until evening.

content: 3 The common people shall worship before the LORD on sabbaths and new moons at the entrance of the same gate.
content_old: 3 The common people shall worship before the LORD on sabbaths and new moons at the entrance of the same gate.

content: 4 The burnt offering which the prince presents to the LORD on the sabbath day shall consist of six lambs without blemish and one ram without blemish—
content_old: 4 The burnt offering which the prince presents to the LORD on the sabbath day shall consist of six lambs without blemish and one ram without blemish—

content: 5 with a meal offering of an ephah for the ram, a meal offering of as much as he wishes for the lambs, and a hin of oil with every ephah.
content_old: 5 with a meal offering of an ephah for the ram, a meal offering of as much as he wishes for the lambs, and a hin of oil with every ephah.

content: 6 And on the day of the new moon, it shall consist of a bull of the herd without blemish, and six lambs and a ram—they shall be without blemish.
content_old: 6 And on the day of the new moon, it shall consist of a bull of the herd without blemish, and six lambs and a ram—they shall be without blemish.

content: 7 And he shall provide a meal offering of an ephah for the bull, an ephah for the ram, and as much as he can afford for the lambs, with a hin of oil to every ephah.
content_old: 7 And he shall provide a meal offering of an ephah for the bull, an ephah for the ram, and as much as he can afford for the lambs, with a hin of oil to every ephah.

content: 8 When the prince enters, he shall come in by way of the vestibule of the gate, and he shall go out the same way.
content_old: 8 When the prince enters, he shall come in by way of the vestibule of the gate, and he shall go out the same way.

content: 9 But on the fixed occasions, when the common people come before the LORD, whoever enters by the north gate to bow low shall leave by the south gate; and whoever enters by the south gate shall leave by the north gate. They shall not go back through the gate by which they came in, but shall go out by the opposite one.
content_old: 9 But on the fixed occasions, when the common people come before the LORD, whoever enters by the north gate to bow low shall leave by the south gate; and whoever enters by the south gate shall leave by the north gate. They shall not go back through the gate by which they came in, but shall go out by the opposite one.

content: 10 And as for the prince, he shall enter with them when they enter and leave when they leave.
content_old: 10 And as for the prince, he shall enter with them when they enter and leave when they leave.

content: 11 On festivals and fixed occasions, the meal offering shall be an ephah for each bull, an ephah for each ram, and as much as he wishes for the lambs, with a hin of oil for every ephah.
content_old: 11 On festivals and fixed occasions, the meal offering shall be an ephah for each bull, an ephah for each ram, and as much as he wishes for the lambs, with a hin of oil for every ephah.

content: 12 The gate that faces east shall also be opened for the prince whenever he offers a freewill offering—be it burnt offering or offering of well-being—freely offered to the LORD, so that he may offer his burnt offering or his offering of well-being just as he does on the sabbath day. Then he shall leave, and the gate shall be closed after he leaves.
content_old: 12 The gate that faces east shall also be opened for the prince whenever he offers a freewill offering—be it burnt offering or offering of well-being—freely offered to the LORD, so that he may offer his burnt offering or his offering of well-being just as he does on the sabbath day. Then he shall leave, and the gate shall be closed after he leaves.

content: 13 Each day you shall offer a lamb of the first year without blemish, as a daily burnt offering to the LORD; you shall offer one every morning.
content_old: 13 Each day you shall offer a lamb of the first year without blemish, as a daily burnt offering to the LORD; you shall offer one every morning.

content: 14 And every morning regularly you shall offer a meal offering with it: a sixth of an ephah, with a third of a hin of oil to moisten the choice flour, as a meal offering to the LORD—a law for all time.
content_old: 14 And every morning regularly you shall offer a meal offering with it: a sixth of an ephah, with a third of a hin of oil to moisten the choice flour, as a meal offering to the LORD—a law for all time.

content: 15 The lamb, the meal offering, and oil shall be presented every morning as a regular burnt offering.
content_old: 15 The lamb, the meal offering, and oil shall be presented every morning as a regular burnt offering.

content: 16 Thus said the Lord GOD: If the prince makes a gift to any of his sons, it shall become the latter’s inheritance; it shall pass on to his sons; it is their holding by inheritance.
content_old: 16 Thus said the Lord GOD: If the prince makes a gift to any of his sons, it shall become the latter’s inheritance; it shall pass on to his sons; it is their holding by inheritance.

content: 17 But if he makes a gift from his inheritance to any of his subjects, it shall only belong to the latter until the year of release. Then it shall revert to the prince; his inheritance must by all means pass on to his sons.
content_old: 17 But if he makes a gift from his inheritance to any of his subjects, it shall only belong to the latter until the year of release. Then it shall revert to the prince; his inheritance must by all means pass on to his sons.

content: 18 But the prince shall not take property away from any of the people and rob them of their holdings. Only out of his own holdings shall he endow his sons, in order that My people may not be dispossessed of their holdings.
content_old: 18 But the prince shall not take property away from any of the people and rob them of their holdings. Only out of his own holdings shall he endow his sons, in order that My people may not be dispossessed of their holdings.

content: 19 Then he led me into the passage at the side of the gate to the sacred chambers of the priests, which face north, and there, at the rear of it, in the west, I saw a space.
content_old: 19 Then he led me into the passage at the side of the gate to the sacred chambers of the priests, which face north, and there, at the rear of it, in the west, I saw a space.

content: 20 He said to me, “This is the place where the priests shall boil the guilt offerings and the sin offerings, and where they shall bake the meal offerings, so as not to take them into the outer court and make the people consecrated.”
content_old: 20 He said to me, “This is the place where the priests shall boil the guilt offerings and the sin offerings, and where they shall bake the meal offerings, so as not to take them into the outer court and make the people consecrated.”

content: 21 Then he led me into the outer court and led me past the four corners of the court; and in each corner of the court there was an enclosure.
content_old: 21 Then he led me into the outer court and led me past the four corners of the court; and in each corner of the court there was an enclosure.

content: 22 These unroofed enclosures, each 40 cubits long and 30 wide, were in the four corners of the court; the four corner enclosures had the same measurements.
content_old: 22 These unroofed enclosures, each 40 cubits long and 30 wide, were in the four corners of the court; the four corner enclosures had the same measurements.

content: 23 On the inside, running round the four of them, there was a row of masonry, equipped with hearths under the rows all around.
content_old: 23 On the inside, running round the four of them, there was a row of masonry, equipped with hearths under the rows all around.

content: 1 He led me back to the entrance of the Temple, and I found that water was issuing from below the platform of the Temple—eastward, since the Temple faced east—but the water was running out at the south of the altar, under the south wall of the Temple.
content_old: 1 He led me back to the entrance of the Temple, and I found that water was issuing from below the platform of the Temple—eastward, since the Temple faced east—but the water was running out at the south of the altar, under the south wall of the Temple.

content: 2 Then he led me out by way of the northern gate and led me around to the outside of the outer gate that faces in the direction of the east; and I found that water was gushing from under the south wall.
content_old: 2 Then he led me out by way of the northern gate and led me around to the outside of the outer gate that faces in the direction of the east; and I found that water was gushing from under the south wall.

content: 3 As the man went on eastward with a measuring line in his hand, he measured off a thousand cubits and led me across the water; the water was ankle deep.
content_old: 3 As the man went on eastward with a measuring line in his hand, he measured off a thousand cubits and led me across the water; the water was ankle deep.

content: 4 Then he measured off another thousand and led me across the water; the water was knee deep. He measured off a further thousand and led me across the water; the water was up to the waist.
content_old: 4 Then he measured off another thousand and led me across the water; the water was knee deep. He measured off a further thousand and led me across the water; the water was up to the waist.

content: 5 When he measured yet another thousand, it was a stream I could not cross; for the water had swollen into a stream that could not be crossed except by swimming.
content_old: 5 When he measured yet another thousand, it was a stream I could not cross; for the water had swollen into a stream that could not be crossed except by swimming.

content: 6 “Do you see, O mortal?” he said to me; and he led me back to the bank of the stream.
content_old: 6 “Do you see, O mortal?” he said to me; and he led me back to the bank of the stream.

content: 7 As I came back, I saw trees in great profusion on both banks of the stream.
content_old: 7 As I came back, I saw trees in great profusion on both banks of the stream.

content: 8 “This water,” he told me, “runs out to the eastern region, and flows into the Arabah; and when it comes into the sea, into the sea of foul waters, the water will become wholesome.
content_old: 8 “This water,” he told me, “runs out to the eastern region, and flows into the Arabah; and when it comes into the sea, into the sea of foul waters, the water will become wholesome.

content: 9 Every living creature that swarms will be able to live wherever this stream goes; the fish will be very abundant once these waters have reached there. It will be wholesome, and everything will live wherever this stream goes.
content_old: 9 Every living creature that swarms will be able to live wherever this stream goes; the fish will be very abundant once these waters have reached there. It will be wholesome, and everything will live wherever this stream goes.

content: 10 Fishermen shall stand beside it all the way from En-gedi to En-eglaim; it shall be a place for drying nets; and the fish will be of various kinds most plentiful, like the fish of the Great Sea.
content_old: 10 Fishermen shall stand beside it all the way from En-gedi to En-eglaim; it shall be a place for drying nets; and the fish will be of various kinds most plentiful, like the fish of the Great Sea.

content: 11 But its swamps and marshes shall not become wholesome; they will serve to supply salt.
content_old: 11 But its swamps and marshes shall not become wholesome; they will serve to supply salt.

content: 12 All kinds of trees for food will grow up on both banks of the stream. Their leaves will not wither nor their fruit fail; they will yield new fruit every month, because the water for them flows from the Temple. Their fruit will serve for food and their leaves for healing.”
content_old: 12 All kinds of trees for food will grow up on both banks of the stream. Their leaves will not wither nor their fruit fail; they will yield new fruit every month, because the water for them flows from the Temple. Their fruit will serve for food and their leaves for healing.”

content: 13 Thus said the Lord GOD: These shall be the boundaries of the land that you shall allot to the twelve tribes of Israel. Joseph shall receive two portions,
content_old: 13 Thus said the Lord GOD: These shall be the boundaries of the land that you shall allot to the twelve tribes of Israel. Joseph shall receive two portions,

content: 14 and you shall share the rest equally. As I swore to give it to your fathers, so shall this land fall to you as your heritage.
content_old: 14 and you shall share the rest equally. As I swore to give it to your fathers, so shall this land fall to you as your heritage.

content: 15 These are the boundaries of the land: As the northern limit: From the Great Sea by way of Hethlon, Lebo-hamath, Zedad,
content_old: 15 These are the boundaries of the land: As the northern limit: From the Great Sea by way of Hethlon, Lebo-hamath, Zedad,

content: 16 Berathah, Sibraim—which lies between the border of Damascus and the border of Hamath—Hazer-hatticon, which is on the border of Hauran.
content_old: 16 Berathah, Sibraim—which lies between the border of Damascus and the border of Hamath—Hazer-hatticon, which is on the border of Hauran.

content: 17 Thus the boundary shall run from the Sea to Hazar-enon, to the north of the territory of Damascus, with the territory of Hamath to the north of it. That shall be the northern limit.
content_old: 17 Thus the boundary shall run from the Sea to Hazar-enon, to the north of the territory of Damascus, with the territory of Hamath to the north of it. That shall be the northern limit.

content: 18 As the eastern limit: A line between Hauran and Damascus, and between Gilead and the land of Israel: with the Jordan as a boundary, you shall measure down to the Eastern Sea. That shall be the eastern limit.
content_old: 18 As the eastern limit: A line between Hauran and Damascus, and between Gilead and the land of Israel: with the Jordan as a boundary, you shall measure down to the Eastern Sea. That shall be the eastern limit.

content: 19 The southern limit shall run: A line from Tamar to the waters of Meriboth-kadesh, along the Wadi of Egypt and the Great Sea. That is the southern limit.
content_old: 19 The southern limit shall run: A line from Tamar to the waters of Meriboth-kadesh, along the Wadi of Egypt and the Great Sea. That is the southern limit.

content: 20 And as the western limit: The Great Sea shall be the boundary up to a point opposite Lebo-hamath. That shall be the western limit.
content_old: 20 And as the western limit: The Great Sea shall be the boundary up to a point opposite Lebo-hamath. That shall be the western limit.

content: 21 This land you shall divide for yourselves among the tribes of Israel.
content_old: 21 This land you shall divide for yourselves among the tribes of Israel.

content: 22 You shall allot it as a heritage for yourselves and for the strangers who reside among you, who have begotten children among you. You shall treat them as Israelite citizens; they shall receive allotments along with you among the tribes of Israel.
content_old: 22 You shall allot it as a heritage for yourselves and for the strangers who reside among you, who have begotten children among you. You shall treat them as Israelite citizens; they shall receive allotments along with you among the tribes of Israel.

content: 1 These are the names of the tribes: At the northern end, along the Hethlon road, from Lebo-hamath to Hazar-enan—which is the border of Damascus, with Hamath to the north—from the eastern border to the Sea: Dan—one tribe.
content_old: 1 These are the names of the tribes: At the northern end, along the Hethlon road, from Lebo-hamath to Hazar-enan—which is the border of Damascus, with Hamath to the north—from the eastern border to the Sea: Dan—one tribe.

content: 2 Adjoining the territory of Dan, from the eastern border to the western border: Asher—one.
content_old: 2 Adjoining the territory of Dan, from the eastern border to the western border: Asher—one.

content: 3 Adjoining the territory of Asher, from the eastern border to the western border: Naphtali—one.
content_old: 3 Adjoining the territory of Asher, from the eastern border to the western border: Naphtali—one.

content: 4 Adjoining the territory of Naphtali, from the eastern border to the western border: Manasseh—one.
content_old: 4 Adjoining the territory of Naphtali, from the eastern border to the western border: Manasseh—one.

content: 5 Adjoining the territory of Manasseh, from the eastern border to the western border: Ephraim—one.
content_old: 5 Adjoining the territory of Manasseh, from the eastern border to the western border: Ephraim—one.

content: 6 Adjoining the territory of Ephraim, from the eastern border to the western border: Reuben—one.
content_old: 6 Adjoining the territory of Ephraim, from the eastern border to the western border: Reuben—one.

content: 7 Adjoining the territory of Reuben, from the eastern border to the western border: Judah—one.
content_old: 7 Adjoining the territory of Reuben, from the eastern border to the western border: Judah—one.

content: 8 Adjoining the territory of Judah, from the eastern border to the western border, shall be the reserve that you set aside: 25,000 cubits in breadth and in length equal to one of the portions from the eastern border to the western border; the Sanctuary shall be in the middle of it.
content_old: 8 Adjoining the territory of Judah, from the eastern border to the western border, shall be the reserve that you set aside: 25,000 cubits in breadth and in length equal to one of the portions from the eastern border to the western border; the Sanctuary shall be in the middle of it.

content: 9 The reserve that you set aside for the LORD shall be 25,000 long and 10,000 wide.
content_old: 9 The reserve that you set aside for the LORD shall be 25,000 long and 10,000 wide.

content: 10 It shall be apportioned to the following: The sacred reserve for the priests shall measure 25,000 cubits on the north, 10,000 on the west, 10,000 on the east, and 25,000 on the south, with the LORD‘s Sanctuary in the middle of it.
content_old: 10 It shall be apportioned to the following: The sacred reserve for the priests shall measure 25,000 cubits on the north, 10,000 on the west, 10,000 on the east, and 25,000 on the south, with the LORD‘s Sanctuary in the middle of it.

content: 11 This consecrated area shall be for the priests of the line of Zadok, who kept My charge and did not go astray, as the Levites did when the people of Israel went astray.
content_old: 11 This consecrated area shall be for the priests of the line of Zadok, who kept My charge and did not go astray, as the Levites did when the people of Israel went astray.

content: 12 It shall be a special reserve for them out of the total reserve from the land, most holy, adjoining the territory of the Levites.
content_old: 12 It shall be a special reserve for them out of the total reserve from the land, most holy, adjoining the territory of the Levites.

content: 13 Alongside the territory of the priests, the Levites shall have an area 25,000 long by 10,000 wide; the total length shall be 25,000 and the breadth 10,000.
content_old: 13 Alongside the territory of the priests, the Levites shall have an area 25,000 long by 10,000 wide; the total length shall be 25,000 and the breadth 10,000.

content: 14 None of it—the choicest of the land—may be sold, exchanged, or transferred; it is sacred to the LORD.
content_old: 14 None of it—the choicest of the land—may be sold, exchanged, or transferred; it is sacred to the LORD.

content: 15 The remaining 5,000 in breadth by 25,000 shall be for common use—serving the city for dwellings and pasture. The city itself shall be in the middle of it;
content_old: 15 The remaining 5,000 in breadth by 25,000 shall be for common use—serving the city for dwellings and pasture. The city itself shall be in the middle of it;

content: 16 and these shall be its measurements: On the north side 4,500 cubits, on the south side 4,500, on the east side 4,500, and on the west side 4,500.
content_old: 16 and these shall be its measurements: On the north side 4,500 cubits, on the south side 4,500, on the east side 4,500, and on the west side 4,500.

content: 17 The pasture shall extend 250 cubits to the north of the city, 250 to the south, 250 to the east, and 250 to the west.
content_old: 17 The pasture shall extend 250 cubits to the north of the city, 250 to the south, 250 to the east, and 250 to the west.

content: 18 As for the remaining 10,000 to the east and 10,000 to the west, adjoining the long side of the sacred reserve, the produce of these areas adjoining the sacred reserve shall serve as food for the workers in the city;
content_old: 18 As for the remaining 10,000 to the east and 10,000 to the west, adjoining the long side of the sacred reserve, the produce of these areas adjoining the sacred reserve shall serve as food for the workers in the city;

content: 19 the workers in the city from all the tribes of Israel shall cultivate it.
content_old: 19 the workers in the city from all the tribes of Israel shall cultivate it.

content: 20 The entire reserve, 25,000 square, you shall set aside as the sacred reserve plus the city property.
content_old: 20 The entire reserve, 25,000 square, you shall set aside as the sacred reserve plus the city property.

content: 21 What remains on either side of the sacred reserve and the city property shall belong to the prince. The prince shall own the land from the border of the 25,000 of the reserve up to the eastern boundary, and from the border of the 25,000 on the west up to the western boundary, corresponding to the portions. The sacred reserve, with the Temple Sanctuary in the middle of it
content_old: 21 What remains on either side of the sacred reserve and the city property shall belong to the prince. The prince shall own the land from the border of the 25,000 of the reserve up to the eastern boundary, and from the border of the 25,000 on the west up to the western boundary, corresponding to the portions. The sacred reserve, with the Temple Sanctuary in the middle of it

content: 22 and the property of the Levites and the city property as well, shall be in the middle of the to the prince; the rest of the land between the territory of Judah and the territory of Benjamin shall belong to the prince.
content_old: 22 and the property of the Levites and the city property as well, shall be in the middle of the to the prince; the rest of the land between the territory of Judah and the territory of Benjamin shall belong to the prince.

content: 23 As for the remaining tribes: From the eastern border to the western border: Benjamin—one.
content_old: 23 As for the remaining tribes: From the eastern border to the western border: Benjamin—one.

content: 24 Adjoining the territory of Benjamin, from the eastern border to the western border: Simeon—one.
content_old: 24 Adjoining the territory of Benjamin, from the eastern border to the western border: Simeon—one.

content: 25 Adjoining the territory of Simeon, from the eastern border to the western border: Issachar—one.
content_old: 25 Adjoining the territory of Simeon, from the eastern border to the western border: Issachar—one.

content: 26 Adjoining the territory of Issachar, from the eastern border to the western border: Zebulun—one.
content_old: 26 Adjoining the territory of Issachar, from the eastern border to the western border: Zebulun—one.

content: 27 Adjoining the territory of Zebulun, from the eastern border to the western border: Gad—one.
content_old: 27 Adjoining the territory of Zebulun, from the eastern border to the western border: Gad—one.

content: 28 The other border of Gad shall be the southern boundary. This boundary shall run from Tamar to the waters of Meribath-kadesh, to the Wadi of Egypt, and to the Great Sea.
content_old: 28 The other border of Gad shall be the southern boundary. This boundary shall run from Tamar to the waters of Meribath-kadesh, to the Wadi of Egypt, and to the Great Sea.

content: 29 That is the land which you shall allot as a heritage to the tribes of Israel, and those are their portions—declares the Lord GOD.
content_old: 29 That is the land which you shall allot as a heritage to the tribes of Israel, and those are their portions—declares the Lord GOD.

content: 30 And these are the exits from the city: On its northern side, measuring 4,500 cubits,
content_old: 30 And these are the exits from the city: On its northern side, measuring 4,500 cubits,

content: 31 the gates of the city shall be—three gates on the north—named for the tribes of Israel: the Reuben Gate: one; the Judah Gate: one; the Levi Gate: one.
content_old: 31 the gates of the city shall be—three gates on the north—named for the tribes of Israel: the Reuben Gate: one; the Judah Gate: one; the Levi Gate: one.

content: 32 On the eastern side, 4,500 cubits—there shall be three gates: the Joseph Gate: one; the Benjamin Gate: one; and the Dan Gate: one.
content_old: 32 On the eastern side, 4,500 cubits—there shall be three gates: the Joseph Gate: one; the Benjamin Gate: one; and the Dan Gate: one.

content: 33 On the southern side, measuring 4,500 cubits, there shall be three gates: the Simeon Gate: one; the Issachar Gate: one; and the Zebulun Gate: one.
content_old: 33 On the southern side, measuring 4,500 cubits, there shall be three gates: the Simeon Gate: one; the Issachar Gate: one; and the Zebulun Gate: one.

content: 34 And on the western side, 4,500 cubits—there shall be three gates: the Gad Gate: one; the Asher Gate: one; the Naphtali Gate: one.
content_old: 34 And on the western side, 4,500 cubits—there shall be three gates: the Gad Gate: one; the Asher Gate: one; the Naphtali Gate: one.
